4BcUzGh6T36bQSAQM5mObA.text: This place is amazing! The food, ambiance, cocktails, service..... A must visit when you are at Aria.

tN5FY9bjxbF4dg32Z7jqDQ.text: We went there for a birthday celebration which was noted on the open table reservation and yet not a single person that we encountered throughout our dinner experience ever wish us a happy birthday. I have been to Catch NYC and i loved it so that's the reason when I saw there was a catch in Vegas I booked immediately. Food was great, love the catch roll, the tartare trio and the octopus. We had to move tables because ours was very wobbly.

fsj_jaLe3USt67KYmVimBA.text: We were told by a friend that we should try this restaurant in the Aria Hotel. From the very second we entered the flower covered entry, we were blown away by our experience at Catch. We made the decision to sit at the bar because we did not have a table reservation. From the very second that we were greeted by Jacob, we managed to turn one drink into several appetizers, dinner and a wonderful evening. I typically eat out 7 days per week because I am single and I travel extensively. Jacob is by far one of the best bartenders I have ever met. His passion for food, drinks and customer engagement were very clear to us. He was also extremely honest about what we should and should not order. We came for one drink.......we stayed 3 hours and ordered half the menu. We will definitely be back and you should try Catch.

-BG5jpphIli73-RcSb_CQw.text: Five star food, so this is probably going to be a good restaurant, I fact, will try it again some day.  Problem is that it seems they didn't hour enough experienced servers for their opening.  Our guy was not on the ball at all and we spent more time waiting on drinks and food than we wanted to.  Once the orders were in, though, it was a non stop small plate avalanche and there was nothing bad.  Highlights were the sushi rolls and ceviche.  We ended up re-upping on yellowtail nigri.    The prices and quality of food meet our expectations but the service fell short.

AlGZGbUKJ6nH8hW-QSVFxg.text: Our waiter was amazing! Every time I'd even glance at him he'd know that I needed something. He gets a 5 star.  Food was delicious -- specifically the Lobster Mac & Cheese... so yum! Just the right amount of creaminess for being a seafood based mac and cheese.   Sushi and raw seafood -- meh! Unique flavor for sure but I could barely finish it. I've had more enjoyable sushi for the same price. The Tartare Trio was particularly underwhelming, the chips we were given with the dip were bulky (and quite gross to me in my opinion). The dip was fine but I wish it went in my sushi or something. My friend liked it.   Dessert -- we only go the "Hit Me" Chocolate cake and it was good! Just the right kind of richness I seek in a chocolate cake.  Drinks were great -- I would avoid the Lush Lemonade unless you're craving diabetes (or just ask for less sweetener maybe). I wasn't having it so my waiter replaced it and I asked for a Grapefruit Spritz instead -- AMAZING! My friend switched her drink for mine because she liked it so much (or maybe she just hated hers so much that the Grapefruit Spritz was a blessing that washed down all the terrible after tastes, who knows)!!!   The music -- SO LOUD!!! I'm assuming they're playing loud music to incentivize people to let loose (party and buy drinks), and I guess it worked(?) Many people who were having a casual dinner night looked so over it.   Obviously the scenic setting and bold marketing is what gets people in here -- I applaud Catch for that. However I think that means that it is time to specialize in a vaster array of sushi. As a high-end restaurant on the Las Vegas strip I expected better specialty sushi options. There is still room to grow!

NW2azWSDO6fv2E7M0Mre2A.text: Don't get caught by Catch. None of the food we ordered was good and all took forever to come out even the desert. The music is so loud you can barely have a conversation let alone order. We didn't order a lot of alcohol and it seemed like the waiter didn't really want to help us after that.

LuYByyBl-1lWqcXpE6ua5w.text: As far as food goes, I would definitely give Catch five stars. However, the service was not good at all, making my overall rating 3 stars. Every time the waiter wanted to take my order he would tap me on the shoulder. Although it was quite loud in the restaurant, I have never experienced a waiter touching me before. Also, we had a large party and instead of serving me my drink from my side, he served it from across the table over 2 people to give it to me and also did the same for my husband when giving him a spoon. When I made reservations they asked if it was for a special occasion and I said that it was for a birthday. The waiter never even asked us about it once, so what was the point of asking us when we made our reservation? Finally, the waiter brought the bill and placed it next to my husband while we were still eating desert and didn't even ask if we wanted anything else. When we were leaving we complained to the manager about the service but he didn't even seem to care.

dbHSuXt4M9ZvwxQ5x4GLcQ.text: My first time in Vegas. My first meal in Vegas. Wow above and beyond any expections I've ever had. First class experience all the way. I was transformed into a whole new world. Who knew seafood could be so fresh tasting in the desert. Highly recommend

C2MgbArxonvhyR6qqx42Ng.text: Absolutely divine!! I was hesitant to go here with the 3.5 star review but we gave it a try and I'm so glad we did! Everything was Sooo delish and our server, Ed was excellent.  Staff was attentive and gave great service.  Truffle sashimi is to die for, in fact we ordered another one. Portions are small and it is pricey but you're in Vegas after all! You didn't come here go eat shitty food!  We ordered: *Truffle sashimi  Catch sashimi *Ceviche  *Branzino *Mushroom spaghetti *Scallop gnocchi  MRC roll *Grilled octopus *Salmon carpaccio HIT me dessert Sorbet  *must try  Bill came out about $570 so $700 with tip

The service was good too, for a crazy busy night. Went during nba summer league so the place was full of basketball stars. It was cool to see the MJ there.

4peULPm1IHSQJKqYvAg8cA.text: Awesome! I took my boyfriend here for a birthday dinner.  The entry way is gorgeous and has opportunity for some awesome photos. I do not like seafood or sushi as a general rule (only eat shrimp), but we got the branzino and a lobster roll.  Both were amazing!!!!  I would easily put the branzino as one of my favorite meals in Vegas!  Drinks were delicious and Marcus was our fantastic server.  My only con is that the seating is a little tight, but we were seated next to a great couple who made the proximity no biggie.  I plan on coming back for sure!!

pT73M9YRaaJrrGSs8YUbzQ.text: This was one of the best dining experiences I have had in a long time. The food was spectacular as was the service. I have eaten here several times and it never fails to exceed expectations. We started with the truffle sashimi, catch roll, hellfire role which were all amazing. We continued with the A5 wagyu, Alaskan king crab and Branzino which again were superb. Naturally it was only fitting to end on a high note with the signature "Hit Me" chocolate cake. We were also surprised at how gracious and humble the chef was to come and see how our meal was. He was such a nice man and we really appreciated his attention to detail and care. Thank you chef Dontea! You truly made our evening memorable.

0DEiB79fl2PpXYhEY-cOJw.text: An amazing spot you won't want to pass up! first and foremost, you don't we able to soak in the Pinterest-esque vibes enough the restaurant is so gorgeous. The food is amazing. Make sure to order the shrimp roll and the lobster Mac. To die for!

JMkTq6tVEKK1hZuR56dwTQ.text: Wow!! Saved the best for last! Crowd was insane even for a 10:15 pm reservation. Lots of lip fillers and silicone LOL but I guess it's to expect as it is the newest and hippest restaurant in the The hotel (Aria.) The food was exceptional! It's a lot of shared apps and even the large entrees are meant to be shared. Started with a different take on Ceviche. Was really fresh but meh.. then came the salmon belly carpaccio and the beet salad which was amazing! Followed by the Best octopus I have ever had over crispy potatoes. We had the "Catch" sushi roll which they run a torch over at your table.. then the Waygu beef and filet skewers that were to die for!  We finished the meal with the Donut Wonder Wheel for dessert. Excellent service and actually very reasonably priced. The quality of the food was excellent from start to finish!

9kxYXF9AaOdSqoqecQp0eg.text: I was very upset by the poor attitude of an Asian waitress. The service was good except for her. The restaurant environment is very nice and romantic

9erHaBZ-XiTeF9v_0c6g1A.text: The food is literally the definition of mediocrity. The drinks are OK. It's funny because the New York and LA locations have incredible food but the service is absolutely appalling and the Las Vegas location has great service but horrifically, underwhelming, food. You just can't win. Either way you either feel terrible for paying so much money for being treated badly at the LA and New York location or you feel bad for spending so much money on mediocre food at the Vegas location. The restaurant itself is beautiful, I'm most likely only going to be returning for events there and not return to dine at the restaurant ever again.

tK5il7ud5QrGMW6Z__xyDQ.text: The fact that this place doesn't have a higher star rating blows my mind. The food was INCREDIBLE and actually reasonably priced for fine dining on the strip. This restaurant is loud because they play on trend music and it is busy so OF COURSE it's going to be loud with everyone talking! I could still talk to my date and hear him just fine. Don't come here if you're expecting a quiet and boring dinner. It is beautiful inside, the One Too Many speciality drink was the best cocktail I've ever had! Our server, Chelsea was amazing and helped me out with great recommendations! She knew her stuff and we had a great experience! The Hit Me chocolate cake was epic!

huTraEJNplOzJkfPCmx_PQ.text: Food was amazing! The entrance to die for. Took so many pictures with family. It was a little dark inside but I got used to it.

i-NiLc50TZCUprQkZlnNig.text: Really wish I had a better time at Catch since I was there to celebrate a birthday. The restaurant is gorgeous, the food is delicious, and the entire staff we had spoken to EXCEPT our waiter, were friendly. My companion caught our waiter roll his eyes at me after I incorrectly named an item on the menu, note our menus were already taken away at this point and I'm pulling this off of memory. I also noted on my reservation that the dinner was for a birthday in case Catch did anything for birthdays. I assumed they didn't since at the end of our dinner, we were just given the tab but I noticed someone else receive a slice of cake for her birthday. I'll give the benefit of the doubt and assume maybe there was lack of communication between the hostess to our waiter or maybe you have to purchase a birthday dessert. I highly doubt it's the latter.  Overall, I would love and wouldn't mind dining there again. I just don't want to be served by our waiter again.

4vUUVQaRlBgi5B4ZfeBlUw.text: Wow, I didn't know what I was going to experience going to Catch LV.  I've always seen this place in IG with all the hyped up photos.  So, yes I went because of the hype, but was surprised with the quality of the food.  At first, i had reservations for only 6.  Of course that changed last minute meeting some friends.  But, the hostess was great about it and was able to accommodate.  Our server Ed was not only helpful and Informative, he basically ordered for us.  Everything he ordered was amazing and showcased the whole menu.  I even had the confidence in ordering the Branzino and the T-bone in which is not cheap.  But, was worth the experience.  Thx Ed for the experience that we won't forget.  This place is great, not so formal and boring.  I'm glad to had dinner that night. Will come back soon!  Sorry food was so amazingly good I didn't even take photos of them.  But, here's a photo of the entrance with my friends!

Dx1qIMfLV8LsmHIhswW10g.text: The whole ambience of the restaurant was beautiful, you could tell they paid close attention to detail. But it  took 45 minutes for me to get a seat after I had a reservation. Then they have a time slot on the table I sat at of only 2 hours and then they collect the table back. It was extended after we were waiting for our food to arrive to our table. The waiter seemed really busy that she couldn't be as attentive as she needed to be. She also didn't listen well, for example  she assumed one of my guest no longer wanted the dish he ordered. So she never put it in for the kitchen to prepare it, in all once the food arrived. It was like a explosion to my taste buds and my guests the food totally made up for the service. I will go back but I pray that the seating time is faster than what I experienced this time.

JJLbdZVeuO7GaDE5HUJ1Pg.text: Great food, Great service and Beautiful Ambiance! Highly recommend it if you like sushi and a good steak. Perfect place for a fun night out.

5rUqBNAbVpFv9Fkv9eA_kw.text: Our dining experience was awesome, great service.  Our server was attentive and provided us great suggestions.  The only complaint I have was how I was greeted (this explains the 4 stars). When I arrived to check in, the girl (Asian) at the front told me I cannot bring in my child under 6. She said I should have seen the policy when I booked through Open Table. She never asked me how old my child was, but assumed he was under 6. I told her my boy is over 6 years old, she looked at me and asked again. I had to reassured her that he is over 6. Then she gave me a stare and told me to wait to be seated. I went back to look at Open Table policy and saw the age policy is 5. I am not sure what was her problem, but I do hope the hostesses do get better trained on how to greet and welcome the restaurant goers. Plus, they should know the policy before enforcing it.

OwyDZCQmEoCHIunXUSgMVg.text: Great ambiance, terrible everything else. None of the seafood dishes were fresh. The lobster Mac & cheese, mussels, & roll with crab all tasted very fishy. I asked for a sweet tea got an unsweetened tea. Asked for utensils multiple times through out the night. Over rated.

6Ln0NoHFHYs683KMVW30cw.text: YUM. I've been to the LA location a few times and the Vegas one is similar, but definitely has that Vegas feel to it. The food and service never disappoint. The sushi and seafood are the best part about this place. Also, the Waygu beef tacos are to die for.

PaFW8TNhgyL_6K7xbv3mBQ.text: Went to Catch for the soft opening and it was a amazing!!! The restaurant was beautiful and food was so yummy. The tuna two way sushi roll was a must have. We sat at the bar and Jake made our night. He was so friendly and the cocktails he made were handcrafted to perfection. I will be back soon :)

-IrDcp6im_bsItuLRtJFsw.text: Crazy loud.  My iPhone Db meter was at 91 all through dinner.  Hard to talk.  Had lobster roll for appitizer and would give it a D grade.  Had scallop gnocchi with no real taste.  Had snapper entre again D.  D for disappointed.  Will continue with my favorite restaurant at Aria Blossom.

43c4MnpGaLNbUk9q5Nozgw.text: If you want cute Instagram photos then this is the place to be. Other than that your honestly paying for the ambience and vibe. The food was nothing outstanding.The crispy shrimp was basically the usual popcorn shrimp they sushi restaurants top their popcorn shrimp rolls with. We had to give back the lobster Mac and cheese we ordered because it was way to salty and the mushroom noodles was just pasta with a cream sauce. The best part of our meal had the be the hit me chocolate dessert. Other than that I feel like this restaurant is nothing but a hype.

I-wY_Q8MVvWgaO9hBGqV2A.text: Service was good to a point. They're not allowed to split the check which makes it hard for groups of individuals who don't know each other to come out even. Food is apparently "family style" which means it's intended to be eaten by the whole table except it's only enough food to be split between 5 people at most. This is probably why they don't split the bill. I was impressed by some of the flavors but none of the execution. Lobster macaroni is flavorful but served with tiny noodles, they need to be larger and thicker. The salmon and crab sushi was all crab and the thinnest slice of fish. The chicken polo dish was all breading. The steak was absolutely phenomenal but it damn well should be at that price. The donut dessert is akin to what you get when you order Chinese delivery. Drinks were drinks, nothing special. Music was loud so don't expect to be able to talk to anyone except the person sitting next to you. There's a unisex bathroom that you'll have to make a quick go at before some drunk girl jiggles the handle and then bangs on the door for you to move it along. Atmosphere is pretentious but we expected that from the new place in town. Honestly I think the only reason this place is so talked about is bc they have a photo opt location as you walk into the place. Influencers aplenty have walked this same hall, enticing us to come hither and be seen, yeah f that lame bs. Valet is $30 to park and that doesn't include tip for the actual valet guys so keep that in mind. No discounts for locals or parking validation after you just spent $750 at a dinner you didn't particularly enjoy. Anyways, good luck, hopefully you'll enjoy yourself more than I.

_6ZxX3lSnr9qHz5KHQ8FoQ.text: Catch is the seafood restaurant in Aria. It was just ok for a high end seafood place. Very pricey, tables are tight (very close together) and portions are small. Everything pretty much has Asian flavors which were interesting. I couldn't find an app I liked since I don't care for sushi so had the Brussel sprouts side as an app. They were very good with a miso vinegarette sauce and an adequate portion. My husband had a spicy tuna roll which was very fresh. For dinner I had the bronzino served over rice. The bronzino was about 1/4 inch thick and about 6 inches long.  It was tasty but overpriced. My husbands red snapper was over cooked. Service was good - very attentive but when we drop $200 for dinner we expect a meal we are impressed with and an atmosphere to remember. Also, Catch is not owned by Aria so we wanted to apply casino comp and they gave us a hard time. No one tells you many of the restaurants in Aria are separate despite the fact they can charge to your room.

d6haULqYPpfN3-avltPhYg.text: I give Catch 1 star. We sat down at at the bar, waited 15 minuets, no one serviced us. Then sat down for dinner, again 15 minuets with no service. Then went to the sushi bar, where we were told we had to check into the front desk before sitting. We left went to Jean Georges Steakhouse. Overall horrible experience, and disorganized staff, we will never return.

tt3tVAy35XOzisVilfKsag.text: Absolutely amazing dining experience. I loved the whole ambiance of Catch, it's such a beautiful restaurant from the outside flower display to the sleek layout inside. the hospitality and servers were also welcoming. I ordered the one too many cocktail, which was perfectly balanced. The sushi was delicious, my favorite roll was the hellfire roll, probably the best sushi I've ever had. The wagyu tacos were amazing! The hit me cake was the perfect dessert to end the meal, it was rich and sweet. All in all, everything I had was incredible. I can't wait to come back!

gDs7_WDomxewHSVhJaeV0A.text: The food and the service was amazing! A beautiful location and friendly staff! Will definitely be checking out the New York location when I get home :)

ixPq3rWmpGJHRTSSk-MH0w.text: Made our reservation two days ago. We arrive,  it's pretty busy but the host tells us that our table is just about ready. 35 minutes later, we're still not seated - never again.

cpvFL9a8fEgER2Re-JdKvw.text: Forty-five minute wait time WITH a reservation, and the hostess/server didn't say a word about it when we finally did get sat... never again. Management needs to get a new host staff- this is a very nice, newer restaurant in Vegas, but it only has 3.5 stars. Almost all the negative reviews mention problems with reservations/wait times, and from when I've seen, restaurants in Vegas don't usually make it with these kind of reviews. Your employees are ruining the restaurant's reputation, and will eventually cause it to fail.

m_Gs3ExRO6F9gdgQ8B5DRQ.text: Marcus was amazing! We had a terrific dinner and great drinks! The service and quality of food was top notch!

9sOHw9G3a-Z86n8CSJ8XPQ.text: If it was possible to give a -10 review I would. Story time: My father had reservations on January 23 for a party of 4. Before his party arrived he ordered a glass of wine in the casino. The host (who had been employed three months earlier according to later knowledge) asked him to leave his wine before coming into the restaurant. My father decided to leave it. He then overheard the host calling over the manager (I wish I could appropriately describe him, all my father said that he was short in stature) and talking about him. The manager then decided to kick my father out of the restaurant (because of his one glass of wine?). Without asking what had happened, no hospitality WHATSOEVER, the manager turned away a customer that would have spent $$$$$$$ at his location. So sad, because we were looking forward to this location. Whatever you do avoid this place until they find better management. Joke of a place, especially in the Aria.

qOxAPHNTf0jzUo-BVF8GKg.text: I was in Vegas over March Madness weekend, and wanted to have a nice, but casual dinner. After reading the reviews on here, I was hesitant at first, but my friend who was going to dinner with me wanted to try it, so I made the reservation for a 6:45pm dinner on a Saturday night.  The first thing you notice when going in is the amazingly beautiful walkway. I'm not one for social media posts, but it definitely was ig/snap worthy. We arrived about 45 minutes early hoping to get seated early cause we were really hungry. The hostess said they couldn't seat us just yet, but they would get us in as soon as they could.  My friend and I sat at the bar and the bartender was pleasant enough. We ordered two shots of 1942 and two soda waters. The 1942 at $40 each was pretty reasonable for Vegas pricing, but we were charged soda water, from the gun, $4.50 each. I couldn't believe it. We weren't there for long, maybe 10 minutes, until we were seated at our table. You'd think we could just carry over our bar tab to our dinner tab, but we had to close out.   So far the experience was unpleasant, but we came for the food and not the service, and almost all the food we ordered was amazing!  First came the truffle sashimi. The tuna was better than the yellowtail, but the caviar mixed with the ponzu all came together really well. Next came the Catch style sashimi, which really wasn't sashimi, but slightly seared thin slices of salmon. My friend and I both agreed that if the salmon had been sliced a little thicker, it would have been a great dish. The sesame seeds made it an overall win for me though.  For hot dishes, we had the crispy shrimp, lobster mac and cheese, and the king crab tempura. The crispy shrimp was my favorite overall dish from a bang for buck perspective. The portion size was great, more than enough for two people, and the cooked to perfection. The lobster mac was the 2nd best on the bang for buck, and had good flavor as wellZ Those two dishes alone, along with the earlier orders, put us in the right place. But we decided to go over the top and be stuffed so we ordered the king crab tempura. I wanted to compare it to Nobu's version, which I've had more times than I can count, and even the worst version I've had at Nobu was better than this one. It was such a hit and miss dish. The smaller pieces had great texture and flavor. The larger pieces had an overwhelming crab taste where to me it tasted like it was two day old crab. At the price point, it should be more consistent.   For dessert, we shared the sticky coconut cake, which was perfect for two people. The coconut sorbet was the perfect refreshing end to an overall good meal.   The dinner service was great at first, but as dinner progressed, it dropped. I can see how anyone who would come in for an 8pm reservation would hate the service.  Our dinner portion of the bill came out to less than $200 before tip, which was steal for what you'd expect out of Vegas. We were more than stuffed, and didn't skimped on out anything we wanted. Because of that, I'd definitely come again, but only for a dinner start time no later than 7pm, and ordering the same dishes, except for the king crab tempura.

-mznHDcFp8PEiJobgjP4CQ.text: I've been looking forward to coming here since the opening! I was staying at the Aria back in May and had seen sneak peeks of the restaurant when it was going under renovation.  Made reservations about 3 weeks ago which I highly highly recommend you doing if you want to come here.   We came on a Tuesday night and it was packed. We were told to wait at the bar and a hostess would come get us. I admit was a bit of a wait but we managed to get seats at the bar and got drinks.   Service: was great! We were checked in regularly by multiple people. Servers were very knowledgeable about the food and drinks.   Food was so delicious. We got a mix of things to share. They were almost tapa style so think small plates.  The lobster mashed potatoes were probably our favorite. Chunks of lobster and the potatoes were so creamy and rich in flavor. It was a good kind of rich flavor. We also had the scallops and cauliflower which was perfectly cooked.   Crispy chicken bao buns were really good. The waygu tacos were legit. although they packed a tiny taco w the meat that it sort of fell apart by the time I picked it up.   We also got the catch roll with crab and salmon which they lit up. That was pretty cool.    I'd honestly recommend this place! It's definitely very different in terms of ambience and decor with other places.  The entrance is beautiful. I could totally see them changing it up throughout the seasons. Who knew artificial flowers and Xmas lights can completely change the vibes.   Great time and looking forward to coming back!

9M_iIfGDfup3nsMLpQlFaA.text: Went to catch with a large group and everything was fabulous. From the service, to the drinks, to the food it was a great experience. qFiKbYIROwGazp6F7tbS0A.text: AMBIANCE. This place has a very enchanting feeling. It's full of flowers everywhere when you walk in to their entrance. Beautiful backdrop to take photos everywhere.   FOOD. Food is amazing. We ordered a lot from their sushi to their cooked foods. My husband who does not like sushi eventually tried their ceviche and spicy tuna and fell in love. We also had the #hitme and their donut Ferris wheel dessert.   SERVICE. Service is 5 stars. I forgot our servers name but he was the big Asian guy. Kudos!

WI2UsP71xilBKTE7Uo-Gvg.text: This restaurant I would highly suggest if you are looking for amazing atmosphere. It is def instagram worthy and absolutely stunning when you walk in. The inside of the restaurant is quite large, larger than I would have expected. It is great for big groups. We had 10 and we were sat at a round table with a lazy susan in the middle so we could spin around our dishes and all get a bite! The inside is dimly lit and a louder more fun of an atmosphere.   The food was okay. I wouldn't say it was the best I've had, but I wouldn't say it wasn't good either. We had a chefs taster and it was fairly decent. Portions were okay as well. The cocktails were really great though, so I would suggest visiting Catch for a drink and to enjoy the ambiance. Our server was very nice and I liked that all the people who worked inside Catch worked together to help the tables and guests.   Overall, I had a very fun night out with friends and enjoyed myself here!

T7QXYjUVyo8glaYRxOxsgg.text: I honestly had great dining experiences! Without knowing or hearing of any hype (out of town), I just went because it was in my hotel. It is pricey but my experience was worth it to me.   First Visit: - Herb Roasted Branzino - Spicy Corn - Catch Ceviche  - Chicken Skewers (on the House, but could do without) - Catch Roll (could do without)  Second Visit: - Oven Roasted whole Branzino - Uni  - Spicy Corn - Truffle fries   They know what they're doing!

6Re_5lIaa67PTTRNkvTnog.text: I've now been to this location twice, and the only reason I am giving it two stars is because both times the food was decent.   My first issue: there is no where to sit and wait while you wait for your table. The first visit I made a reservation and the two of us were seated without issue. However, on my recent visit we made a reservation and then waited a subsequent HOUR to be seated. So my question is, what is the point of a reservation then?   And when we are seated, our table was too small for our party even though they insisted we could fit. We did fit, but we constantly didn't have room for the shared plates we ordered and we had to store drinks and food on the shelf behind the booth which is incredibly tacky. Overall the service was subpar.   I won't be returning here. Yuma at the cosmopolitan has better food and better service. I suggest taking your Instagram pictures at the garden tunnel in front of catch, then walk over to Yuma instead.

35nVl1YNkY-UxqA41XWzyw.text: Overpriced food. Dishes were small for the price paid. Lobster Mac and cheese was very salty. Drinks were tasty and cute looking. Excellent ambiance.

GIRGD0pLL4TjlxD21i4VMw.text: First off I don't understand how this place could have 3.5 stars on yelp it truly is 5 star worthy.   This place is located immediately off the lobby area inside Aria.   Initially you're greeted by the floral pergola! It's a dream to walk down this amazing creation and is truly picture worthy. Arrive a few minutes before your reservation to snap a few photos.   The dining area isn't as beautiful as the entrance and could use revamping.  Service is impeccable. Although we had multiple people bringing out our dishes I want to give a special online shout to Francis who was so helpful in assisting us with what we should order and was overall friendly.   Food that stood out: the Waguy beef that you cook on a hot rock., O-M-G melts in your mouth! Worth every penny! So flavorful. The scallop truffle gnocchi had incredible flavor I will dream of it fir a few nights to come, the king crab hand roll- DELISH, and the rock shrimp!   Will definitely come back to this place in Vegas!! Come see it for yourself

chedpjzFVWgYNW0Y4SedPA.text: My wife had been to Catch in Los Angeles and said it was great so this was definitely on the list for our trip.  We also wanted to stop by because our favorite bartender at Hyde, Kat is working her now.    The entry is like no other in Las Vegas.  It really is a dramatic scene walking in.  We found Kat over in the well area and said hello and also met Jake who was great.  They both found a spot for us at the bar and we took up residence for the next 45 minutes.  My wife ordered the One Too Many and then the East-Coast Kali.  Both were great.  I went with wine which is my norm.    This was a fun time and we would definitely return.

9bpjXzCw-CRZI33y54vdpQ.text: As much as I was excited to go to this location it was disappointing, from the long wait and the waitress that was rushing me and she was super grumpy and rude! Ts2yAbVTgbk5gXdCDan-OA.text: Vegas on a 4th of July weekend was pretty packed so we were so lucky that we got a last minute reservation at 8pm on a Saturday. Thank goodness because I have been wanting to try this place.   The decor when you walk in is so cute with a lot of floral. Once we walked all the way in, the hostess greeted us and took us to our table about 5 minutes later. The restaurant and bar was pretty packed as expected for a Saturday night in Vegas.   Once we sat down our waiter greeted us and explained the menu a bit with us. Once we were ready we ended up ordering things to share:  Brussel sprouts - this was crispy, crunchy and soft all at the same time. The only thing I would say is it was a little too salty for me.  Toro sashimi - this was so good!! Just as toro should be, it was soft and almost melts in your mouth. Definitely a fresh taste.   Toro roll - the toro was good both as a sashimi and the roll. The roll just gives it more texture. So delicious.   Grilled spanish octopus - this came on top of some potatoes and the octopus was so tender and the flavor was on point.   The food overall was great and so was the service. Our waiter was awesome and everyone else that came to help him was good. I would definitely come back here again. The seafood is fresh, the service is great and the atmosphere is fun. Next time I'll come back w/my girlfriends.

8rHXYc_3RZp6s96-tVmXvw.text: The entrance is beautiful but the food was overpriced. Hubby was disappointed when his order arrived. Small pieces of sushi but double the price compare to the other sushi place. If you want to satisfy your hunger go somewhere else.

ly3rlEXSeLuCFqTH6PHoYQ.text: Surprisingly, i enjoyed our dishes very much and not just a beautiful place to dine at after all. Some of the reviews about this place how the service sux and service being pretentious I did not EXPERIENCE. Shino our server was excellent. Delicately flavoring our sashimi and salmon belly taking it to another level was something i did not expect from this place which blew me away. Their charred octopus was top 3 best i have ever had. Sake selection was also exquisite. Price they can most certainly work on but if you keep putting out dishes like these, people will have no issue paying for great food.

F4zReb_HmI9SQVwcLspTtw.text: Came in for dinner a few nights ago and was a little late for my reservation. The hostess was more than accommodating and was able to seat my party within a couple of minutes, considering how busy it was I appreciated this very much!   The service was fast and professional whether it was my server giving recommendations, the bus boys removing dishes from the table, water refills, the staff was very on top of it!  The food was delicious we ordered the grilled octopus which exceeded all my expectation the potatoes were perfect as was the octopus! The lobster Mac and nice a creamy, the macaroni was al dente and the chucks of lobster was really good as most lobster macs don't provide that much lobster! The sushi was lite, fresh, and very good. We skipped dessert because we had plans elsewhere but seeing it be severed to the tables around us looked delicious. I can't wait to be back!

zVmpuMAof6of_VP_LHK6cw.text: Great place but be ready to spend some $$$$ We had the sashimi tartar, lobster roll and filet. OMG all were amazing. Am I full no, but great food!!  We also had some great drinks-East Coast Kali is the best if u like spicy! I hate sweet drinks and this was amazing, plus if u start at the bar the great bartenders will let I try drinks!  Worth going buy don't plan to be stuffed!!

WQlBSwjUTemVyP8nUqeoqg.text: I was really disappointed in this place. I've been wanting to go there for long time but it wasn't as I expected at all.  1) We made a reservation a week ahead for my birthday. The hostess wasn't friendly and they had us wait for a good 30 minutes before we get to our table.   2) The tables are so close to each other to the point I can hear the people's conversation. It was too loud that we had to scream to hear each other (NO PRIVACY AT ALL)  3) We ordered bunch of sushi and they never brought us soy, chopsticks or even fresh plates.  4) The crispy shrimp is so average. The only thing I like was the Tuna Nigiri.  5) The pricing is overrated for the quality of food you get.  I was definitely looking for a better experience but unfortunately I was so disappointed with the service and the food.

xoI4ALL_QX3nysDp7xTjBw.text: Delicious food. Small portions. Instagram worthy walkway.   But what really irks me is how hard it is to make a reservation here and then to be seated in a tiny 2 person table where your elbows are almost touching your neighbor. We could literally hear each other's conversations. There's no way to have a proper conversation without having your neighbors hear everything that you're saying.   So much for fine dining.

qXYqw3pp_HD60pudlQ2Msg.text: Beautiful restaurant with great food! I've tried Catch several times and have always had a great experience but the filet, crispy shrimp and zucchini noodles are definitely the best options on the menu. The filet is the best steak I've had and I highly recommend it to everyone!

lLEIN478c-x6tDa54C_zkw.text: this is one of my favorite restaurants in new york, and was pleasantly pleased with the los angeles location two nights earlier, so i had to try out vegas.  as usual, the food was amazing.   however, i can't say the same for the service.  i'm a stickler for good service because i tip fairly, and i really left this place feeling like i tipped  my server simply for taking my order.  he was uniformed about the menu, unenthusiastic and just overall made the experience underwhelming.  we didn't even order dessert or a second round because the hot food paired with the cold service left us with a bad taste.

my0jceFYggdZCk3_aJd_BA.text: Aria's trendiest restaurant, Catch is a place to see and be seen! huo2QZulU1zAYTBHFwslQA.text: Great place to take a date or go with a group of friends.  Catch has a very beautiful entry way and a very fun ambiance. XGX1KXJiG3L8IyB_530Wlw.text: Showed up after a Knights game on a Monday. asked the hostess if it was open seating in the bar and was told yes. My girlfriend and myself proceeded to sit down at a six top and were asked to leave bc there was a larger party already there that "would spend more $$." 6L-GPzfR1dbWKMtwcSw4DA.text: I think the hype over this place is because of how aesthetically nice it is. The entrance is beautiful it's like a long walkway with flowers which is what makes it unique. I love that they play good music it makes the ambiance great. The only reason I'm taking a star away was because the food didn't blow me away for what it's worth. Maybe I'll give it another shot in the future. Staff here was amazing our servers were so accommodating and friendly I couldn't have been happier with the service.

NGK9U1Y6k3y__TIPyrkPEw.text: Had the best dining experience I ever had at Catch Las Vegas. The restaurant is stunning. We walked in it's what I picture the gates of heaven looking like. We checked in the hostesses were lovely. The restaurant was bumping so we grabbed a drink at the bar while we waited for our table. I got the Detox Retox it was served in a little juice bottle which I thought was super cute. The hostess grabs us from the bar and we get seated. Then we get sent an Angel, Joesph N, he is probably the most beautiful man I have ever seen. He was tall with a scruffy beard and he had us cracking up from the second we sat down. We stared with the oyster shooters, the oysters tasted so fresh like the just came out of the Pacific Ocean.  Joesph then placed a wagon wheel looking thing on the table. I was like wtf we didn't order a wagon wheel. Then he put our next course on the Truffle Sashimi. What a delicacy! Truffles, caviar with a little bit of spice. Incredible.   We got a hell fire sushi roll. They even took a blow torch out to finish it off. What a unique touch. It was delicious and spicy   Followed by Cauliflower which I was blown away by. It tasted like a buffalo wing but they were VEGAN!!! Probably the first vegan dish that I could not get enough of.    Then we got a steak which was perfectly cooked and some lobster Mac and Cheese. Holy moly perfect combo.  To finish it off Joesph recommended the hit me dessert. I looked like a chocolate cake but he gave me a spoon and told me to hit it and I did. Out splashes our the most delicious vanilla creme all over the plate and the cake. It was so delicious I wanted to lick the plate  and Joesph clean .  Joesph was so graceful and engaging. He really Wow'd my guests and I.  Defiantly coming back

A23EhGSl5X_lejM1kgQK_A.text: Food is good, wait staff great, ambience is good, beautiful restaurant. Expect small portions. I requested a booth but didn't get one. Make reservations. Make sure to call if running late. Bar in the front while you wait for your table.

ZlFPlUNZpCKfJ7dlUEwvTQ.text: Beautiful venue. The entry way is gorgeous and definitely reason to stay after and take some great photos. We did have to wait for a while to be seated even though we had reservations. Came there for my birthday with 5 other girlfriends. The food and service was overall very good. YA7lW5w77vq776DDHd4pqQ.text: Serious issues with service from the door to the kitchen. We arrived 7 minutes before our reservation and we're greeted with a heavy sigh, "you are early for your reservation so please wait in the bar area." The host staff looked stressed; heads down, shuffling chits around, two runners walking around like zombies with eyes that scream "I'm dead inside." Not a way to make anyone feel welcome. There were droves of people standing around hoping that their table would be ready next. I would have appreciated a real conversation to let me know they were behind on their wait. They missed the mark with authenticity and genuine hospitality. Bummer. We were seated around 20min after our reservation, fine.  We were lead to our table which was a tiny two top squished in between two others on a banquette. I wasn't too worried about it, except that my chair in the isle could touch the chair of the person seated at the table behind me. The service staff had serious trouble reaching us without being in the way of each other. Basically, the same hectic "chicken with head cut off" vibe in the dining room. We got the standard spiel about food coming out as it's ready & a list of our servers favorites. This is lazy service, all the servers repeating the same blah blah blah all around me. Everyone loves the Brussels sprouts for some reason. Again, no authenticity. Very junior servers with little experience. When I ordered a bottle of wine, my server asked me to open the list to show him the wine because he needed the bin number to ring it in. Uh, can you do that in the side station on your own time? I didn't order some crazy thing I can't pronounce. Dr. Loosen Riesling, anyone who works with wine should know this producer.  The staff was all going thru the motions with noticable  pain. It seemed as though the host staff sat the turn all at once and everyone was rushing to catch up. The managers gave no eye contact, and in fact were texting in the middle of the dining room. One suit moved like a bull in a China shop, wrestling chairs around without apology.  I could not hear my guest, she could not hear the waiter. In fact all we could hear was the guy sitting next to us talking about his wife being the guard to Hades.  The food was comparable to the quality of any chain restaurant. Very unimaginative, in my mind I could hear the chef menu planning meeting going like this; "whatever, throw lobster and truffle oil on it & they'll eat it up." Sad, boring, one note, simple minded, disjointed... While clearing our dishes, I mentioned that we didn't care for the last plate. We each ate one bite & left it sit. Our server panicked and with passive aggression immediately dropped the check with no follow up questions; no offer of additional drinks, coffee, dessert. I guess we are done. Bye.  I hope that the management gets inspired to lead their team with grace in a beautiful space with so much potential. And that it becomes a great place to work and a fun place to dine. I understand that a busy restaurant in Vegas is hard to manage, but when the guest feels like an inconvenience, we all lose.

yDh1r1y60bbOdxlMGoICAw.text: The only reason why I'm giving this restaurant two stars is because our waiter was lovely and the manager handled our complaint very well on her end. The service was great but the hostess staff was terrible.  We had a reservation for 8:15pm and didn't get seated until 9:00pm. The hostess with the dark hair and tattooed arm was extremely rude and didn't accommodate us. We asked her when we would be seated after waiting for 20 minutes. She told us that she couldn't just kick people out if they're still eating, which I understand, but she said it with an attitude. After waiting for 45 minutes, we were finally seated. However, as we were walking back, we noticed that there were so many empty and open tables. We didn't understand why so many people were waiting if they had so many tables available.   I also waited a very long time for a drink at the bar in the dining area and there were only two other people there. I was getting ready to leave and walk back to the table, but the bartender finally came back and said that he didn't have everything stocked at the bar.   Now, for the food, it wasn't good. We ordered the mushroom spaghetti, lobster mac and cheese, new york strip steak, and the herb roasted branzino. We spent about $300 and the serving sizes didn't justify the price. I could've eaten a ribeye at Craftsteak or Mastros for about $58, while this place charged me $79 for a 16oz new york strip steak. In addition, I could've eaten a deliciously-seasoned whole branzino at Momofuku for $70, versus the filet of fish branzino for $48. The pasta for the mushroom spaghetti was overcooked. The lobster mac and cheese was missing the main ingredients...cheese and lobster. They basically turned the lobster into breadcrumbs and just sprinkled it over the macaroni.   Overall, the only good that came out of this experience were the pictures that were taken in the entryway. We definitely will not be coming back to Catch. It's not worth it.

0MrwTyTl3ObLCRwfaR5QxA.text: My husband and I choose this restaurant for our date night. I LOVED the ambiance (it was a bit loud - but I liked the music and the vibe). The food was good. The steak was very tender and the corn was awesome. The service was amazing... David and Nina made the experience much more pleasant. They were awesome! David was very attentive, knowledgeable about the menu and had a friendly personality.  The only negative comment is that the tables are WAY too close together. You can hear each others conversations, and it is a bit awkward trying to slide in between tables to sit down.  Overall, great experience!

LJdRLZq_IdVFbZtpKhbLaw.text: The food was great and the service was even better. Ask for Edward T if you ever come here!! Best server ever! I came here for my birthday and he took such good care of us.

qd_-NXwp1IjTnOpXSmWWOA.text: Great ambience, food was delicious and the service was incredible!!! My favorite  part was the dessert, the sticky coconut cake. Would def. come back.

jxmqa5hryCouPVJdw7usPQ.text: So, I was definitely interested to come to this place and see how the service was based on some of the initial reviews.   I'll preface this by saying I'm a Las Vegas local and I go to a decent amount of nice restaurants on and off the strip. I also come from a service background so I am picky-ish about service but I also understand what makes things go upside down.   What I can say is we had the best experience and everyone we came into contact with was fantastic, super friendly, and knowledgeable. The ambiance is great which I'm sure everyone knows by now. It wasn't too loud and the music was fun and upbeat. We were able to have a conversation and hear our waiter and bartender. The hostess was really friendly. We were 10 minutes late for our reservation which was at 7:45p and they said it wasn't a problem at all and they hold it for 15 minutes anyway. They had valet blocked off and said it was full so we had to drive around to self parking. The hostess escorted us to the bar to have a drink while our table was being set. I think this concept gets lost on a lot of people leaving these reviews. It's basically part of the dinner process and adds to the experience. You don't wait awkwardly in the hallways. If you do, that's your own silly fault. We waited about 10 minutes so we grabbed champagne from the bar, bartender was great, and took some photos. Obviously. You must get the obligatory Catch photos.   The waiter was really nice. He came over and explained the menu. I have been to Catch in LA so I was familiar but my boyfriend wasn't so the waiter went through the menu.   He ordered wine, I got the spicy margarita-ish cocktail. Both were great. The sugar rim on the cocktail was a bit much for me and made the whole glass kinda sticky so I just got a new glass. Quick and easy.   Truffle sashimi is definitely the best thing on the menu. Must try. We also ordered the Catch ceviche. Really good. The lobster in the dish was great. Lobster mashed potatoes were my second favorite thing. It's like lobster bisque but in mashed potato form. It's soooo good. We also had the toro sashimi. It's pricy anywhere you go. But let me tell you, that $9 bite is so worth it. Buttery and melts in your mouth. I kept the truffle sauce from the sashimi dish and dipped in that. Probably the best decision I've ever made. We also got the New York strip which they sliced for us. Really nice. Highly recommend this process. We had the yellowtail avocado cut roll as well and it was probably the best basic roll I've ever had. I dont know what they're doing to it but it was so good. I kind of judge restaurants off of how good their most basic food item is and this did not disappoint at all.   After our initial course the manager came over and asked if he could move us to a booth. They had a large party coming in and we were basically sitting between two large empty tables. I totally get it. The booth was an upgrade anyways since the tables are smaller. We gladly got up and they moved us over quickly. He brought us this amazing desert for the move. I'll take it! It had chocolate. Yes. Cake. Yes. Ice cream. Yes. Caramel. Yes. And it was Instagram worthy with the hammer/pouring process. Yes. The other waiter that brought it over advised to get the camera rolling. Lol. Love it.   Overall really great experience. Every restaurant has their funky opening and growing pains. I never try restaurants in the first month. So if you had a bad experience here, I encourage you to try it again.

S4lvW3T5tTYhQZ3QquD0dw.text: Beautiful ambiance. The walk way to enter is picture perfect, IG lovers check it out. Food was ok..... sashimi was excellent. The rest of the food we ordered reminded me of a very popular Asian fusion chain restaurant. Service was fine. Cocktails were good.

0skbNERNrYdsk_kB3e2wwQ.text: This concept is completing missing non millennial audiences. By promising items on the menu as vegan however using the safe oils and pans as meet items, many True vegans will be disappointed. Further more for a Sea Food resturant cross contamination seems rampant due to this same problem. Negligence to use different oils for certain dishes will result in a considerable loss of revenue and reputation.   Catch has potential but obvious shortcomings will always prevent this place from being more than  Update: Management was understanding about our complaints, and they made it up to us stating the blame of the holiday pressure

g9HNKO8pzch2SOBDFBGI-A.text: Catch is a feast for the eyes, but this hip joint is a whole lot of hype. While the fusion menu designed for sharing seemed interesting, the flavours were lacking. Mahi mahi tacos tasted like they were drowning in mayonnaise. Blech! Crispy shrimp, ceviche and chicken Bao buns were just ok.  Scallop gnocchi was probably the standout of our meal, but still, I wouldn't write home about it. In terms of ambiance, the room is too loud. And gets louder as the night goes on - while we were there music increased in volume twice. This combined with the general room noise made it nearly impossible to carry on a conversation with our table mates. Here's the catch on catch - the value for the dollar on this high-flying dining experience does not measure up.

ae1sIjCrKmyC8HsD-BwaCw.text: This place is definitely pricey but I think it's worth it. The food is amazing! and the Lobster mashed potatoes were amazing as well as my steak. Great place to take someone on a date or have a birthday dinner. They have some good spots before you walk in to take pictures while your waiting to be seated as well.

fkKW6n4EjV_hZrls4g2xlQ.text: Great shareable plates. Some of the food was the best I have ever had. Fortunately I went with a big enough party where we were able to order a lot of different items. I ordered the lobster rolls which as a born and raised New Englander were not great but like I said everything else more than made up for it

0YC4DOM3Wg_WTRSoxToKYw.text: Great food, service and atmosphere. Would've appreciated if they brought my birthday candle BEFORE the check as my husband was already running outside to find a cupcake or similar somewhere else. They knew it was my brithday.

J661KZ2yIIfuCKdCj3T4Kw.text: Absolutely beautiful and amazing hot spot! The food is SOO good. We did several small plates to share. The Mahi Wonton tacos were so good, I could have eaten 20 of them. We had the shrimp gnocchi next and it was delicious, rich and stick to your ribs kind of food. Then we had the chicken lettuce cups. Best I've ever had. For dessert we had the 'hit me' chocolate cake. It's delicious and comes with a surprise when you hit it. We ate at the bar. It has TVs in the mirrors which is helpful for nights when big games are on. They also have a sushi bar to sit at further back in the restaurant. I suggest a reservation if you want a table. The place was packed and the vibe was cool. Dress nice..you know, this place is hot (not temperature wise) and it's fun to dress up at times.

c3mOMLwkxKyjYiwkrQsM_Q.text: It was my first time at CATCH and I must say I was delightfully surprised at how good the food was. We got the Crispy Cauliflower to start, Baby Gem Caesar Salad, Herb Roasted Branzino, NY Strip, and the Mushroom Spaghetti. Everything was so flavorful. The baby gem Caesar salad is probably the best Caesar salad I've ever had. The branzino was good, the steak was cooked perfectly, but the spaghetti takes the cake!! We ordered a second one because it was so good!   All the drinks on their cocktail list looked yummy. I ordered the East Coast Kali. The waitress described it as a spicy margarita with passion fruit. And spicy it was! If you like spicy, it's a real kicker, but the sugar on the rim really balanced the spice.   Overall, I had an amazing experience at CATCH. The walkway was absolutely beautiful. But there was one downside. It was extremely loud. It would've been nice to have the music softer, and not like the club. I almost asked for earplugs.

C2dlWD2YOR4zvycGcwAeNg.text: Beautiful entryway! Very nice staff, great place to watch a game at the bar and eat amazing tasting food. I went for an event to ate off a fixed menu and was still impressed.

n83RK8oXySduKf4T0vNXfQ.text: Delish all around. Decor is Instagram worthy. If seafood is your thing, the menu lends a wide variety of flavors and styles. They do have a steak option and chicken meatballs, as well as vegetarian plates. Sashimi, sushi, cooked fish and shellfish, salads and appetizers, it's a lovely spot.  While a little pricey, you'd expect that with the style of food and location, it's a good place for birthdays or business dinners.

yUx_92sDVgZxH46ZDc1Oxw.text: Not at all good, the lobster was extremely dry. Sushi had this very bitter taste. Plus the service was extremely poor it's a beautiful place but definitely never coming back.

bRtPypewRXBTcLSHbgyYGA.text: "CATCH" me if you can! The most beautiful restaurant in all of Vegas! And, quite possibly the world!   This truly is a gorgeous restaurant! There are many ways to take pictures, at least 3 different backgrounds. I could give 10 stars for the atmosphere alone but that is not the way it works. lol   We came exactly at 6:15 of our reservation. And we were quickly directed to the bar. Neither one of us wanted drinks so this was discouraging. After about 10 minutes, we were really hungry, we asked to be seated which we were. It would've been nice if we would've been seated right away though. The hostesses could be more pleasant. But, once inside, the waiters and busboys were super friendly & nice. This place looks hip & modern but the music is anything but. lol It goes from 80s, to 70s & then all of a sudden it's Oldies & Motown which we did not like at all.   As for the food, there were some dishes that we enjoyed, some were ok & one that we hated. The shrimp cocktail & lobster was good. Their cocktail sauce is excellent but the aioli has curry in it & is the worst thing I put in my mouth for a long time. There was also the scallop gnocchi which was awful. Very oniony and fishy with no scallops to be found. They took this of the check.   But, we also ordered a vegan "crab-cake" by mistake. We thought it would be a real crab cake but, it was a heart of palm crab cake, maybe they could confirm that the customer knows that there's no crab in it. We didn't know. Or maybe they could call it a "heart of palm" cake.   The lobster mac & cheese was just OK for me & could've used way more lobster. Finally, we got dessert, it was the S'mores dessert it looks very pretty & it is pretty good but it doesn't have any chocolate at all. Although, the marshmallows were roasted to perfection.   Overall, I would definitely come here again. But, it would be mainly for the atmosphere & to take pictures.

iAVBx4LHGmoLcOmLHTe2Bg.text: Came here with my boyfriend for our anniversary dinner. Came in on a Saturday night w reservations, come to find out my reservation was actually for Sunday lol fortunately the hostess sat us anyways which was super nice.  The food and drinks we're so good! Loved the Bluefin toro and Spanish Mackerel nigiri, Wagyu gyoza, brussle sprouts and the #HitMe Cake!!  The only dish that we ordered n didnt enjoy was the crispy chicken baos but not a big deal. Our experience here was perfect. The food, ambiance, company (the couple sitting next to us was fun and nice to talk to) the staff, all so great. We'll definitely be coming back!

kHjkla0rhF41GUAZpq1PTg.text: We went late night after dinner and gambling. The girls at the spa told me to at the very least go at night to get a drink. I gathered up our party of about ten of us (work event) and we went in for some libations.  Well fast forward and we started ordering some apps - get the shrimp  amazing!!!!! We talked about that shrimp for days!!  Bartenders are stellar, love good service!! It's so pretty in here We had a ball Really made the night

C6HSPget-9rKmwo8uhPv5Q.text: I've been here about 6 times and we always order the truffle sashimi, mushroom spaghetti, sticky coconut cake and the donut wheel. The truffle sashimi just melts in your mouth. The mushroom spaghetti is my favorite. Sometimes we order two orders of it! I recently had the New York Strip and it was so tender and juicy. I would definitely order the strip over the filet. The "Hit Me" cake is definitely something that makes a good social media post but it's too sweet and heavy for me to ever finish. I prefer the donut wheel which comes with chocolate, caramel and raspberry jam. And my favorite is the sticky coconut cake. It's a coconut sorbet with a hard chocolate shell and little pyramid shaped cake with a delicious mango sauce. Sometimes my boyfriend and I stop in just to get this dessert.  The service isn't the most consistent here and it also depends on where you're seated in the restaurant. I've noticed that when I've gone with a larger party the service is better than if it's just two people. Also the seating in the main dining room seems to have more servers than the bar seating area. I would highly suggest to make a reservation beforehand since the wait for a table can be awhile.

3m3czm3k2c2fGOCk3N27oA.text: WOW. Came in for a Bday celebration as walk ins. We were told we would be seated by 8:30p. It was7:50 on a Momday evening & this place was loud w/ a crowd. Yes I said Monday. The concrete jungle draped w/ vines greenery & lights as the infamous CATCH tunnel entryway there are plenty of photo ops for you& your party. The floral catch. The floral butterflywings. HELLO!    The hostesses need help! No, srsly! Numerous guests were complaining and the hostesses just drew a blank stare and said sorry to probably every group.  We were seated shortly after 8:30 meanwhile we sat at the bar I had champagne the others had rose. There are TVs at the bar & "bar seating" is available @ high tables surrounding the bar stool seating area. You really have to let the aesthetics of the entire venue soak in.   We ordered a variety of dishes. Ok trying to stop my mouth from watering:  Catch Ceviche- definite hit, w/ blood orange so refreshing juicy & delicious. Prime Ceviche combination  Jap Yellowtail Sashimi- (2pc) $10 was ok.  Crispy Shrimp- good, creamy, v crispy most shrimps this style lose their crisp this one maintains its crisp deliciousness!  Spicy Cashew Sweet Potato- a tad salty but so crispy & delicious. The kale. Wow. Fave!  Mahi Mahi Tacos- in wonton shells. were good.  Hit Me Cake- as it was my bday! I absolutely am a fan of chocolate& this GF dessert is all that & some fun!   Our server was wonderful & the service was wonderful they cleared plates & refilled beverages asked us if we were alright & the food was well worth the experience.

dThfUfO0EAM0L0d7uK-ghA.text: Contrary to what most other Yelpers have reported, I had an amazing time at Catch! I made reservations a week prior and when I arrived at the restaurant we were seated within 15 minutes of checking in. So definitely a lot better than what others have experienced.   My fiance and I were drawn to Catch because of the beautiful entryway; it is absolutely stunning when you walk through. We usually aren't too crazy about fine dining restaurants, but it was our 4 year anniversary so we decided to splurge.   We started off the night with the Truffle Sashimi, I thought it was pretty good, but I wish the portion was just slightly bigger. My fiance ordered the Sauteed Wild Caught Snapper and I ordered the Herb-roasted Branzini. I ended up eating her snapper and she ended up eating my branzini. I liked both, but I had a slight preference for the snapper. However, I would go for the branzini if it's your first time. We finished off the night with the smores pizza. I definitely recommend getting that! It was a great way to top off the meal.   Overall, I had a great time at Catch. The food and service were on point and the decor is amazing!

t8lceepjnHJL61FiPMBgRg.text: I've been to CatchLA multiple times so wasn't expecting anything new. The entrance is omgeee IG worthy!!!! I would recommend coming a bit early just to take pics before the dinner crowd comes. Since the entrance was so beautiful I was left underwhelmed when I walked into the dining area. The entrance and beautiful bar definitely took from the rest of the restaurant. Now, on to the hostess and employees...they are way super nicer than the LA employees!  We didn't feel unwelcome and our servers were very friendly. I have to admit the food here is waaaay better than CatchLA! Everything tasted so fresh and well seasoned! My favorite dishes are the hamachi and octopus. Yummy! I would definitely go back to just have those two dishes. The drinks were strong and tasty! I was left craving for more!!

eISw7n7Mfw82-2DExiM5aA.text: The entrance of the restaurant makes eating here worth it! You walk through a big tunnel that is covered in flowers. The lighting is absolutely perfect and all of your pictures (with flash) will look amazing!   The waiter said their dishes are family style but everything our table ordered was small. I ordered the chicken bao buns (3 for $25 or 2 for $19) and they were not enough to share, unless you ordered tons of stuff for the table. I guess it's supposed to be tapas style. My friends loved their sushi and drinks. We ordered Brussels sprouts but they were out, so we ordered broccolini instead...it had a super strong lemon taste.   The waiter was friendly but the restaurant was so loud, it was hard to hear him the entire time!   Tip: They won't seat you until your entire party has arrived.

Y8-x6noxNcn-WiYvWzIPgg.text: Legit good seafood in a fun sort of speakeasy/old school/vintage vibe.  Went here for my wife's birthday. Initial impressions were good. Lots of friendly staff, cool atmosphere, especially the entrance (very Instagram friendly). Opens into a bar with friendly bartenders and nice open space, it got crowded later but didn't feel crowded...if that makes sense. Check out the pics, on to the important details:  Our server was super helpful, and the staff were very attentive, filling water glasses, taking away plates, however I did not feel rushed and nobody ever reached for a partially eaten dish. They utilize a "streaming service" so each dish comes out when it's ready, although they did a good job of timing so we never had too much on the table or felt rushed to finish a dish.  The food was very good, I'd say it is worth the price. It is expensive, for sure, but not outrageous if you are familiar with pricing in the casinos and honestly considering the ingredients, the freshness, and the variety I found it very reasonable. I would definitely recommend three small plates per person and skip the entrees. I thought the cold and hot were equally delicious. Highlights were definitely the truffle sashimi and the grilled Spanish octopus.  Cocktails all sounded very sweet when I read the menu, and I was hesitant bc I feel that strip casinos/bars tend to make drinks on the sweet side, however I found both our cocktails to be well balanced and very nice. Honestly these are some of the best cocktails I've had on the Strip.  TLDR: Definitely try this place, order a cocktail and two or three small plates and enjoy the cool ambience

Qeqb0Fh4VLqBj5-TGBgqyA.text: I came to Catch to celebrate my 24th birthday on 9/6. This is probably the best birthday dinner/experience I've had my entire life. I called the same day to make a reservation for 2 and although I didn't get the time I wanted, it was really nice to even have been accommodated. I'm from NYC, I should have known better than to try to get a reservation the same day lol! The entrance is so incredibly beautiful, you'll definitely get the perfect instagram picture. We were then seated, and our waiter Miguel was AMAZING. He helped us with the menu, telling us his favorite dishes. He made sure we were having a great time and he is part of the reason why I have to say their customer service is 10/10!!! For an appetizer, we had the lobster avocado roll, which was everything with the sauce. Followed by, wagyu gyoza and finished with the organic crispy chicken. The hit me dessert was also really great. The only unpleasant part, was their hostess who kept looking at me up and down, it was actually quite rude. However, other than that, If I ever find myself back in Vegas, I will definitely be back but I strongly recommend.

-Z9rgveuhEiigTrNzF_oGQ.text: The entrance to the restaurant is eye catching and beautiful. There's music playing in the entrance and as you enter the restaurant you realize that it's pretty consistent. Loud. The volume level is stupid loud. The staff said they cannot lower it. I guarantee you're going to leave this place with a splitting headache.  But you're in luck, if you want to have a meal but not want to talk to each other then this is the restaurant for you,  There's no way to hold a conversation in here. everyone is shouting over the music to have conversations. In photos, the atmosphere looks cozy and romantic, but once there, it's like your neighbor's blaring their stereo while your trying to sleep.  The restaurant look is reminiscent of a restaurant in a wine cellar. But the sound level is reminiscent of enduring a bombing during WWII. I might not make it to the main course.  Update: yeah we left after the starter.

b9N07KhaA0d57ZStJ21zAQ.text: After seeing the beautiful and unique Catch wall blow up my social media, I decided to look into this new, hip Aria restaurant. I'm so glad I did! I asked around and had heard great things, especially about their truffle sashimi. I was not disappointed! The ambiance was both beautiful and modern, as well as a speakeasy vibe within the lounge area. The colors, the subway tile, the chandeliers... all gave it a fun but classy ambience. The service was great, the cocktails were on point, and the fish was great!   The food is more or less served tapas style. The waiter suggested we choose two hot appetizers, two cold appetizers, and share an entree. My favorites included the truffle sashimi, the scallops gnocchi, & the MRC Roll. The entree we chose was the Red Snapper, which was plated beautifully and was tasty but honestly was my least favorite of all the things we ordered. Next time, we might just order 1-2 more app's. They also took care of me with a little birthday surprise--a few delish & fresh chocolate chips cookies.  Really enjoyed my time here! Definitely recommend!

gVQbNcIUxuDBRF_nQS-Mtg.text: Trendy, hipster, cool. All of those buzzwords that make this a social dining place.   Find this place next to the Aria Front desk. You can't miss the entrance that everyone talks about. Long archway covered w/ floral. You'll find two slits to take pics--the butterfly wings and the "Catch" flowers  You walk right into their bar which has a speakeasy vibe. Then behind that their main dining room with a sushi bar and birdcage booths. To the right of the bar is a lounge that also has another bar and kind of library feel to me. Outdoor seating will come in the future.   Okay okay food. So it's a Japanese spot but they also got your steak and seafood. Yes very shareable. I'm just going to list my favs. Keep in mind it's will likely change since it's just opened.   -One Too many Cocktail -Crispy Shrimp -Branzino  -Mushroom pasta (must like truffle- my fav of the night)  -Donuts (I just thought about them..drool!)  Those stood out to me but other solid choices are the sweet potato gnocchi, filet, truffle sashimi, and eggplant skewer.   Service solid. Timing of food was normal. Music good variety of old and new. Not as loud as STK.   Needless to say Yes I would return!

PBtzuAl5xm9Xc8k8P4LwYQ.text: Marcus is amazing! Had reso's for 2 at 9:15 took too long so we ate everything at bar and was 10000000 times better then sitting at a table! Marcus gave us the best recommendations on food and the best drinks! The whole staff here is actually amazing! So kind and nice and very welcoming! This made our trip so much better! I wish I took pics of the amazing good but we devoured it the second it came out! Wish yelp had an elite star cause this place was amazing! Thanks catch and thanks again to Marcus! Perfect Day!

7PIZ5rOED0mE_EaEKExrIg.text: Amazing food and drinks and even better ambiance! Loved everything about this place! Definitely coming back.

psVU7OYN2O4tQvxCM9ap2g.text: Of course it's packed on V-Day. My date and I were impressed how flawlessly service went. The food was delicious. Everything was great!

jtzG9eY1feFzReMroWfUwQ.text: Another Catch another disappointment. After going to the one in LA and being extremely disappointed there my friends informed me that the Vegas location was better. I asked what about it was better and they said the food because it's a different chef. In my mind it made some sense so I said sure let's give it a try. Both service and food were worse than the LA location. Our whole group agreed that all the seafood dishes from the rolls we ordered to the lobster Mac and cheese had an extremely fishy taste. We waited forever in between courses and had to ask for utensils and water more than once before we got it. With so many restaurants in Vegas and at Aria save your time and money go somewhere else.

WWkDKqgMNf_R2SpEf2c8Jw.text: Let me start off with the good stuff.  The food was excellent and our server Miguel was great.  But other than that, everything else was subpar.   First, we were given a super small table for party of 7.  Second, the table was uneven so drinks were spilling and utensils were falling off.  Third, since our table was so small we had specifically requested the main courses to be served at different times since we knew the table would not fit.  Well, guess what? The chef didn't listen. Most of the main course came out at the same time where we had no choice but to reject some of it due to lack of space. Worst of all, the steak came out before the fish.  That was a total no no.  For a restaurant that prides themselves as the top, this mistake should not have happen.  Management needs to read all of yelper's comments and improve.  There are so many nice restaurants in Vegas.  If you can't keep up with the rest of them you will be weed out soon.

5fer9yTmZn8ZEIp50fCxPA.text: Nothing but good times at Catch. Great food, livelier ambiance, fantastic service. They treated us very well when we went (party of 5). Edd (Edd-normous, what they call him lol) was our server and I highly recommend asking for him. Knowledgeable on the menu, drinks, and history of the restaurant. Try the Tuna Tartare Trio, NY Shrimp Steak, Seared Scallops, Corn on the cob, and the Coconut Ice Cream for dessert. Would highly recommend Catch at Aria!

qlrDA_saJiJeE0NdJgAS8Q.text: The food was great! Restaurant beautifully decorated.  Bartender, Steve, was wonderfully friendly and efficient!  Wait staff engaging, thorough, and friendly.  Four stars because it is pretty overpriced (yes, it's Vegas, but small amounts of food for the $), and the food came out to us out of order.  Our cold appetizers never arrived and we had to start with hot food.  We had our entree and then had to ask for our sashimi and roll.  Very loud and difficult to hear as well.

ZJ1mRRWABOSa8LEq5d0LLw.text: This place was excellent. Had the Branzino and the wife had the salmon and they were both cooked to perfection. The lobster mash was really good with a huge piece of lobster in it. All recommended by our waitress.

hiSYTWJltjmyOTy0HraT-A.text: Way to go! This restaurant is an awesome addition to Vegas! I love the atmosphere and the food is excellent! Great for sharing! Beautiful set up, however It's not a quite place so if your looking for ambiance this isn't the place but the drinks are unique, wine list extensive by the glass and lots of menu choices. Will def be back!

b5UzoYHJedPEQvNEJmoROg.text: Amazing atmosphere and great drinks !!! Super chic ... this is a must along w the donut wheel

I39SDhbc8RBL04UP43F9mQ.text: The atmosphere is trendy and pretty, but the food was mediocre. I had the snapper with lobster mash. It tasted very plain, and for the price, I expected more.

KeaCeifaUjCSe03JeKuOnQ.text: If I could give negative stars I would. We won't get into details about this horrible place.  In a landscape of amazing restaurants here in Las Vegas and a assortment of amazing restaurants to go to..... I kindly and humbly suggest...... avoid catch like the plague!!!!!! Do not waste your money at this lame, sorry excuse for a restaurant.

L9QJa-Vs0fZlhN7Ibjl1lw.text: What an amazing dining experience. So many people are being so insensitive. The restaurant just opened and they are learning through trial and error. We sat down and the waiters were very attentive, quick and personable. Our waiter Edward was great. He helped us pick out some great dishes. We ordered two truffle sashimi, ceviche, king salmon, carpaccio, hamachi with Kale, charred octopus, Mrc roll, mushroom spaghetti, scallop gnocchis, broccoli side dish with the oven roasted branzino. We topped the dinner off with the hit me Klondike chocolate dessert and sorbets! Gosh, five of us ladies ate very well and we had nothing but high remarks! Thanks for a great dining experience and being an MLife Platinum member I was able to get reservations last minute on a Friday! Amazing in every way! For those that give the restaurant a bad review, give them another chance. Restaurant business isn't easy.
