JbDbyWBacKZEtUHMMRdlEQ.text: I would give a negative star if I could. Had reservations at 10 PM, but due to our show getting out late we weren't able to make it in time. Attempted to call once our show let out at 10:15 PM, wasn't able to get thru. Finally arrived at CATCH around 10:35 PM and was greeted by a hostess who seemed bothered that we were showing up so to closing. I explained our situation and she said we could sit in a booth, where we did sit. We weren't given any menus by the hostess. We then sat for 10-15 minutes and weren't greeted by a waiter or waitress. At this time we decided to go elsewhere. Yes CATCH is a very nice restaurant, but their customer service was not up to par.

Y7MRj3tWCPYk88c1JXj6Lg.text: Love loved Catch Las Vegas. Great ambiance, beautiful entrance to restaurant and even tastier food! I highly recommend the filet, the lobster roll and the sweet potatoes with kale dish. Definitely will be back next time we're in Vegas!

LPsUlj1kvsWGEfyBZOQCIQ.text: Horrible service. We had a reservation and were stuck in traffic on the strip on our way, so made the call to the restaurant to give them a heads up. I spoke with Vicki who said verbatim, "No worries, we'll see you guys soon!" We arrived 15 minutes after our reservation and scrambled through the line of people to check in, when we were told that they only hold reservations for 15 minutes (which was not communicated when I called) and that we were now on a waitlist. The host was extremely rude, wouldn't make eye contact and also wouldn't let us know how long the wait would be now. Needless to say we left immediately, and are now enjoying an amazing dinner at Momofuku. Definitely avoid.

aZaDw4VhDMp4bLwGukY1Cg.text: Unlike the other reviewers we were sat at a table immediately upon our arrival (20min before our 6:30pm reservation). Hostesses were nice.  The restaurant had trendy loud burger joint kind of music which was unsuited for a nice pricy restaurant. The entrance was beautiful. We were party of 2 and assigned to one of the tiny tables which did not have enough room to get in and out between them. I had to ask the next table to move their table a little (I'm 5'4" 125lbs).   The food was ok... nothing memorable. I thought the price was too much for the portion even considering it's in Vegas.   After all, now I can say I've been there but don't think I'll be back.

yrdP1k-3aysOWP6JGcmVaQ.text: The hallway leading into the restaurant is perfect! Completely "Instagram worthy".  The food on the other hand is average, very average sushi. Way overpriced for what you get. I will not be going back.

_sf_XngVZuALXS1NrEJ84Q.text: So disappointed in this place. Waited over a half hour for a table despite making reservations over two months prior. It was LOUD. So loud you have to yell to the person sitting across from you. They pack you in like sardines. All of which would be fine if the food was worth it. It wasn't. I've had better sushi at local restaurants. For the price level I was expecting more. I ordered two rolls and my husband ordered seared tuna. My rolls sat in front of me for over 15 minutes while we waited for them to bring out his dinner. All of which was ordered at the same time. We have been loyal M-Lifers and stay at Aria. There are many other restaurants that are so much better than this place. We will not be back.

DUgidJ2Vth1yJ7Mt5qO_hA.text: To say the walkway into catch is an experience in itself, it was absolutely breathtaking. It really brings you to a place where you feel like you are no longer in Vegas. The hostesses seemed short staffed when we walked in but they seemed relaxed and having things under control. We got walked in by Chey who was so sweet and acknowledged we were celebrating something special. She even made sure we were comfortable in our seat and explained the difference in menus she handed us. We decided on our food and they advised the chef recommends to order all at once and they will send out the feast as it is to be served. We got the sashimi, shrimp cocktail and oysters for appetizers and we were not disappointed ! They even had (mignonette) which is the white wine and shallot sauce for the oysters which was phenomenal! The scallops were perfectly cooked, and the filet was served with a spicy miso sauce. My all time favorite was the crispy Brussels sprouts, something so simple but made perfectly! Overall the service the was incredible. The hostess who sat us, was a welcoming hello and an attentive goodbye! Would defiantly recommend!

8_ARi-9e8PvVp8hfxXfFbw.text: Food: Under Seasoned, small portions (entrees)  Atmosphere: casual very beautiful it can get very cold and there bathroom is a single restroom for one person at a time.  Service: poor lots of errors on waiter, and the hostess played on there phones and he seated two walk-in's before our group with the reservation.   Would I go back? Only to take a picture of their beautiful entrance.  Disappointed by the food, and the service. Walking into this restaurant is like stepping into another world, it's amazingly beautiful and it makes it hard to write this review. I joined friends for a birthday dinner the other night and was very excited to try there food for the first time after seeing the yelp reviews everything looked so delicious! I ordered the snapper with lobster mashed potatoes and for $42 you would think they would have seasoned the fish it tasted as if it soaked in water all day the seared skin side down almost too long because it was almost on the dry side. The mashed potatoes were good but for the amount of money being dished out a bigger portion would have made more sense. No one at our table enjoyed there food, I even ordered a Jack and Coke and that was even off! And for this to be a birthday celebration the waiter never made mention of it being my friends birthday even though the reservation was for a birthday, the waiting staff was very rude in how the brought out our food reaching over our faces just placing food down on the table and walking away giving the wrong food to the wrong people. I felt very bad for my friend she deserved a better experience and better food. I will say the Crispy shrimp were very good, but Catch Las Vegas I have had some better food off of McDaniel's dollar menu then what was served to me Sunday night. Also if your wondering about atmosphere it's very nice I just wish the brought the entrance into the restaurant it was also very cold. For Aria to be such an amazing hotel you would hope for a restaurant to match that reputation. And before I forget I ordered my friend the doughnut wheel for her birthday as a surprise at the end and my "amazing " waiter in front of her asked the table for my name as he will charge the birthday dessert to my part of the bill thank you for the surprise! Then it took 25mins for us to receive the bill after asking for it and he mixed up our bill 3 different times I don't know if the Catch was having an off night but to make up for my friends disappointment I took her out somewhere else where we able to enjoy our food seeing that we were still hungry and enjoy one another. As a Vegas restaurant Catch you can just depend on the name and restaurant your LA location has be world class season then taste your own food and hire a better staff.

fBPNlRpF4cdOs68OchVXSA.text: The front entrance is beautiful and instagram-worthy. We accidentally reserved a large table on the wrong date but the main hostess was able to accommodate us even though it was fully booked during Father's Day weekend. Thank you!  Portions are small if sharing, but the service and quality is great. Would definitely come here again on special occasions.

ixJSHgpUp3htpcIayTJ0Rg.text: 5-star dining while listening to early 90's hip hop and rnb ... yes please! Went here for our office holiday dinner and I was very impressed. I mean, the entrance itself adorned with flowers and foliage deserves its own yelp page ;)  The ambiance is lively with dim lighting and the decor beautiful. They serve very fresh seafood and cuts of steak. My favorite was the crispy shrimp dish, truffle sashimi, and the kalbi tacos. And make sure you order the chocolate coconut dessert! The servers were on point, our glasses always full, and our tummys very happy. Our entire office had an amazing time. Will be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ROeJ5gg_45foqb0lWDTztw.text: Ahhhh man! I was really hoping for this place to be better than we experienced. My husband and I are True Aria/Mlife supporters. We were really looking forward to this spot and even counting down the days until opening.   So on our recent visit to the Aria, we made a reservation for 5:30. The opening spot of flowers, entry way of butterfly wings with flowers, all that is gorgeous. I was a little bummed that it's all fake flowers but hey, it's for instagram and photo-opts, right?   When we walked right in, we were greeted with a hostess a little preoccupied with her peer-hostess. Finally, after a minute, we then were taken in but directed to the bar, since they were "so busy". How can they be so busy when they literally JUST opened? After ordering a drink, within minutes, not even where the ink was dry, a hostess waited for us to seat us. Already depleting the stars.   Sitting us down, we were given a row, one side couch, and other side chairs. The tables were literally two tops, 6 inches from the next. I found this so ridiculous since the restaurant was barely filled. They could really give more space between the tables. Why am I going to want to hear the chatter next to me? It takes away from the experience, ambiance and shoot, food! I had a couple or two looking at our table, seeing what we ordered and rather than being able to enjoy the last bits of it, we were in the middle of a conversation with the table that was six inches from us.   Service aside. Seating and ambiance aside ...  The food was just okay.   We ordered a seafood platter but it could be replicated at Herringbone. We also ordered some special appetizer roll, which was good at best. My husband ordered the scallops and I ordered the fish (not the whole). Husband's dish was okay, but he complained of sand and the components not being tied in together. My dish was okay, fish was cooked well but the basmati rice was over seasoned.   Would I support coming here? No. Save your money, go somewhere else.

KNOUmI2DdRxWgWx5K-jtlA.text: Ate here last night for my Bday and I will never return unless it's to sit at the bar to order drinks, eat fries and take pics. My food did not look like what the waitress explained, the lobrers mashed potatoes were nasty with one piece of lobster, too expensive, and the crispy shrimp made my cousin sick.  The only two pros: the drinks and the friendly bartender

DUsuBSpLbxzp8Xjm4l6BLQ.text: So basically the only reason I'm giving 3 stars is for the decor itself. Presentation wise, Catch is absolutely beautiful. If you're looking for cute Instagram pictures and a pretty view when you're sitting down this place is perfect! Before you reach the hostess stand there is a beautiful display of flowers along the entrance. This is where everyone is mainly cluttered trying to get pictures before they enter. As far as the food goes...i really didn't like their food. I came here with my friend on one of our only nights off and i was so disappointed With the quality of the food. I got the lobster Mac and cheese and i barely finished half of it. I'm okay with paying a little more for good food but this was really gross.

ciPweafUTPBBltvJqtoqfg.text: The decor of this place is so damn Beautiful! The entrance/exit is gorgeous & perfect for pictures. So make time to arrive an extra 10 mins earlier for pics. The seating is relatively tight, depending on your party size it could seem uncomfortable.  Food: It's a family sharing style, so we ordered a couple things to try. The crispy shrimp is one of the known dishes & it matched up to its expectations. Delicious   I also received the mahi mahi tacos..either 3 or 4 are your choices...,I should have gotten the 4. They were really tiny, but tasted amazingggg. Lastly, I ordered the lobster mashed potatoes. This was dissatisfying to my taste buds, it was extremely too thick.   Otherwise, drinks were good! Dining experience was good. I would definitely recommend & plan to come back again.

SYJHW80_k8pMnEQBKEyJCQ.text: I've been to CATCH LA, NYC and now Vegas. The obvious things were great and aligned with the other locations - decor, bar and food. The one thing that didn't align was hostesses, and to specify, the women at the front counter in the hallway of flowers. This review is based on them, and a mere blind eye being turned to this problem by the management at CATCH who is reading these unpleasant reviews.  My party and I made 2 reservations to CATCH, 30 minutes apart because we didn't want to experience the unapologetic and long wait time. Our reservation, which was for 6 at 8:00 PM and a reservation for 8:30 PM. We showed up and were awkwardly standing in the hallway for 30 minutes until our second reservation. I'm not sure how this is acceptable, to be ignored by hostesses. And frankly, don't have the energy to continue writing a bad review about this non sense.  Figure it out.

rfdBflVN3BrvUcAhgIQzeQ.text: Delicious Asian-inspired predominately seafood dishes in a gorgeous setting. From the moment you enter, dining at Catch is quite pleasing to the senses.  Dined here twice over a week, and both experiences were fantastic. We ordered quite a few dishes but enjoyed the crunchy rice cakes, crispy shrimp, king crab tempura, filet skewers, the NY strip, and Brussels sprouts the most. Fun place for a group, reservations a must. They had a DJ playing upbeat music--much fun was had by all!

gmGTk5_w8GEsShdSF8W71A.text: Catch was great! Beautiful restaurant, starting with the hallway leading up to the hostess stand and continuing throughout!  The restaurant may have been a little pricey for a few people in my group, but everyone found something to eat that they really enjoyed. We ordered: spicy scallop roll, vegetable rolls, lobster and avocado roll, mahi-mahi wonton tacos, crispy chicken bao buns, grilled Spanish octopus, lobster mac, and the sauteed snapper.  My wife and I had the lobster and avocado roll, the octopus, and the snapper.  The lobster sushi roll intrigued me so I ordered it, and it was pretty good! Definitely a unique taste (at least for me); I've had plenty of sushi, but never with lobster.  The octopus was amazing! The highlight for me. I love getting octopus, but it's always a risk because it's easy to overcook and make rubbery. I'll say that Catch did a spectacular job at cooking it perfectly; it was tender and delicious. The potatoes that came with it were also delightful.  The snapper was a lovely piece of fish; succulent and tasty! I'm not personally a fan of truffle, and was happy that it wasn't OVERLY truffled, but instead had a little bit on the plate that you could use as you wanted.  Definitely would recommend this place if you're looking for an upscale place for dinner on the strip that has really delicious fish!

RYrICCO1YLv57vCQKW_Cxw.text: A group of 4 of us just came here tonight and we had a reservation at 5:45pm. There was hardly anyone at the restaurant when we show up, and we were told to go to the bar to wait to be seated. We ask 2 times when we would be seated, but the hostess kept telling us "just a few minutes". Finally, we send my boyfriends mom over to ask when we'd be seated, because by now, we had already waited over a half an hour (not as bad as most of these other reviews, but the restaurant was literally empty when we showed up, and we noticed the restaurant was getting full with people who showed up after us and we still hadn't been seated)!!! The hostess finally said she was seating us right now, and her excuse was, "oh, I didn't know your group was all here." We literally notified her our entire party was there, and she saw all 4 of us, when she had asked us to wait at the bar. Why would we keep asking when we could sit to eat if we didn't have all of us there?  Anyway, our waiter, Raj, was excellent--5 stars for him! And the food was excellent. The hostess was just the only terrible part of our dining experience.  -Hostess: 0/5 stars -Waiter: 5/5 stars -Food: 4.5/5 stars -Service(based on speed of food coming out, water refills, changing out clean plates, wiping table, etc.): 4.5/5 stars -Atmosphere: 4/5 stars (the entry way is obviously incredible and unlike any other place around, the bar is really nice, the sushi bar is nice, but the restaurant itself is a tad underwhelming in comparison to everything else...)  We only ate appetizers but they were almost all really good with the exception of the lobster mac (eh...), lobster rolls (not worth it), and chicken ball skewers (others liked this, but it wasn't my favorite). These are the other items we tried and enjoyed:  -Catch ceviche -Catch roll* -Shrimp and mango roll -Filet mignon skewers -Cauliflower with some sort of sweet dressing* -Yellowtail nigiri -Eggplant skewers* -King crab tempura* (everyone thought was better than Nobu's) -Salmon belly carpaccio* -Corn on the cob* -Crispy brussel sprouts (great flavor, but I expected the leaves to be peeled off the brussel sprouts so they would be really crispy, but it was the entire brussel sprout so it wasn't that crispy) -Crispy chicken bao -Donut wheel  *These were my favorite items  Overall, I would come back for special occasions, but I really hope they improve the whole hosting situation for people who show up early with their whole group when the restaurant is empty and have reservations.

wvTPTRj3YjuLnp64IFBxsA.text: My husband and I are often at Aria, whether for Sunday brunch buffet (Amazing!) or to gamble, it's one of our favorite casinos and possibly the only reason we venture to the strip. We now have another reason, CATCH is our new favorite restaurant, the Tar Tar trio was so delish and though everything  was exceptional, the TAr Tar was beyond that! It's loud and super trendy, also really dark, I thought it would be hard to get noticed (we sat at the open tables in the bar), but our server and the rest of the bar staff were quick to take care of us and provided the best service. I look forward to dining here again and will recommend it to all our visitors. Also, when the server brought the check, she also brought us two scrumptious chocolate chip cookies on the house!

JnkfBfSCmyPulHkaPxIVow.text: Went for my birthday dinner-  3 stars for food- sushi was ehh, not worth the price I've had better Quality at a much cheaper place.  Must have: truffle sashimi, crispy shrimp, and hit me cake it was amazing.( they do not do anything special for birthdays- you need to order a desert and they will put a candle on it lol) kind of disappointing they can't even give a free desert on birthdays when your spending so much money.   2 stars for inside scenery: the outside of the resturant was wayyyyyyyyyy nicer than the inside. Inside was boring, and plain. Walking in I was expecting something else it was like two total different environments.  4 stars for service: our waiter was great very accommodating and knowledgeable, however we felt a rushed to order everything at once.   Overall it was an okay experience, guess I was expecting a little more since it's so hyped up. Would recommend to try, but probably won't be going back. I prefer Nobu, Roku, or TAO

J2RDnTrtmZfq_wybUNlPqQ.text: Came here opening night with a group of gals after visiting both locations in NYC and LA. Sooooo... high hopes!! And then BOOM right off the lobby you see this snazzy, cavernous floral tunnel. Fountains and fairy lights and flowers up in this bitch! CATCH is hot and CATCH knows it. The bar looks like a sexy Metro cave, in a glamorous/post-industrial way. You'll get those vibes in the main dining room with the birdcages covered with vines with hanging cable lights and subway tiles. The ambiance is just so killer here and perf for Aria.  Okay sooo the good stuff. Literally everything we ate bitchin' with a capital B!!! Let me take you on a wild, front seat ride on this culinary coaster baby.  Crispy shrimp: Little delicious orange nuggets of goodness. Creamy. Crunchy. All that good stuff. Catch Style Ceviche: Came apart like sexy, fluid, warm butter. Hamachi Spinach: Crispy spinach and yellowtail!! Solid combo. We like it RAWWW! Salmon Belly Carpaccio: My favey fave of the raw dishes. Salmon belly is salmon's sophisticated and hot older cousin. Don't be stupid and not order this dish. Catch roll: Got two of these little flaming bad boys. Got to see a blowtorch light these puppies up like the fourth of July! That's showbiz babyyyyyy and we're in Vegas!!! Crunchy rice cakes: Every soosh place has crispy tuna rice cakes. This is not every soosh place. So good we ordered another plate and scarfed these down not like the fine women we are. Perfectly worded as "tater tot tuna boats". Grilled Spanish octopus: Personally my favorite dish!!!! Oh my word. Octopi are my favorite animal and even that didn't stop me from hogging the whole plate. Perfectly grilled with little touches of sweet potato and some other veggies thrown in there that I hoovered down with sophistication. Mushroom spaghetti: A huge favorite among the table. Garlicky. Creamy. There was carnage. No mercy no survivors on this dish. Charred broccolini (spicy!!!): CATCH made broccolini delicious. Usually broccolini and related companies are the redheaded stepchildren of the cruciferous vegetables (and vegetables in general). This is some voodoo that they were so bomb. Parm-truffle fries: Marinate me in that (VEGAN!!!!) truffle aioli and serve me hot and crispy. These fries were perfectly crispy and hot and sinful. I need to repent. AAAAAAND dessert (AKA the best part): "Hit me" chocolate Klondike cake: if you don't get this, you a big dumb dumb. Not only was this fun to completely destroy with fervor with a simple piece of cutlery, this was a big ol' square of milk chocolate delishus. Like so good. Hit me baby, one more time. And to really seal the deal, we had dark chocolate chip cookies that were a fan favorite across the table. Only sociopaths don't love a god damned chocolate chip cookie.  Danny Ye (sir chef himself) came over with the owners/ managers multiple times to make sure that they were killin' it (spoiler alert: they were). They were so kind, introductory, and generous with their service. Even better was Joe C ("the tall one"), our server. Our dinner would NOT have been the same without him. He was attentive and funny and kind and treated us like absolute #queens and was one of the best servers we've ever had and we all work in the service industry in town. Highly recommend requesting him if you want stellar service!!!!  They have tons of vegan options (cheesecake, pasta, etc) and a bitchin' cocktail menu. Although we had only wine (so goooooood, we had to snap pics of the bottles to save for later), can't wait to come back and try their cocktails like the matcha-tequila thingie. The menu is huge, like absolutely massive (like my waist after this dinner). The transformation into Carbie Barbie is complete. TILL NEXT TIME CATCH! Xoxo, the Carbie Barbies

C6QPOt23gmvlx8aCPdPbDw.text: Loved it, had so much fun there with friends. First entry way was beautiful with all the flowers! It was great!  Mimi oyster shooter with the Bloody Mary shot is genius, so yummy and of course fun to do. I'm not a huge truffle person but the truffle sashimi, so good! Lobster Mac delish. We had the salmon and branzino, preferred the branzino. Tried both the HitMe dessert and donut wheel, HitMe for sure. The donut presentation is fun but just tastes okay. HitMe chocolate cake/dessert was very good and obviously fun to hit open.  Service was great! Miguel our server was so nice and helpful! A great time overall. I definitely will go back. So glad this beautiful place opened up.

-adYDZmfGxu__vB5EHyLVw.text: Delicious food, but has growing pains.   I was recommended by a friend to try Catch - I'm glad I did! I love the Aria and Catch has an absolutely beautiful facade. However, it feels as though they need to improve their system and function/flow as a restaurant.  After arriving on time for 7:15 reservation, we see a man and his wife berate the hostess for having to wait 20 minutes past their reservation time to be seated. There are also about 4-5 groups just standing around waiting to be seated. This seems like a big problem for the restaurant-they don't anticipate people staying as long as they want, so they asked us to sit at a high table by the bar in exchange for two free appetizers. A deal, but obviously there are issues with the system. I wouldn't go with an urgency to make a show, because we wouldn't have made our show time if we had waited for a table instead of the bar.   As for the food and service throughout the meal, food was 5/5, service was again seemingly going through some problems. They had to comp a glass of wine because they forgot about it, and had two servers trying to take our order one after the other - lost in communication!   The food, though! Truffle sashimi was EXCELLENT and very flavorful, and the fried rock shrimp was on par if you've had the similar dish at Katsuya's. Creamy and a little spicy.  We also had the Wagyu tacos, those were okay. The meat didn't really shine the way wagyu should, so maybe try something else as the small taco wasn't really worth its price. The Charred Octopus was very well done and flavorful but not overpowering. At last the Cantonese 2.5lb Lobster arrives and that was incredible! A little on the spicy side, but tender and packed with flavor. Had charred broccolini on the side and it was a perfect green side dish. For dessert, the hot donut ferris wheel. Delicious, exactly what you want from donut balls: not dense, sugar melts on your tongue, and comes with four delicious sauces.   The food and menu have no problem here, but be prepared for the problems the restaurant experiences overall. Worth a try, definitely a 4-5 star if they can fix these problems and let their food shine!

gBR1Txcaii7zErmiRF2wYA.text: Wow!  What great date night!  Everyone and everything was on point.  The customer service was great.. the food was FREAKING STUPID GOOD... the ambiance was exactly what I wanted for my fiance's birthday dinner.  Really happy I chose this place.  Highly recommend to anyone for any occasion.  This was our first time and it will not be our last.

-mMk7-XgTxvXcDkA2TmW3Q.text: It was my birthday and my boyfriend decided to pick where we eat and surprise me. Needless to say, when I saw what I was walking into & I thought it was going to be an amazing experience. Boy was I wrong. We arrived for our reservation at 7:30 about 10 minutes early. Strike one, our table wasn't ready. They proceeded to tell us that we needed to wait in the bar area. We waited until 7:55 and I sent my boyfriend to go ask how long we planned to wait because if I went it wouldn't have been a nice visit. Not only am I pregnant, but I came hungry expecting to be seated at 7:30. We finally were seated around 8:10. Strike 2, I saw he table looked at the hostess and my boyfriend and sat down, miserably. My table was not only about a foot and a half wide, but it was RIGHT next to the people next to us. The menu didn't even fit on it. I had to rest it on my belly. Let me add how uncomfortable it is to "slide" in and out of a table where you have about 6 inches of space between the next table, pregnant. Definitely not an area for someone who makes a reservation. I was upset when I saw someone who walked in just prior to us, receive a private booth that was available when we sat down. I didn't want to ruin the evening with the poor poor service that we had already received. So I made the best of the night. The food was good, not worth what we spent which was about $250. My boyfriend and I continuously filled our own water glasses with the bottle that was left there, while the waiter catered to the people next to us and their empty wine and water glasses. I will gladly say we will never be dining there again. You don't pay that much money for decent food and shit service. Save the money you'd spend here and head to Mizumi at the Wynn if you're wanting amazing service and amazing food that's comparable to this menu.

Z1EoHOEfSX0fgFfXhc3K2A.text: So my husband and I had a reservation here for our 1 year wedding anniversary which we told them and the hostesses try to seat us at a two seater table literally elbow to elbow with two loud 8 person parties sandwiched in between us. Look if I was coming there for cocktails then fine, but it was our anniversary. Call me crazy but when I spend 400 dollars on dinner I don't want to be elbow to elbow with other patrons. They at first told us they had no other tables even though there were clearly other tables and it's not like we didn't make a reservation weeks in advance. They ended up seating us in the bar which was better but I think the hostess forgot to tell our waitress it was our 1 year anniversary and our waitress never asked. Kind of a big disappointment because we have been to numerous amazing restaurants on the strip and paid less for quality food and outstanding service. Here is was seriously lacking. The hostesses were pretty stupid and need some better training. All in all the food was okay but this place is seriously OVERRATED. Everyone just comes here for the instagrammable front. You want great food and service for 300 to 400 bucks, go to gorgon Ramsey steak! Way above this place in service and food quality. Sorry.

f84lzZlqelWHoL6lyPUVuw.text: This place is horrible service and food! I can not put into words how bad our experience was there. Went there for my birthday with prior reservations and after we were seated we got up to take pictures in the lobby. The hostess came up to us and said we only have 3 more minutes to order food so she rudely demanded us to sit down and take pictures later. Then when we followed her directions and went to sit back down, we waited another 20 minutes for our waiter to come to our table to take our order. When we asked why we were told to sit down because we only have 3 minutes they said that is not True and hostess was incorrect, with no apology. Then to top it off they kept switching waiters on us. Then to top it off even more they brought us the wrong order at the end. When we let them know they told us the kitchen is closed and demanded we eat the incorrect order they brought us. We told them this is not what we ordered we asked for our waiter several times and its not our fault it took forever for our waiter and food to come out. Again, no apology and they were extremely unprofessional and demeaning to us. To a point where we felt uncomfortable, attacked and not safe. We told them we will not pay for a meal we did not eat and they demanded we pay and would not let us leave. They ruined my birthday and never cared. It was the worse experience ever with a horrible manager, ambience, food and service. I would never step my foot there again. They have no respect for human beings. Do not go!!!!

QN7mrz-4LEUMnsEsGttXbQ.text: I was disappointed with my experience here. First impressions are largely important and I didn't receive a great one. I reserved a table last night for 9:30 and was not seated until 10:20. The hostess offered for us to have drinks at the bar while we waited however there was no room whatsoever so we waited outside instead. I can appreciate that it appeared to be a very busy night (considerably so for a Monday, although the restaurant is still very new and trendy) but I feel as though if one secures a reservation days ahead of time, the guaranteed time should be honored. I took my boyfriend here to celebrate his 25th birthday and we were both surprised and saddened by the substandard service. Our hostess forgot my name and came back to ask me what it was after we had been waiting about 30 minutes, and we weren't seated for another 20 minutes. She did not acknowledge the wait time or even apologize until 5 minutes prior to our seating. I work in an advanced professional capacity with VIP guests at another five diamond property on the strip (not Aria) and to assess this service as shocking and disappointing is an understatement. I noticed 4 open and set tables when we were finally being seated, so that was annoying to say the least. Our server Marcus S was a saving grace in a way. He was knowledgeable and attentive and the food was great, however the standing for almost an hour prior to our confirmed booking obviously left a bad taste in our mouths. Not a fun way to spend a birthday.

gszb12UFTI8GUXKJwStR6g.text: This was our favorite meal during our latest trip to Vegas. I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews, but we had an amazing meal! Yes, there is music playing and yes, parties of two might be seated close to another couple. However, it's no different than other restaurants we have dined at before...even off the strip! I would recommend the Catch roll, scallops and gnocchi, the grilled salmon (its all GF) and the Hit Me cake!

LRJK6bvZcklQ7445Vn7Eeg.text: This places entrance is an Instagram influencers dream! We were in Vegas for my bachelor party and a friend recommended this place so we headed over to aria for dinner. Place is super fancy super hip and lots of either rich or pretending to be rich people. The service here is top notch,  what you would expect out of the place. My friend pretty much took care of the menu and ordered everything. There's so many dishes that I tried that I couldn't even remember what they were. Some of the ones that stood out in my mind were the truffle sashimi, this orange chicken shrimp thing and the steak. The truffle shashimi was soo good. I've tried other truffle sashimi dishes that were way overpowering but this one had the perfect balance of truffle and some kind of soy or citrus. Place is really good but I probably can't even afford to come back. It was a great spot for dinner when we were in Vegas.

yaZlj9QpZ7QqVs-z_tzSog.text: We went here for our anniversary. The only thing I actually really liked and impressed was the decorations of the entrance! It has nice flowers and ceiling lights. It's very good to take photos. Next, we got seated and everything went wrong there.  1. Table for 2 was so close to my left and right side of the other tables. It's like there's no privacy. I had to actually scream across the table to have a conversation. You can hear people's conversations on the left and the right. It was so close to each other which I didn't like.  2. We ordered most of the popular items on the menu, but the only 2 items I liked was the truffle sashimi and the lobster mashed potatoes. Others were just ok to me. I was not impressed.  3. After our server took the order, he never showed up after to check up on us. Maybe a good 50 mins until he came and I was so disappointed that I didn't wanna try anything else and asked for the check.  Not sure if I would recommend this place but if your at Aria, come in and check out the entrance. That was the only thing that was cool about.

zM3Ha5oHOjJCGQFUpnACQQ.text: I'll get some things out of the way first.  Yes, I did have to wait to be seated even though I had made a reservation, though I didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes.  Yes, the tables there are very close together, especially the section with one long bench and regular seats on the other side.  I was aware of that when booking my reservation and requested something a little more spacious, preferably a private booth.  The restaurant wasn't able to honor my request exactly but did seat me and my dining companion at one of the ends of that section.  (The booths seemed to be held for larger parties.)  At least we only had neighbors on one side and they didn't arrive until about halfway through our dinner.  And yes, it is loud in there and I did find myself yelling out "What?" on several occasions.  Having said all that, I do think CATCH is a nice place to celebrate a special occasion: the entryway is an excellent picture-taking opportunity, service was prompt and professional, and the food was good.  We had the crispy shrimp, Catch roll, and mahi mahi wonton tacos which were tasty.  To drink I had the Watermelon Felon and for dessert we had the donut wheel, both also very good.  Heads up though - the donut wheel comes with 11 large donut holes and a few dipping sauces, and was too much for me and my dining companion, even taking them with us as leftovers.  One thing that would have been nice is if they had noted the birthday on our reservation - they didn't offer a greeting at any point of our meal so I had to ask for "happy birthday" writing to be put on our dessert.  Still, I can give CATCH 4 stars based on my experience.

3mZNpfIrzChaamU2zMEjFA.text: Wow! I mean Wow!!! This place is amazing from the gorgeous fairytale, floral entrance that surprises your senses with so many colors and picture op (had to add that in lol)...if you werent excited you will be now.   Reservations are a must!! They do allow walk ins but expect to wait awhile. It's a fairly large restaurant but they are jam packed so book that spot now!!   Decor: all I gotta say is I haven't seen a place with so much to see. Absolutely beautiful!  We were greeted by the hostess and sat within 5 min of checking in, yes we had a reservation. We were seated and within minutes our server, Ed greeted us with extreme friendliness. He explained a few things on the menu, gave us a few recommendations and took our drink order.   We took Ed up on some of his recommendations and we were not disappointed.  We love the whole sharing factor, you can try so many different things!!   Dishes: *Truffle sashimi - YES you MUST TRY!!! *Crispy Shrimp- more of a traditional, simple dish. Didnt shock me but if you like cooked shrimp this is a good option *Catch Ceviche- wow the mango and orange with the ponzu sauce, no words *Trio Tartar- so many flavors all at once *Scallop Gnocchi - not my favorite, but my girls loved it * Spanish Grilled Octopus - YES another MUST try!!! *Mango Shrimp Roll- they serve it with a spicy type sauce, YUMMM we kept the sauce to use with other dishes LoL. Yes that good! *Sticky coconut cake- loved this, the sorbet looks like a coconut shell and with the mango sauce it mixed so well with one another *Hit Me Chocolate Cake- Really cool delivery, not a huge chocolate fan but I do gotta say this cake wasnt as sweet as it looked so I ate alot LOL.   Presentation of each dish was 5 stars!!! When served each dish was explained very well.   Service overall definitely 5 stars!!! Ed was attentive and our food came in a very timely manner. He checked on us just enough for us to be extremely happy and super satisfied with our first time to CATCH. We will be back for sure!!!!

oce2RgG9Qa85a_rMpvKl6g.text: I really want to like this place, I really do because they have vegan menu and they have a great selection of seafood plus it's my anniversary dinner that my husband secretly planned.    But this place is LOUD and NOISY and I am not loving the service.   The waiter interrupted us few times; also the bus boys.  I guess they focus how fast the tables can turn around way more than customers service  The alcohol is really expensive here too.  I can buy the entire mini bottle of the sake for the price they charge here in a shot.  The wines as well.  They charge $40 a glass for a bottle that average cost around $35. We really should have brought our own wine, again I emphasized to my husband. Lol  FYI.  I live in Vegas so I am not a tourist and usually not used to tourist / casino pricing either.   Tonight it's a special night and we do like to splurge ourselves few times a month.   One thing that blew my mind is how uncomfortable the seating is.  My legs are cramped.    Okay.  Let's get to the food.  The food is actually good. LOL.  I know!!! The only savior of the night.  Some dishes are super salty though like the beet salad.  I did like my sashimi trio and cut rolls.  My husband also likes his bronzino.    But since we have been feeling so rushed this entire night.  We are leaving!!!  Ordering was rushed, appetizer was rushed, sipping wine was rushed.  For a $300 dinner that we have to be rushed and finish in 45 mins.  YES, that's why I am giving only 3 stars.  Not because the food but because of everything else especially the service.

ivKSbAlmBhBMq-kUJHIz_Q.text: My friend and I visit LA and Las Vegas several times a year. I have always wanted to try Catch in LA but decided against it based on their Yelp reviews and attitude that "celebrity" status comes before everyone and everything else.   After discussing Catch with some of the Aria Luxury Experience staff and a few managers of Aria restaurants where we are "regular" visitors, we decided to give Catch in the Aria a try.   The restaurant is beautiful. The food is excellent and our service was top notch. Maybe this is because we are pretty often visitors to the Aria but regardless I found the staff friendly, knowledgeable and on top of their game. Each dish we tried was done to perfection and is exactly what you'd expect from a high end sushi type restaurant. The highlight was the Catch roll and torched crab leg (we had to order another one after the first...it was that good).   The "hit me" chocolate cake was delicious but definitely big enough for two to share.   I will probably still pass on Catch LA but will go back to Catch Vegas.

3cn2KEK0PmmnbU7szjXFww.text: I finally got to try Catch!!! I must confess I insisted on coming here so that I could have the "Hit Me" cake.  The Place: The restaurant is beautiful! It has a modern and trendy atmosphere. I made reservations for my husband and me at 9 pm. I was disappointed when the host took us to our table.  It was super small and felt cramped. There was a group of 4 people to our right and a couple to our left. The table was so small that we could not put the menus on it. I had a claustrophobic attack and kindly requested our waiter for other seats. He graciously agreed and took us to a better table.    The Food: As the name suggests, Catch specialty is Seafood, but the menu has steaks too. For seafood, they have Cold, Raw Bar, Sushi, tapas, and main dishes. The price of the food is on the expensive side.   *We got the "Catch Ceviche," it was amazing! Maine lobster, scallops, shrimp, crab, mango, and a blood orange sauce that made it so distinctive.    We had the "Crispy Whole Snapper" to share with truffle fries. The fish was delicious. I have had fried fish before, but this is one of the best I have had. The crust was delicious, and the fish inside was so juicy! I loved it! They bring the dish so you can take photos and they take it to get the bones out.   The dessert menu was interesting too! But I was on a mission, so we chose the "HIT ME." A delicious chocolate cake with dulce de leche, liquid klondike inside a chocolate cake. I was the happiest person in the world when I hit it. I thought it was a pretty cake, but when I tasted it I was blown away!    We had the food with a margarita and "MO'jito MO'problems." I think the mojito was OK, nothing really to say about it.  The Service: The staff was friendly and professional. I liked the way the first waiter handled my request for a bigger table. Our second waiter was pleasant. He was not very talkative, but he gave us a couple of suggestions.   I do want to come back! I wish I could afford it!

xmZ2M0cR3iKknMzTP1EPoQ.text: This NY upscale Asian style seafood & sushi lounge is similar to Tao in which it has a hip and club vibe as the place is hopping and at 10pm a live DJ starts spinning classic hip hop (at least on the Monday night). The menu has variety of small bites, small plates, sushi & larger entrees all meant for sharing. Started off with their skewers of:  Chicken Meatballs - a breadcrumb type crust over a juicy meatball accompanied with a hoisin dipping sauce.  Eggplant - Light grilled and very well prepared with a miso dressing.  Beef- tender but needed some finishing salt.  Other dishes shared were grilled octopus over a saute potato goodness that was probably the star of the dish; truffle fries that had plenty of truffle flavor and was McDonald styled tasty. The lobster mash potatoes was ok, so use your calories on something else.  The main dish was a whole snapper from head to tail and was lightly battered served over vegetables and accompanied with a similar hoisin sauce. The meat was tender at some parts and they will filet for you if desired.  For dessert the donut wheel of cake style donut holes covered with sugar and served with caramel, raspberry & chocolate sauces rounded out the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Snapper

w-wAxWEVUVbGICr8DZ0C2Q.text: Since the opening of Catch, it has been on our list of restaurants to check out. We made a reservation on Open Table for a 730pm reservation, w/ a note that it was our anniversary. We happened to arrive about an hour early in hopes we could get in early. Nope. They gave us the option to sit on a high top table in front, but wouldn't place us on a list of possible tables to be sat early. I asked if we would receive a text or given a device to notify us if when our table was ready. Another no. We were instructed to return closer to our reservation time. Odd that in a technology based world, an establishment that takes pride in their atmosphere from the moment you arrive, doesn't have a service that you other establishments are using to contact their guests who are off property.   Arriving at Catch is amazing. Their hallway makes you feel like you're being transported to another world. The Instagram worth Catch bench along w/ a butterfly photo opt are inserted in this same walk way. Coming or going it's so fun to walk thru. We walked out to grab a drink elsewhere since it was LOUD in the front of the house of Catch. Upon returning, Catch's security stopped me w/ a glass of whiskey. No outside drinks. I haven't been to a casino restaurant where not only do they have security, BUT I can't take a drink in from another place. I threw back my whiskey and walked into Catch to check back in. Arrived back at 725pm. We were sat at 750pm. This is where that device or text service comes in handy. We could've stayed at another bar or establishment until our table was ready.  As we walked through the dining area it just got louder. Then we were taken to another room which was much quieter. The room was curtained off due to lack of reservations I'm guessing. We were greeted within minutes by our server, who immediately wished us happy anniversary. That was key as we've been to several places booked through Open Table w/ notes, to which the establishment/server doesn't read. Our server got right into the specials and recommendations.   We ordered our drinks and made friends w/ the table next to us. We asked what they ordered, which happen to be a couple items our server recommended.   Truffle Sashimi - Tuna, Hamachi, Chili Oil, Ponzu, Caviar, Black Truffle - This just melts in your mouth, break out the drooling emoji!  Catch Roll - Crab, Salmon, Miso Honey - Again another great selection, SO tasty  Lobster roll - Maine Lobster Salad, Potato Roll, Chive - These are smaller than what you may think of an actual lobster roll. The bun isn't warm. Still good, but from experience a warm bun is DEF better.   BLUEFIN TORO SCALLION - wasn't feeling this one due to the flavor  SPICY JAPANESE YELLOWTAIL - Good, same quality I've found at other sushi places in Vegas off the strip  The food was good. I honestly expected it to be better, like all of it. W/ the presentation at the front of the house, the delay on being sat and being on the strip it added up to it should be better tasting than what it was. Our neighbors who ended up being locals said the same thing. The first two items we ordered we were we expected the flavors and tastes to be. From there, everything declined.   Catch is a cool experience. If you're going for the experience for Instagram, you can take your photos w/o having to eat the food. The food itself, there's comparable and better sushi found on and off the strip for less of the cost. I will say our server though was always attentive.

yNSfGc3SQkEqYwnTGyoqpw.text: Catch is one of those Strip restaurants that has the glitz and glam and full bankroll support of the casino, without the food to match. This isn't to say that the food is terrible, but rather it's not anything special that you can't find at any sushi restaurant. But, if you pick and choose, there are some golden nuggets within the menu without having to go overboard on the price.  We started off dinner with the truffle sashimi from the signature cold plates, skipping the rest of the raw bar and cold options. Despite the $31 price point, we all enjoyed the chili oil, ponzu, caviar and black truffle atop delicious pieces of tuna and hamachi. We tried a few more of the hot plates to start off the meal including the crunchy rice cakes ($26 for 4), grilled Spanish octopus ($24) and the scallop gnocchi ($29). The crunchy rice cakes are something you might find commonly at any sushi or AYCE sushi restaurant. This was no different with tuna tartare and wasabi tobiko atop a fried rice cube. I still get it and enjoy it every time. The scallop gnocchi with bay scallops, soft fluffy gnocchi topped with parmesan and black truffle was my fiancee's favorite. I thought the octopus was well cooked and tender.   For entrees, we skipped the big fish and meat and instead got the yakiami style whole dorade ($44) and the organic crispy chicken ($34). The dorade was boneless and surprisingly well-flavored. I especially enjoyed the soy mirin truffle emulsion. It was slightly on the salty side and needed something to cut it, like rice, but still very good. The chicken tasted like a really good shake and bake chicken breast. Still, it was very tender and juicy - which is all I can ask for in restaurant-cooked chicken. We also tried the crispy Brussels sprouts as a side, which had an interesting yuzu-calamansi vinaigrette with dry miso - again slightly on the salty side.  We ended dessert with the eye-catching "hit me" chocolate cake ($19) and the sticky coconut cake ($16). I'm a sucker for coconut, so that one was my favorite. The chocolate cake featured a liquid "Klondike" block which you were supposed to break unleashing a flow of chocolate onto the layers of dulce de leche ice cream brownie & Devil's food. Rich and decadent is an understatement.  The name, Catch, itself is somewhat deceiving in that, I fully expected a seafood heavy menu, when in fact, it featured more Asian fusion flavors. The dining experience is centered around the ambiance including the entrance and dining room, which are quite elegant - so much so, that we witnessed a couple get engaged in that tunnel of flowers afterwards. If you can stomach the price, it's a fun experience. Just know that many items can also be found at AYCE sushi restaurants. Basically skip the rolls and nigiri and cold plates and order ones that have truffle in the description.

q-sB622UQxInaNd2bS-nfA.text: I made an opentable reservation for 6:45pm. Showed up at 7pm exactly. Waited for them to help the people in front of us and when I got to the front, the Asian hostess with the heavily mascaraed lashes (who claimed to be the assistant manager?) said that 15 minutes was the grace period for reservations and it was 7:02pm so our table was gone. I was shocked. Making a reservation is supposed to be for the convenience of the guest. She offered to seat us at a high top table in the bar area. I was not interested in sitting at a two seater in the bar area sandwiched between two other parties so we went back and nicely demanded another seat. They sat us in the main area at a table that was half a couch and half a chair. Kind of annoying but better than sitting at the loud bar area. The place was busy but there were definitely many other tables available. This really gave our dinner a bad start.   It should have been nice. The decor in there was amazing. There is a super instagrammable entrance. You walk through and it feels like magic. Til you reach the host stand and have to deal with BS. Once seated, our server was nice. We ordered the seafood tower, which was delicious and filling and then got a lobster roll, the lobster mac and cheese and the crispy brussel sprouts. Finished the meal off with the "hit me" dessert which was like a liquid klondike bar over a chocolate dessert. I was happy with the food although with pricing like this, the people working there should be more welcoming and accommodating. I am docking two stars because that was not a good way to start off a nice, expensive meal and there are definitely many other great options in Vegas for you to spend your hard earned money at.

-_GOJl0CPK1HARx3V1vfCA.text: Style over substance isn't necessarily a bad thing and Catch is a great example.  If I wanted sushi and seafood at this price point, Zuma at Cosmopolitan would be the better choice, but you can't tell me this place isn't a good time!  The "if Gabi Coffee and Bakery had millions of dollars to spend" atmosphere, decor and vibe are big reasons why this is a spot I'd gladly return to; preferably with a group so I could sit in one of those cool birdcage booths.  We started with "Toro Tartare"....and sent it back after two bites because the sauce it was wading in was a complete turn-off.  When enjoying high quality ingredients like fatty tuna and caviar, less is more and even the half wedge of lime on the side suggesting it be squeezed over everything is like inviting a cat to piss on a Persian carpet.  It was great after they brought it back sans sauce and I suggest you get it that way.  "Yakiami Style Whole Dorade" with cippolini onion, heirloom tomato, capers and soy mirin truffle emulsion was my favorite dish of the night and would have been even better with rice.  Perhaps due to an overwhelming amount of booze by this point in the evening, I prefaced my request to the server as "This may be the most Asian thing I've said today, but can I get a bowl of white rice?"  They unfortunately were unable to accommodate since only sushi rice was available.  I got over it quickly though because the "Sauteed Wild-Caught Snapper" was delicious as well with the filet sitting on top of a tasty lobster mash with truffle and lemon brown butter.  The tableside blowtorch to the "Catch Roll" was fun and memorable, even if the taste of the crab, salmon and miso honey combination somehow wasn't.  The $52 whole lobster cocktail was kind of like not going all the way; although really nice with the curry dip, it wasn't worth the price and I'd just go with a full seafood tower instead, which includes it.   "Sticky Coconut Cake" with coconut water sorbet and mango sauce was a nice combination of sweet and tart to end it all.    3.751111119 stars

MzWlF_MzrmmG6UXZ7aWtiw.text: Catch has an amazing entrance and energy! The staff is very attentive. We were a little early for our reservation so they seated us in the bar, but they had our table ready before we could order drinks.   We noticed some tables wrestling with their orders. I think some people were unfamiliar with the fusion style food. We ordered the seafood tower and a bluefin roll. It was a great way to get a taste of almost everything. A couple of glasses of Veuve Cliquot was the perfect pairing. The #HitMe chocolate cake is a spectacular finish.

SrJvDcW4lBUh1Sml3lD6Bw.text: CATCH Las Vegas is truly a CATCH! My friends surprised me for my 30th birthday and decided to arrange a nice little dining experience here. Now because I love seafood, this place has always been on my radar and with all of the great marketing they do around Las Vegas, it was hard for me not to bookmark this place! Little did I know, I would be provided an opportunity to eat here a lot faster than I realized. AWESOME!   Reservations are strictly followed here, meaning that your entire party needs to be present in order to be seated so yeah my friend that was late made us all wait but the food made up for it, that's for SURE! Once we were seated, I noticed the ambiance was even more dreamy inside! The iconic walkway with all the flowers and that whole garden feel is super cool. Now, please note that the music here is REALLY loud so be prepared to yell at whoever you are sitting with and that includes giving your order to your server! We all started with a round of drinks which were awesome! Drinks ordered: Meatpacking Manhattan(super strong and I loved it), East Coast Cocktail and Sauv Blancs.  Our server Joseph was amazing as he made some very good recommendations to the table! Each and every item that we ordered was nothing short from amazing! Talk about a knock your socks off type of dining experience. I like the whole sharing concept and putting the dishes on the spinning wheel deal. I felt like we ordered a feast of a meal but with 4 people, everything ended up being just enough food without having to worry about left overs. Pricey but it's extremely worth it! A Must try if you're in Vegas kind of place!

ksPJJ2e48TVFFpvNnDodYA.text: WOW!!!  If you are looking for an incredible, high-end meal with impeccable service then this is your place.   We came as a party of four, including two weird allergies. The waiter was super receptive, and said he would make sure everything was prepared properly or inform us if we should order something else. So professional. He explained anything and everything on the menu by memory, made suggestions, and was just more like a guide through a fun evening than a server. Kudos to him.  But more importantly, the food was so delicious. We got excited and ordered a lot! The cocktails were strong, unique, and balanced. Well done. We ordered the Tempura King Crab and Grilled Ocotopus appetizers. Oh my god. The tempura batter was so light, and the crab was perfectly tender. Dipped in the accompanying ponzu type sauce was absolutely delicious. A unique take on the usual tempura. The octopus was cooked just right- tender and not chewy. The whole dish was beautiful.  For entrees we had the seared ahi tuna, scallops & cauliflower, and filet mignon. All of them were perfect. The tuna steak was prepared just as requested, and was presented beautifully. The scallops was so soft, and a little crispy right on the top. The cauliflower and sauce made for little delights in every bite. And the filet! Served as two small medallions, they were as tender as any steakhouse we've visited. It had some kind of wine sauce that really added to the depth. For sides, we had the Brussels and sweet potatoes. Both also incredible! The sweet potatoes were a little spicy and sweet- a flavor profile I hadn't experience with that veggie.  Overall, such a wonderful evening. Highly recommend for a nice night out, date, or special occasion. Oh, and the place is beautiful as well. Bonus!

Tb2c_F5TxiRscb0nQEcVzg.text: "Selfie time!  Can you guys move?  I only want myself in it" says Midwest poker bud as he preens himself for his phone.  "Prima donna.  Actually more like Madonna" I mutter in response.  Catch, an impressive re-invention of LA and NYC hot spot eateries scaled way up for the Vegas world of excess.  Reclaimed wood comingled with contemporary flair make for an impressive dining space.  High vaulted ceilings and brightly lit display of liquor, a stunning, welcoming bar.  Retro contemporary elegance, a plush lounge.  Nooks abound for shameless social media self promotion.  Oh and the food is great!  Asian influenced, fresh and seasonal.  For example, the truffle sashimi starter.  Maguro and hamachi are sliced thin and folded over.  They are drizzled with and sit in a pool of broken chili oil and ponzu vinaigrette.  Black truffle puree and caviar sit atop.  Earthy, oceanic, spicy, acidic flavors all play off the clean, slightly sweet fish flavors.  Excellent.  The A5 Miyazaki wagyu, as good as any.  Thin sliced, sprinkled with sea salt and sesame seeds.  Grill it on one side on the hot stone allowing the salt to melt into the fat, reroll and dip into the yuzu / soy / garlic oil sauce.  Good eats.  The tender grilled Spanish octopus with sofritto and garlic aioli over a bed of crispy potatoes and perfectly cooked scallop gnocchi with black truffle and parm both mouthwatering good.  Finally, the whole branzino.  Oven roasted, head on, whole fish, spine removed and butterflied open before being stuffed with a stir-fry of pattypan squash, whole baby zucchini, artichokes, tomato and wilted arugula all dressed in a tangy citrus vinaigrette.  Perfectly cooked, the flavors work well together.  Very good.  The only weak point, sushi.  Not the best rice, over seasoned and sticky.  Not the highest quality, freshest, sashimi grade seafood.  (uni, tako and saba sampled).  Pedestrian.  The "Catch roll", reverse roll of crab, rice on the outside topped with fatty salmon and finished with a miso honey is good but the rolling looks like an armature did it.  Unappetizing.  Service is clumsy and lacks confidence.  It will improve with time.  Solid mixology program.  Good wine list.  High Vegas resort markup.  Worthy of its home in Aria.

d21-wmn0eEfLJgVGRhKbSA.text: It's good sushi no doubt.  It is expensive no doubt.  It is assaultingly loud no doubt.  The 'chef' is inflexible with slight modifications to food... i.e. no advocado, rainbow on top, etc.  For up to $200+ a person, out a piece of salmon on the roll of the salmon if that is what the customer wants.  If it's a new waiter, instead of having crappy service, offer him help when he needs it, don't wait for the customer to ask for the manager to help him get food an hour after he ordered it.  To the management: no one walks into Catch expects a free meal, or to have a cheap meal.  When everything goes wrong, instead of discounting the meal try committing to excellence the next time a customer comes back and then you won't be reading reviews like this.    We don't need free food, we want calm, competence and good food!  All the time!!  I ate there three times last week and had 3 different experiences, all too loud!

wsMq0sUkDw1mppFEth5f1A.text: Is the second time I came here in that week. This time we came to celebrate birthday of our friend. We made a reservation for 4 people to 8:30pm. On the desk the girl told us to wait at the bar until our table will be available. We waited over 45 min to be sedated!  This kind of service just make us feel so bad. The taste of the food is not matter when the service is like that! The manager Michelle didn't know how to handle the situation well, NOT PROFESSIONAL! Very disappointing

Ham5balg-ahdtxSk3XpLHw.text: Bar none best new restaurant in Vegas. The flavors. The ambiance. I am a huge fan and it's going to be our new spot. Thank you to Ed for the fabulous service. This kind of service and food is something this LA girl has been missing in Vegas. A+

uAg62emoauc4nwWcVrbW8Q.text: Definitely deserving of 5 stars. The food was excellent and the service was top notch. The sashimi with truffles, Spanish style grilled octopus were so yummy, everything we ordered were delish!  Our dessert was so decadent!  The staff were very attentive and very knowledgeable of what's on the menu. Our server's recommendations were on point, so delish! Since we're locals, we will definitely be back!  Although I hate going to the strip but for Catch I'll make that drive back!

seVk8OovJFkcHwJ95zDgjw.text: I happened to be in Vegas the night of their opening so decided to check it out. The best thing about Catch was the photo area at the entrance. We were so excited when we first arrived and it went downhill quickly.  We looked at the menu and the food being served at the table next to us and started to get a bad feeling. We go to Las Vegas for the food and the standards in this city are very high. The server proudly told us the focus of the menu was truffles... I wish he would have told us that that just meant everything gets doused in cheap truffle oil.   We spent much of the evening laughing about what a big mistake we made. This is the last time I will go to a restaurant opening in Vegas... I will stick to places that have enough real reviews to judge their quality. All the positive reviews for this place are by people who live in Vegas and are from before the restaurant opened.

jC9lyarwYfWR7CRPyevJzg.text: We came here around 8pm had a reservation for 12 people, still waited to be seated for like 20 mins. Japanese A5 wagyu was delicious, must eat!!! Japanese matcha green tea wasn't impressive, was offering a tea bag, wish they had better quality of green tea. Lobster mac & cheese I also liked it, good amount of lobster in it. Scallop gnocchi, taste weird, not recommended!

ga7pdlS0H8rZLWaRO2A2fg.text: As you can see, this place is breathtaking instagram-able in every way possible. It's whimsical and fantasy inspired decor is why I wanted to come here. Came with a group of girls for a pre club birthday party and it didn't disappoint. Service was decent and surprisingly fast considering it was packed. Only giving 4 stars because the food was just ok- to be honest, it reminded me of PF Chang's... only more expensive.

FHmBbn9T0AcALJiDjWRj7g.text: I went to Catch for the first time with a friend on opening night, and everything went off without a hitch - service was great, and drinks & food were delicious! The second time I went to Catch, however, was a completely different story. While the food was still amazing, the service definitely left a bad taste in my mouth that would make me think twice about ever dining at this restaurant again.   My second time at Catch, I went with two others who had never been before. We had a reservation, we arrived on time, and it still took them 30 minutes to seat us. We saw about five parties, both large and small, who checked in after us get seated long before we did. The hostess seemed unconcerned and unapologetic about our frustrations and did not exhibit any customer service basics by any means. The extremely poor service we received from the hostess ruined the rest of the experience at Catch for the others in my party for the rest of the night.   As far as food goes, over my two visits, I've tried the below and all were AMAZING: - Truffle Sashimi (a must!) - Catch Ceviche - Hellfire Roll - King Crab Tempura - Wagyu Short Rib Tacos - New York Strip - Lobster Mashed Potatoes - Hit Me Chocolate Cake - Sticky Coconut Cake (my fave of the two desserts I tried)  The food is definitely 5 stars. 2.5 stars overall because of the bad service.

ALaB4tONLtW9hODzPh-RZw.text: Instaworthy photo op as you walk into this eatery.  I went for the mocktail and I got the rejuvenator.  The drink was so on point- tasted just like one i would've gotten at Juice Press.   The service was impeccable.  Shout out to Michael L!!  Before I could ask for a plate change or water, the server read my mind and got it.  Our lamb took awhile and before I could ask what was taking so long, the chef sent out a hamachi special to hold us down since it was taking longer than expected.  When it finally got here, the lamb with the pesto sauce was cooked to perfection.  I topped it all off with a lobster mash.

cOIWVnfUvn52WrsiSwtaiQ.text: Meh. Too expensive for the portions and overall taste/quality. I mean, $16 for an order of fries.....Come on now. 6zJs0Tvf-aLMpSkGb5nB1A.text: Came to celebrate an anniversary and the second she saw the walkway to the restaurant she adored it. ORAuOUMo5YcFebko7vjwwg.text: Right off the gettyup this place is a 3 star because of the service.  Food is excellent.  Nigiri is on point, def up to par.  Scallop risotto was 5/5.  We were Brought sashimi instead of nigiri and when tequila was ordered chilled it came neat.  I would rather have great food instead of great service, so don't be afraid to give this place a try.

bdW6K_HhWwEtAPm-Z-nYUA.text: If you can get a reservation this place definitely does the popular Los Angeles eatery proud. I'd recommend using Open Table to avoid wasting time. I stuck with something easy and got a dozen mid sized East Coast Oysters to start and they were super fresh and absolutely delicious. Then I tried the Spicy Shrimp appetizer which wasn't that great, however the Filet Skewers were made to perfection, so I had to order another plate of them. To be honest after 12 Oysters and 4 Skewers and 4 Cocktails, I was stuffed! But I saw another table that had some delicious Chocolate Chip Cookies and I had to order the same, and they came out freshly baked, warm and gooey! I was in heaven and ready to go to bed to be honest! Damn you CATCH! I'm in Vegas, now I need a 4 Hour energy!   The staff was amazing, the ambiance was superb, and I can't wait to return!

vYkKlMUiX21k6ZIHo7mQXQ.text: Simple review. Claimed Gluten Free by menu, and server.  Contamination.  Made them aware of severe Gluten allergy.  My dinner companion extremely ill.   Irresponsible kitchen.  Spoke with manager Jason.  "Very sorry, and I will look into it".   Okay. Then what?    Google Celiac and learn a thing.  Please take GF label off of your menu.  Not worthy.   Same review.  Never heard back from them. Please don't offer gluten free .  Fine.  Since you asked, "I love Sushi in Henderson serves much better quality sushi , and they are more creative with their menu.    Expensive trendy

eazU3nh27OLppcEuehGfpQ.text: This is a shareable Asian inspired cuisine, all the plates are pretty small so don't be afraid to order what your heart desires. My co worker and shared a few bites; I personally do not eat fish but she LOVED the catch roll. The beet salad was delightful light and crisp. We ordered sweet potato cashew fries so so good no extra sauce needed. I got the steak skewers it was one of the most buttery soft beef I have ever had. They sever a salty soy sauce it's great with and without. The cauliflower was crispy and full of flavor. We had some cocktails as well I had a pineapple train wreck highly recommend ! Not too sweet very well balanced. I tried going to wine tried the Malbec by the glass it was gross don't get it; tasted corked but the table next to us ordered a bottle and said the same. I also got lush lemon aid had to be my favorite drink but it can get you in trouble. (Can't taste the liquor) the sever was sweet to bring me a lemon drop shot for my birthday and we ordered this slice of heaven chocolate cake with a sauce that was inside a hard chocolate shell and ice cream. The reason for the four stars was because we had reservations and people that arrived after us were sat before us. We waited 45 mins after our checking in on time. Other than that server was great, food bomb !, and the oasis feel from the beautiful garden throughout the venue. I recommend everyone try this place if you enjoy small delicious bits it's worth the wait.

mPrNsr2X4cvds2m1B3hsaA.text: My husband and I decided to take a few friends here for the first time, and we truly enjoyed it! They have a very large selection of Sake. Our favorite is Funaguchi! Must try! Here are the items we've ordered! Delicious! We will be back!

O_YiUw2vhshojgUX6magIg.text: Don't bother!! Absolutely agree with all the bad reviews. When we made reservations they asked us if we were celebrating something. I informed them it was our anniversary. When we arrived, which BTW was the first sign that it was going to be bad, there were a dozen hostesses and only one could help you! Really? They mentioned they saw that it was our anniversary yet they never did or said anything to reference our anniversary. The bill was $400 for us and our teenage kids. Not unheard of for fine dining, however, this was FAR from fine dining. The Crispy shrimp and the truffle sashimi were the only good items.  Note: 0 STARS is not an option.  P.S. If anyone knows Gordon Ramsey can you tell him to check this place out?

iquKRZ7jr9efEoTF0gLRdQ.text: Went here on NYE and had a great time. We were 30 min late for our reservation because NYE traffic was horrible.  But they hostess was very accommodating and didn't make a fuss. We were sat after about 20 min.  The atmosphere is fun and exciting. It's loud with conversation, just the way I like it. The only complaint is that the tables are SO CLOSE to each other, you are basically elbow to elbow with the table next to you. I recommend this restaurant for groups, but it is NOT a romantic vibe. You cannot be having romantic conversations unless you want everyone around you to contribute LOL.  All the food we ordered was delicious.  The beet salad, was sweet and tender, the perfect start to our meal.  We also ordered oysters, which were fresh and amazing.  For entrees, we ordered the whole roasted Branzino and the 1.5lb King Crab legs. I was in freakin' heaven.  The only thing I'd do differently next time is course out the crab legs first, and then once those are done, ask for the Branzino because cracking crab legs takes too long and I couldn't properly pay attention to the Branzino.  Also, they had crackers, but no small forks. Either a bib is needed or they should cut tiny slits in the crab legs so it's not so much work to crack them open.  Regardless, it was a lovely $300 meal and I can't wait to go back.

uGvrPrlfXDAQYHqTCBEuCg.text: I've been to the Catch in LA numerous times. They set the bar high but the Vegas location misses that mark by a lot. We arrived 15 minutes early and they asked us to sit at the bar to wait for our table. One of your hostess is miserable, she hates her job and can't even fake a smile to welcome people. Isn't that part of her job? I have to add, our reservation was at 6:30, the night was just starting, the restaurant wasn't packed. It's too early to be in a bad mood.   We were finally seated after our reservation, which they blamed on their system not allowing them to give us a different table. Not a big deal, until we saw how small our table was, and how close it was to the table next to ours. No joke, there must be 8 inches between tables. As our neighbors arrived, the girl squeezed in to sit down, dragggggging her butt on top of our table. Our server was apologetic, but that didn't fix anything.   I wish we had spent $200 somewhere else. Save your money and go to Cleo or another restaurant at Aria. When you go out for dinner, you don't pay $200 to sit 8 inches from another table. You've left a bad taste in your customers mouth, that will likely never give you business again. The fake flower wall isn't worth a $200 dining "experience" when you can't have a private conversation at your table with a date.

ttD924ImaNWGzoDwFMt-Ew.text: Ok ... I don't know where to start... 5 star for the ambiance... love the decor, walking in to the restaurant is just magical... I'm not a fan of the noise level, it was pretty loud in there, I like a nice quiet ambiance to enjoy a nice meal and chat with my friends where I don't need to yell in order for them to hear me. Food is really over priced, I mean I am willing to spend $$$$ on fine dining, but I feel most of the time I do the food delivers, make me feel like it's worth it. This was so mediocre, it wasn't special enough for me to return for the food. I actually wasn't a fan of their entrees, the appetizers were way better, it was spectacular actually, but then again if you are willing to pay $21 + tax for a cauliflower lol. The sweet potatoes, Brussels sprouts, broccoli are really my favorites. Cocktails are great as well. I think it's a great place if you want somewhere trendy, early 40's crowd, this is a place to grab some tapas, appetizer, and drinks and socialize.

I like that the bar is front and center. My husband and I didn't have reservations but we were able to get a seat at the bar. The food and drinks were very good. The bartender, Marcus, was on point! Quick with service and wit, he's hilarious. A True startender! He recommended the truffle sashimi, holy shit, mind blowing!!! I want to just swim in that truffle sauce. He also made some really good cocktails with a banana whiskey.

4KMr_paih-w_vXtbKAiGcQ.text: The ambiance is amazing! The customer service is on point! Our server MICHAEL was amazing! This was an amazing birthday dinner! Music was an awesome MIX! We are definitely coming back!!!!

pOr1x9GtNHv2mZaLMCdU9A.text: Really cool and memorable meal! The reviews warning about bad service almost made us cancel our reservation, but I'm glad we stuck with it. The service was great and the food was incredibly inventive! Would come back.

_y4C4ArNXT6GvYQhKYPp3w.text: Ladies, just come and take your pic at the fake flower wall and leave. I repeat, DO NOT DINE HERE!   I regret going here last night for my birthday. I was so excited so I made reservations early in advance. So why the 1/5 stars? The service was absolutely awful! It started with the rude, untrained and entitled hostesses who acted like they were too good for their job... RME. We had a 7 pm reservation, but they did not seat us until 7:40. The crazy thing is our table was available at 7 bc I checked inside to look for empty tables when they said we had to wait, and 7:40 comes along and they seat us at the table that had been empty since before 7. After waiting for 40 mins, you would think they'd apologize. Then our server... nice but improvement is much needed. He placed the dessert menu down then pushed it towards us, all without saying a word hahah. So weird and funny that I couldn't be mad.  As for the food, all overly salty. The only good thing was the truffle sashimi. *Advice to management, please train your employees on proper customer service bc you cant charge 5* prices and only provide 1* service.  *side note- the security at the entrance A+++, PLEASE promote him to become the new host. He greeted us upon entrance and said thank you and enjoy your night as we exited. As for the hostess, I guess they can't speak

hYXbef7It_tx_8ru4_7hwA.text: Hands down the best dinner I've ever eaten in Las Vegas. We wanted to make our own "Surf and Turf" (they don't officially have one), since it was Valentine's Day, and wanted to splurge. They were quite understanding, and set us up to do that, from the kitchen, instead of having to hack at the entrees by ourselves. The Filet literally melted in my mouth. And the fish that they recommended... I only wish I could remember its name, because it was delicious!! Server could not have been more courteous, with a fantastic smile, remembers everything, and checked in on us often. They even gave my wife a rose for Valentine's day when we were leaving. Wonderful place. I'd go back for certain.
