4T-9OMLN9uZgAJJUaS6MDQ.text: I so wanted to love this place, especially because the ambiance was stunning; and service was honestly 5 stars. However, the food was such a disappointment for the price. Paying $20 for dessert meant that my mind was about to get blown with innovative flavors and techniques. In reality, it meant that I was getting their version of a Klondike bar with chocolate cake. It was abysmal and the flavor profile severely lacked!

5NQDk95OL4-m7csAnfix4Q.text: Honestly I'm surprised this place doesn't have 5 stars. I loved this place: from the entrance, the decor, the bar, and not to mention the exquisite food. I'm not gonna lie, this place is so busy which might explain the bad reviews about service. We didn't receive bad service, we just had our server forget to put in an item which was ok because at the end we were so full. The server was really nice and recommended some items that we absolutely loved. My boyfriend loved the potatoes and he usually doesn't like them. All the food was beyond perfect!

FKTlYSXRbVASK4Rftwd99g.text: Beautiful decor with horrible service and terrible food.  SERVICE: dazed hostesses have no clue, snobby bartenders (the drinks were awful....watched her put what appeared to be oxidized avocado puree into my cocktail, it was so gross-I couldn't even drink it), pushy waiters who just want to sell you the most expensive items on the menu. Incompetent managers who don't know the first thing about hospitality.   FOOD: pedestrian sushi menu, poor quality, and even worse execution. Brussels sprouts were flavorless and uninspired. Desserts are gimmicky and do not taste good. Tables right on top of each other...literally had 6 inches of space between the table next to us.   I have nothing good to say about Catch except for that the entrance is "pretty".

jA6b7KxwvATyCFpHqhjbvg.text: Great place for photos! Amazing food, worth it! I wish I remembered my server's name, but she was energetic and friendly! I will be back for more!

aVipSaiE8tL1an9Y3n0NqA.text: We came here late in the evening to have a few appetizers after watching a show.   It was around 10 pm and the place was very full but luckily found a table near the bar.   We shared salmon carpaccio, spicy tuna roll, sea urchin sushi and Brussels sprouts.   The food was good though very pricy.  Being in Vegas I understand the high prices on fresh seafood or everything else but to pay $16 for Brussels sprouts was a little ridiculous.   We are used to paying the exactly same thing for $5 during happy hour in San Diego.    Anyway, we enjoy the food and the service was great.

98vm03qvCYH-x6npvz3HDA.text: I refused to believe to Yelp reviews here- but oh boy what a mistake!!! The food here is definitely a madiocre,mushroom spaghetti was more like a soup from a can,beef skewers-let's say it nicely..chilis beef is even better ! bernazino filet was far away from a good taste, spinach salad?? What the hack is this devastating sauce??king crab vegetarian -just an avg roll !  Now we're thinking that maybe the drinks and cocktails are better...they all too sweet and used the lowest quality of alcohol!

mNgmz8rNH73wR-jmvG2YAQ.text: We came here twice for my bday in July for dinner and a 3rd time for lunch at the bar we couldn't get enough of it. Everything on their menu was OUTSTANDING! The staff was fun and energetic. The hostesses were sweet and the ambience is very pretty! Great for photos. Don't plan on just walking in here and getting a table 9/10 you'll be waiting a while. Plan ahead and make a resv!!! Favorite dish  king Crab hand roll

0W_HFqsw9d6f8b4RuT5zMg.text: THIS PLACE IS SO CUTE!  We came here for an early birthday dinner and the ambience of this spot is spot on. My only issue with it was the music being a bit too loud, but otherwise, almost impeccable ambience.   We ordered the following:  truffle sashimi: this was to die for. The fish was very fresh and the truffle oil and caviar topping were very decadent and paired perfectly with the fish. I would order again   Snapper nigiri/yellowtail nigiri: very tender fish and very fresh. Would also order again   Wagyu Gyoza: I had never had wagyu in a gyoza and this was amazing. The beef is very tender and juicy while in the gyoza and I would also order this again.   Branzino plate: perhaps the best Branzino dishnive had. The fish is grilled to perfection and has a nice crisp to it.   Staff is very friendly and I would totally recommend for special occasions.

3NixtdQBEpPVxv7zoZm5eQ.text: Catch is truly a dream. From the moment you walk in you feel like you've entered a fairy tale. The ascetics are beyond perfection.  We came a little late in the evening (11pm-ish) and sat at the bar. We were ignored (this is the only bad thing about this review) so we sat at a cocktail table. Our cocktail waitress was extremely sweet. We had the lobster roll, cauliflower, and salmon carpaccio. Then the amazing food runner Alfredo sent over a truffled sashimi plate for us that had a dab of caviar. That was honestly the best dish I've possibly ever had in a restaurant. Since then I've brought in chefs to specifically try this item and every single one of them couldn't get over the unique and amazing flavors.  I absolutely love this venue and will continue to come back.

I6DCs_nBzmZLf2e6Fe97sA.text: Absolutely beautiful walkway through a flower garden but never any reservations available even days prior to your visit. No accommodations.   CATCH is located in Aria near the main lobby. We tried to make a reservation for 4 people two days before and they were "booked." Although, they do have a bar which is first come, first serve that does not require reservations. Luckily, we were able to find a spot on the bar where we ordered drinks and food. It worked out for us but seems as though they are unorganized.   The server was never around for us to order more food so we ended up closing our ticket and leaving which took 15min to even find the server to close out our ticket.   The food and drinks were definitely worth the inconvenience but some dishes were unnecessarily overpriced and not worth a penny.

9iBziGgJVMDKAZizdc8LXA.text: I see why the reno was nearly seven mil.  It's a stunning design, every detail.  But what I love most about Catch is that they didn't stop with the investment and attention to detail in paint and linens.... they cared just as much about the food.  The menu is a True focus in providing a culinary experience.  How do you even choose.  We opted for the seafood towers to get a variety (around $195) and we were not disappointed.  Some of the best sushi we have had.  The staff was attentive and the sommelier had wonderful wine pairing selections and recommendations.   Catch is worth your own time and dining investment.  Enjoy!

r1qRPGote8yab1VlJeoCng.text: The decor is beyond beautiful. But I think that is where all the money went for this place. The customer service starts great but then dies off during your meal, come get your empty plates, and can I get a refill of water? Then I felt rushed, we ordered 5 small plates because they said we had to order everything ahead so we did. They brought them out two at a time and our table was for two people. And then it was my wife's birthday and as a complimentary birthday item they bring her two chocolate chip cookies? Really???? After $225 meal that's what we get? I will stick to Nobu at the hard Rock. You get dishes with flavor, not bland blugh, awesome customer service, like you have 3 waiters on you st all time and you feel special there. And you can even use their Groupons which are incredible.   Thanks for the experience Catch but with so many wonderful restaurants that stand out in Vegas you won't Catch me or my money there again.

66zwtg1cgeKY1kFYAscAhg.text: I love everything about this place except for people blocking the entrance to get social media footage, but can't really complain as the decor is indeed breath taking and ask for a picture. We walked in at 7.15pm on a Saturday and it was busy but we got a spot on the bar corner ASAP. We ordered a drink. I had the watermelon cocktail which was delicious, exotically presented. Next to us there was a large bachelor party. They treated us to a glass of champagne for our cuteness, that was funny and unexpected. I just like to touch my boyfriend his bald head and that seems to be cute hahahaha.  We ordered the warm crab hand roll - an obvious as its the first thing we ate together at our first date in Miami 4 years ago:) it was delicious. The menu doesn't mention its a little spicy but it does give an afterkick. We ordered the  lobster avocado roll another hit. It comes with a spicy mango sauce but we both agreed we liked it better without it and just plain to take in all flavors. Our next order was the spicy tuna roll, I don't like spicy so I tried one piece which was mouth melting, but I couldn't handle the spicyness of it. We had a great time at Catch, very nice date spot but also good for any other occasion. If i would come back I'd hope to sit in the darker room on the right hand side when you walk in, I really liked the atmosphere there.

The Catch Ceviche has one of the most tasty, refreshing, and perfect sauces I've ever had. The sushi was very fresh, and the drinks were fantastic.  Worth topping off your meal with the "Hit Me" cake, it's flavorful, rich, and not too heavy. A definite must try on the Strip.

ixwijll_L-98wCtwzouE4g.text: Wow. What a cool place to eat. Definitely one of the more pricey dinner options but the food is really really good. They aren't just a place with "vegan options" they're a place that the chef clearly enjoys making vegan or plant based options. I appreciate that the option for "vegan" was plant based. It was healthy, filling and delicious. I should have stopped FAR sooner than I did on the "cheesecake" but it was killer. I was just disappointed in the service. It was inconsistent. For a 5 star dining experience I feel like we shouldn't have had empty glasses or been waiting for anything but we did. I realize it was busy but then price yourself as a 4 star restaurant would, or higher more experienced staff. I would absolutely come back to Catch if I ever come back to Vegas but they need to work on the service a bit.

l0btBWpLXKJo1xPqxbjRfQ.text: Great ambience and food! The entry way of florals is gorgeous. The food we ordered came out fast and was so delicious. We ordered the Avocado roll with Lobster and Mango Sauce, Hamachi Spinach, Crunchy Rice Cakes, and Yellow Tail and Toro Sushi. Sitting at the bar was comfortable and convenient. AXRxr-9pidpUmdfbdp-xPw.text: This is your go to place if you want to have a girls night out!!! From the moment you walk in the vibe with the upbeat top 40 music and decor is meant for a good Vegas night ahead and perfect for that insta pic.  I've been here on two different occasions and tried different things each time, the plates are definitely made to share.   For appetizers, I highly recommend the truffle sashimi it is the best thing on their menu...it is very rich and tasty (I love truffle). The crispy cauliflower with spicy mayo is another great appetizer with lots of flavor and more filling than the truffle sashimi (very similar to Nobus rock shrimp tempura). For sides, get the truffle fries they taste good on its own or paired with the New York steak, I liked that the fries have a lot of truffle taste not just a hint of it.   For entrees, the New York steak is great & the oysters tasted fresh and yummy even though I'm not a fan of oysters too much.   CONS: I also tried the grilled mahi mahi which tasted a bit too over cooked.  The catch roll has a great presentation but tasted too crabby for me which I didn't like.

ZFNJytay16m0cUJwkfxu-g.text: What a beautiful place! We arrived right around 5:30pm on a Tuesday evening. We sat in the dining room and we were immediately by our server (I can't remember her name but she was awesome!)   I started with the East Coast Kali cocktail which was amazing and my friend had the One Too Many. She also enjoyed the Pineapple Trainwreck. I tasted both and I'm convinced all of their cocktails are amazing.   For food we had sashimi which my friend thoroughly enjoyed. Next was lobster Mac and cheese, tempura crab, truffle fries. The lobster mac was very different than what you may be used too, lots of flavor. The tempura crab was my favorite. It was cooked just right. We would probably get two orders of that next time! The truffle fries were perfect. The right amount of truffle oil, Parmesan and herbs.   This was topped off by the Hit Me chocolate cake. That was also great! To state the obvious, this was a great experience. Music played the entire time at the perfect volume. We did not feel like we had to yell to hear each other. Catch is beautiful and lively.   Special shout out to Chris F. For ensuring we had a great experience. We'll be back soon.

wnQXFPXWm0BgpZksFYSaTg.text: Catch left much to be desired.  As a large group, we had different taste preferences and dietary restrictions. The waiter was extremely inappropriate.  The food was horrible.  The Crispy Chicken was dry. The Maine Lobster Avocado was bland. Everything else we had was not worth mentioning it.  Also, I inquired privately if the restaurant did anything special for birthdays. The waiter rudely stated in front of the birthday girl that Catch doesn't celebrate birthdays. It was a tragic experience.

Ns-lOI5Bo2HFTHJ3WE1GIA.text: Yes, I'm sure you can tell by now this restaurant is aesthetically pleasing to the eyes. From the entrance hallway all the way to the good lighting in the bathroom (lol yes, I'm serious) this is a place where you want to dress up and look your best.  Music wasn't too loud in my opinion. I could hear the song but I was still able to carry on a conversation. This seems like the new direction Vegas restaurants may be heading. "Nightlife restaurant dining experience" is what I would describe this. Their playlist had a lot of throwback r&b, a bit of hip hop, some pop. Think 2000s music genre. I personally enjoyed it. Please don't change the music format. It was great hearing 112's "Hey Luv." Haven't heard that in awhile...thanks for putting that back on my playlist =)  BF and I were here mid-February and we received solid service throughout our dinner. We were checked on multiple times...drinks were constantly replenished....the correct food items were delivered. Each waiter who brought out our food introduced the name of the dish, the ingredients and if applicable, the sauces used.   Most items are served more like tapa style. We ordered the following: -Truffle Sashimi....delicious! One of our favs of the night. -Filet Skewers...cooked to order. Delicious flavoring! I ordered this as my entree since I was too full from all the other appetizers. Comes with 3 skewers I think. -Hellfire Roll: spicy tuna two ways, pear, balsamic. Very interesting combo and we enjoyed it a lot!  -Spicy Tuna Roll -Crispy Shrimp....a little heavy on the spicy mayo so this can fill you up quick. -Mushroom Spaghetti. Sauce was good..wasn't too heavy on the mushroom taste. -and a side of crispy brussel sprouts.  For dessert...I already had my heart set on the vegan Pistachio cheesecake and man...that did NOT disappoint. It was heavenly!!!!!!!!!!!   All in all, it was a very beautiful night. Eye-pleasing decor, service was on point ANDDDDD the food was delicious. Reservations recommended.

bLjn0wZ81FWNgtGyGhFVmA.text: Catch is a super-trendy place to see and be seen inside Aria. The flowers on the walls leading up to the restaurant, make for great photo opportunities.   Sadly, the food did not live up to the hype, and everything seemed to be overpriced. Granted, I'm willing to pay good money for a good meal, but CATCH dropped the ball.   The highlight of the meal was dessert! The s'mores pizza with a crisp crust was oooh so good. I wish I could have had a pint of their burnt marshmallow ice cream to go. My friends and I were able to let out our frustrations from the lackluster meal with the "Hit Me" Chocolate Cake. The star of the show was the Donut Wonder Wheel, which attracted numerous people to our table to see it up close. Honestly, the Donut Wheel would have been more than enough for my friends and I to share, but we're greedy.   If the prices were slightly lower and the cooking just a tad bit better, then CATCH will totally fit into the Las Vegas foodie scene.

56QwQzR9ki8BN3jmZ-1gMQ.text: My friends and I came here on a Friday night, CATCH is located inside of Aria. We booked reservations ahead of time, lucky that we did since it was packed inside. The entrance to CATCH is beautiful, make sure to factor in some time before or after your meal to take some photos. Imagine a hallway covered wall to wall with flowers, my friends and I loved it! :)  We were seated right on time, our waiter Attapon was great. He quickly brought out waters and menus. He came back in a bit to take our orders and asked if we had any questions and gave us some recommendations. As a table we ordered the following: - Truffle Sashimi - This comes with Tuna, Hamachi, Chili Oil, Ponzu, Caviar and Black Truffle. The fish was so fresh and the sauce was perfect with it. It comes with four pieces of Tuna and four pieces of Hamachi, it is perfect to share with a group. - Catch 22 Roll - This roll comes with Crab, Salmon and Miso Honey. This presentation of this is super extra, a torch blows fire over the top of each sushi roll piece. There are five pieces total along with ginger and fresh wasabi. These rolls are STUFFED with crab and salmon, they do not skimp.  - Mahi-Mahi Wonton Tacos - This comes with three tacos with Mahi-Mahi, Guacamole, Tomatillo, Pickled Onion and Lime. I was really surprised at how delicious these tacos were... the fish was flavorful and all ingredients were fresh. It is a little messy to eat, but if you order tacos... what do you expect? ;) - Crispy Cauliflower - This comes with Cauliflower with Spicy Vegan Mayo. This was tasty, lots of little bites and so perfect to share with the table.  I have zero critiques or negative commentary on the food or service here. I was super impressed with how quickly the food came out, yet tasted fresh like it was just made for us. I am not sure why this spot has such a low Yelp rating, I had a wonderful experience. The menu is pricey, but it is worth it for the quality of the food. I would definitely recommend CATCH if you want a nice, sit down dinner with delicious food and great service :)

nWugKRwUXD-H4AxQV-Rq_Q.text: Such great food and a great atmosphere!! Must have the catch roll and leave room for the hit me cake for desert!

mFLpLG_sAsP4RSaLmR4C9A.text: Gordon Ramsay was sitting on the table next to us...need I say more?   The food was amazing. The service was great and the decor was TOTES Instagrammable lol   We ordered the truffle sashimi and it was SO good that we had a second order of it! These crispy shrimp and mahi mahi tacos were epic too. My hubby doesn't like seafood and he actually devoured all three plates. Can't wait to go back.

eIQhdhHcarKDENvdzGvePA.text: Break down my review.  Food: I've enjoyed everything. Recommend mosts  Truffle sashimi Lamb chops Miyazaki wagyu Catch roll All raw fish and sushi rolls I've tried were all good. Oyster shooter was good but be careful from tipping over the oyster.  Service: I've came a few times. One that stood out was Attapon. Not just cause of his name but cause of his recommendations all hit the spot. Did not disappoint!  As long as you have reservation. The hostess got our group sat within 5 minutes or less of checking in.  Ambiance: once you walk-in. It's instagramable. Music is at a decent volume to be able to hear across your table. And it's not thumping edm which is nice. It's definitely a hip vibe with a high end style. Which makes a perfectly night out dinner before going out for more drinks. If you're expecting for high class vibe. It's not the place to be eating at. Overall had a great experience.

_vVOai9_18akvUbxPdoH7g.text: Very disappointing experience.  Hostesses were pleasant.  And in general service staff was nice.  Service itself was ok. Why 2 starts ?! 1. Tables super small to fit your food.  2. Place is super loud and overpriced  3. Food was extremely tasteless.  Cauliflower bites had too much sauce.  eggplant skewers - too much sauce. , ceviche - not flavorful  At all.   4. Hand rolls - fish was completely tasteless.  I honestly could not even tell between yellowtail and salmon.  That's how flavorless it was      5. Grilled fish - super overpriced. Super blend and doesn't taste like fresh catch  In general.  Mediocre food below average. Overpriced. Loud place      Unlike other experiences - staff was on point.  Otherwise i would give 1 star.  Will not return

By8J8cEkul8MEB-4VxKwbw.text: We were on vacation in Las Vegas and stayed at the Aria. Catch Las Vegas is located within Aria and so we decided to make reservations here. Note: even though you make a reservation, we still had to wait more than 30 minutes to be seated. So not sure why there is a reservation for specific time slot so just be prepared. Had to knock off a star for this.  Ambiance: as many Instagram posts will show, this place is very nicely decorated starting from the entrance and throughout the entire restaurant. My wife really loved it and there are great spots to take photos! Inside the restaurant the tables are fairly close to one another and noise level is really high. Had to almost yell right across the table just to have a conversation. Another star off. Wish they had more ample space.  Food: our food was delicious! I ordered a variety of sushi dishes and a lobster Mac and cheese. My wife ordered chicken lettuce wraps. Great food but nothing amazing. We also had the HitMe cake since we had seen this to be the most popular dessert item. It's basically a chocolate cake with a Klondike ice cream sandwich on top. Once you crack it the vanilla spreads and makes it so good. Definitely recommend.

e_9DPPF1KLdguLfuaYzO_g.text: Came here with a group of friends! The atmosphere is great!!! The food was amazing. I'll list the foods that I tried during dinner. Lobster mashed potatoes (decent).  Lobster Mac and cheese (amazing).  Salmon (AMAZING, I absolutely love juicy, cooked to perfection sal

v8mTqrO6eaDjP5LYPjnRZA.text: Rudest host we have ever seen. Made a reservation and we were running late. Called numerous time to let them know and we got there he told us that he can't sit us.

uzwc0TG3HQKrt-NuIPNOPA.text: Portions can be a little small for such higher priced items but the food is great quality and the customer service was phenomenal.

DU6kglbzFtmCIKnQ5lCq9w.text: The decorations are phenomenal, the food are surprisingly tasty, only short coming is the seating is too crowded, i was able to hear everything about the next table's conversation. Space the table apart! We need some privacy dining at a romantic restaurant.

JVDjlwPEDxw6dNFN1IhW9Q.text: Mushroom spaghetti, crispy shrimp and waygu beef were amazing!!! Highly recommend. We sat at a table at the bar that was first come first serve and it was a great atmosphere.

gkLds2Shf6wtYuck23Ncyg.text: First time to Catch at Aria. Would highly recommend! Ambience was perfect. The service we received was excellent. Our server recommended several items and they all exceeded our expectations. Portions are small and should be spared. Food was pricey, but so worth it. Would highly recommend for seafood lovers and groups.

siLjKnt6qUIGO5PKgWfmEA.text: Not even sure why im giving this place 2 stars. Maybe because I was really hungry and I ate my food, so they fed me I guess. Lets start off with we had a reservation for 8:45PM for my sisters birthday, which was made way in advance. We arrive at 8:40PM and are told to wait around anywhere, not given a time when we would be seated. With reservations we expected that we would be seated shortly. We walked into the back bar and hungout there since there was no room to stand anywhere up front. After thinking "How will they know where to find us when our table is ready?" I decided to go tell them where we would be. They said they didn't need to know amd that someone would come find us when it was time to be seated. Maybe about an hour or so later we were finally seated. Again, not sure what the point of a reservation is. Immediately placed our orders. 5 people total, we expect nice place our food will be brought out together. Wrong. One plate comes out. A few minutes later next persons plate. Few minutes later the same. And so on. First plate out my sisters boyfriend takes a bite and goes "This is disgusting." Ends up ordering something else, ends up having to wait for basically everyone else to be done before his food is out. By that time im hungry again so place another order, because the portions are very small. So basically it was a waiting game. Bot to mention, pretty sure their "Special" water is just tap water. Overall crappy experience. We were pretty excited to try the place and expected alot more due to the waiting and high demand. Overpriced below average food. Dont waste your time. Best meal in Vegas by far was In-N-Out.

2Hy8cNHebwFmUCFJsLeYew.text: If I could make this "0" stars I would. This review is for the horrendously lazy staff. The food was ok a little over priced. There's waaaay better places to eat in Vegas and off the strip. We had reservations at 5:30pm super early before our flight so there's no wait, but we waited for 12 mins standing at the front of the restaurant while a dozen employees and at least 6 hostess chics walked around us. It's like they're still in training. Wtf! The the service here is so so disappointing here especially after having one of the most memorable and delicious eating experiences at Jose Andres "e".  The staff her could learn a lot from them. This is just another over priced, wannabe hipster trendy joints that doesn't really know what kind of restaurant it is, so I'm going to try and service you everything and hope something sticks kind of shit hole. We waited 20 mins for 2 out of 7 dishes to come out. Everything has too much sauce. Like it's trying to hide how basic everything is. Waste of calories. There's so much lag I've posted 3x while dining. Our waiter was nice. The truffle sashimi was pretty good. But if if you messed that up, u got real issues. Don't come here. It's a waste of time and money.

jejoHTe6k-kcX6xFC7Mlxg.text: Made a reservation for 3, we were told we could wait at the bar while our table was ready which wasn't a problem for us, the bar area was extremely loud for my liking definitely more of a club scene ambiance, which is good for the people that are into those kind of things. The place is adorned beautifully and I was content when we were told our table was ready.   The food is good, but not impressive.  We ordered truffle sashimi, the catch roll, grilled mahi-mahi, corn,  another sushi roll cannot remember the name, and drinks of course.  The service was prompt and attentive. Though this place is more for people that are into taking pictures and want attention, I just like to enjoy dinner while conversing with my husband.

63Wyg7m-v3XeOYc42ujGaw.text: Catch was an amazing experience for my and my 6 friends. We ordered the sushi, lobster avocado roll and the lobster Mac and cheese. The service was great and our server was great and made sure that we had our food cooked the way we liked. I will definitely be back on my next trip to Vegas

2XY2DwmR-EEPlYuJ5hATBA.text: Catch the name of the restaurant also means trying to Catch service. This was one of the worst dining experience I have had on the strip We ordered a bottle of wine ( 2 couples) the sommelier (?) presented the wine took it away 10 minutes later brought it back to pour. After having to "catch" someone for service we ordered entrees. The  first fish entree was served, we waited for the rest to arrive, 12 minutes later we "caught" someones attention the rest arrive. uE7Mu5Xz_2Q6hU47zMJvmA.text: Having tried this place out a second time, we did not have the same issues as in my first review. The ladies and gents at the front were much more receptive and pleasant to speak to. We were also seated at the correct time. They've definitely improved!

Up3n1xRvPw7Zl7zGGWTJEg.text: Went here on a Thur evening ~9pm without reservation and the place was packed ... luckily, we were able to get high table seating (no reservation needed) right away.  The service was great - got menu right away, got drinks quickly.  The ambience was romantic, darkly lighted and loud music.  Really no dress code - some were in jacket/pants and others in t-shirt/shorts.  I do recommend dressing up if you are on a date!  We ordered the "small seafood tower" and the entrees were  "scallop & cauliflower" and "herb roasted branzino" (a sea bass type fish).  The small seafood tower ($100) was delicious but it was actually kind of smallish serving for 2 people (only one king crab leg, one lobster piece, big shrimps, lot of small clams, mussels).  The 2 entrees were $44/each but they were absolutely delicious!  Would definitely come back to this place.

-iF8DybnE1DZ6miO6h6Bhw.text: Tasty seafood.  Good ambience.  Good mix of cold, raw and cooked.  Good for business or special occasions.  Favorite dish was the grilled octopus. 6I_Maxr3VY0e4JCRQ1RCFw.text: Just went here for a date night with my husband and had the best time! Great service and the food and drink is beyond delicious!!! We started off with Manhattans - I had a regular and my husband had their Manhattan on the menu. Both delicious and they have the big ice block-love that!   For food we pretty much choose everything lobster- the Maine Lobster Avocado hand roll was the BEST roll I've ever had! Flavor town USA and it came with this mango dipping sauce- WOW. This is a must try. SERIOUSLY. Next we had the mahi-mahi Wonton Tacos- excellent! The tacos had so much flavor- yum!! Next we had the lobster mashed potatoes again delicious! There are big chunks of lobster it in! Finally we ended with the lobster Mac and Cheese! Also very good! It's not your typical mac & cheese with cheddar cheese.  The decor was great I love that there are flowers everywhere in multiple places to take great pictures.  I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone!!! And don't forget to try the Maine Lobster Avocado hand roll!!!!

q0Bo6XuIaf8vZm80EI22Rw.text: Highly recommend Catch in Las Vegas! Great food, great service and great atmosphere. This a great place to do family style and share a bunch of different meals. Definitely coming back!

okW8w5eELZJzA7En_qEXiw.text: Do you remember where you were that night Las Vegas was momentarily caught off-guard by an earthquake? I do! I was sitting underneath the stunning chandelier at CATCH...yes, it was moving beautifully from side to side.  Upon arriving at Catch, before you get to the reception desk, you will pass the picturesque arrangement of flowers and colorful decor. I'm sure you've seen several social media posts of this gorgeous spot. Once past reception, you are led to one of  the multiple dining areas, all organized for maximum seating...which also means that on a full night, you can forget about making sense of any conversation at your table.  We ordered about ten dishes to share between three of us. A combination of seafood, meat, vegetables, and carbs...everything was tasty, but not so special as to be deserving of either the high price or the hype. Suffice it to say, there are a lot of better options in town if you want to be wowed by what you are eating.  Unfortunately, the service didn't do anything to make up for the less-than-memorable food. At its heart, it was a little unorganized. For example, as soon as we set, they delivered 2 appetizers which we thought would be complimentary, but it was just a mistake, and they took them to the right table. Additionally, there were many staff members, but it was not easy to have them over when you needed anything, on account of it being so loud and busy...almost like fine dining price with overcrowded casual service.  Would I come back intentionally...no.

qv1z02vAEzzGFrAuiC8HoQ.text: The entrance to Catch is the highlight of the restaurant. The garden like tunnel is special memorable attractive. I recomend the Truffle Sashimi appetizer, the Crispy Whole Snapper for your main dish, and the Donut Wonded Wheel for desert.

Sc2CkizEj5ubVAeppQh-Qw.text: After seeing Catch on many celebrity/social media influencer's stories, this restaurant was on my must-try list for the hubby & I's getaway trip to Vegas for the weekend. We had made a reservation for 7:15, but got there at about 6:50. With our spare time, I made sure to take pictures in the iconic hallway that Catch is known for -- in retrospect I would have taken our pictures then gone elsewhere for dinner.  The hostess called us & had us seated by 7:00. She led us to this tiny table, & even had to move it to the side to let me in because there wasn't space between us & the other couple's table to walk through. The lighting is low to the point it was hard to read the menu, & between the loud music & close proximity to the other tables it was hard to hear our own conversation.   Neither of us were terribly hungry so we ordered two dishes to share, the Catch Roll & Grilled Octopus. For $23, the Catch Roll was mediocre at best. I've had better rolls for $10 at any other sushi place. The Grilled Octopus however was DIVINE. It was perfectly paired with crispy potatoes & a garlic aioli. Hubby & I still talk about how delicious it was & how we wish we could find a similar dish in Denver. We finished it off with the famous Hit Me Cake... also unimpressive. Although the presentation was fabulous, the taste was lacking. Sweet, rich chocolately desserts are my guilty pleasure, but it was not to my satisfaction at all.  All in all, after spending over $100 on dinner & drinks, I was disappointed that the food wasn't WOW material. If we ever go back to Vegas, maybe we'll think about coming back to Catch only for more insta-worthy pictures, and the Grilled Octopus. Otherwise, we'll be fine dining elsewhere!

F7yOyfWRnS8ZCu4fvYXuUg.text: I forgot to finish my review. But I definitely did not forget this experience! From service to food and ambience, this place is hands down my new go to place in Vegas! The grand entrance is the first thing that catches your eye. Its gorgeous flowers and colors are instagram worthy. Be sure to arrive early for your reservations to take pictures. Or better yet, come before dinner service so there isn't a crowd.   The food was top notch! The skewers were flavorful and a beautiful roasted aroma. Try the roasted corn, eggplant and beef filet mignon. The wagyu gyoza and mahi mahi tacos were a fresh twist on the usual comfort food. I love how the mahi is mixed in with guacamole so you get every flavor in each bite. The king crab tempura & mushroom spaghetti were delicious; There were so much more to write about, you just have to try it for yourself.   Our server Courtney was outstanding! She anticipated our every need and refreshed our drinks regularly. As packed as it was she was always available and was not flustered at all. Definitely a pro! We got to personally thank Chef Adrain Vela for the wonderful meal. Very sad to lose him from LA but we are so happy to visit his new home in Vegas and can't wait to return!

aF0_mySw4F5VsL_uGMY-rA.text: Catch as of the time of writing this review is the newest restaurant at Aria replacing their previous Japanese restaurant. We've been here several times now and always had a reservation. There's plenty of seating but I would book ahead of time to be safe especially if you have a large party and it happens to be a busy weekend.   The restaurant serves a variety of foods and everything we've had has always been delicious. Some of their dishes such as their scallop gnocchi while flavorful was slightly lacking in texture. Their lobster mac is excellent. Their large entrees are all top notch.   The price here is not cheap. If you want to eat your fill, with a drink, appetizer, entree, expect $70+ per person.  Service has always been good as is the ambience.  My biggest gripe was our last visit we ordered some cut rolls to-go. They were nothing like the ones I've ordered while dining in. They are amongst the worst quality rolls I've ever seen. I was extremely disappointed.   Nonetheless the overall food quality is great. I will edit this review should the quality tank in future visits.

4TD9jNhrQzU94AMQ5pxpkw.text: I was very skeptical about this place and left extremely surprised. I thought this place was a viral hub and trap for mediocre food and people trying to better their instagram feed.  The place is beautiful and almost all the dishes I got were stellar. I could see people getting pissed about the waiting time after talking to the hostesses, but to me it is always about the food and the service is a nice plus.  The space between tables can be quite reduced and can be a little annoying to overhear other people's conversations, but the loud music should take care of that.   Only dishes I would avoid as they were very mediocre are the mango shrimp roll and the catch ceviche. The salmon belly carpaccio is amazing, same goes for the branzino with creamy basmati rice, hamachi spinach, Spanish octopus and the donut wonder wheel for desert as the cake donuts had an amazing texture and flavor.

2It6oAf0fZIv7a53gwNbVA.text: The place is beautiful  But...  I'm a local and I work in a fine dining  at the strip also and I know how things work at a restaurant.  First of all we arrive to the restaurant and they ask us if we want to drink fiji, tap or pellegrino we ask for tap they bring us the water and the glasses smell like fish we ask to the busser can you change the glasses he respond yes and he bring us "new glasses" the glasses still smelling like fish.  What's the answer to that?  The stocker is polishing with a dirty rag. Change the rag put soap and that's it!  We tell the server hey can you bring us plastic cups and accidently she bring dirty plastic cups with stains of tomato juice that look like lipstick in the plastic cup.   And we honestly understand those kind of accidents because we work in the restaurant business. Server was great busser too actually we left the 20% tip because they were good!   But here is the interesting part, we call to the manager because we were celebrating the birthday of my friend.   My friend  is a hotel manager in  Colorado, and she know how to treat people.   Well we tell the busser can you call to your manager?    The manager get in our table with the worst face and a terrible attitude.  Her words were: what happen? We tell her the story and she said "mm maybe someone spilt tomato juice in the plastic cups or whatever"  That was her answer and she leave!  Oh she just send us a Fiji and we appreciate!   But that's not the way you treat people specially if we are celebrating a birthday and choosing catch as an option.

tQGWSoTgAC8z0NGyRQTg3Q.text: I came here for my birthday a few weeks ago. Everything was so great - from the service to the food.   Our server gave great suggestions and was very knowledgeable about the menu! The catch roll is amazing! The crispy shrimp sooooooo good!  You gotta get dessert! The donut wheel is to die for you!   All in all such a great experience. Will definitely come back here!

SAEYjv8tT_3q9gn_GRXW_A.text: I was looking for a new spot to take my best friend to dinner for her birthday. Catch was delicious. Our server gave us a few recommendations on food we could share, which were all really tasty and good. The atmosphere was really nice with good music. Our server was very attentive and brought us some free birthday shots. I read a few reviews before going, which weren't that great, but I wanted to experience it for myself. It is pricey and loud. But it was worth it for my best friend. We didn't mind the music because we weren't planning on having a work meeting in the restaurant. The most important part was she loved it.

33cPH995_qC5Z7B4JTNTbQ.text: Food was amazing! But the waiter couldn't suggest what drinks to order and wasn't very patient. I am sure they have a quick turn over to get as many people in there as possible but felt a little rushed

photos.caption: Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak skewers with wasabi sauce

QOAp75o4pZXWTEsFPbKiYQ.text: This spot has the best salmon carpaccio. Hands down most fire sushi I've had. Ask for Steve as your server and you won't be let down. He's the guy at this spot.

etRWqutNWJubXl_fpsTiXA.text: Disclaimer - this review may be biased because I love Vegas and I absolutely love Aria and I've been this location 4 times in the last 4 trips.  So here it goes - this place is awesome. Yes, it is probably pricey, but what upscale place isn't? Yes, this place is loud, but it's just because the atmosphere is so upbeat that everyone is just having fun. Yes, the portion sizes maybe a bit small, but it just means we get to order more things and try all their different flavors.  So the bottom line is that if you want to have a great time, and be served by a really nice and hospitable staff, and even end your meals with a nice dessert, and be present in a great crowd - this is definitely the place to be. In fact, I'd even go as far as demanding everyone to try it out at least once!!

6xzmMvP-9XdcYtXhnGAi7g.text: This place is the best! The hellfire roll is awesome and the crispy shrimp is outstanding!! Super fast as well the place is designed great and has lots of drinks to choose from . It's super clean and all of the servers are very nice. Keep up the great work.  P.S The donuts are amazing

QQK7APJ1VVUNcZ3hvES1pw.text: This place tries to present its high end but,if you go to dinner and all you can hear is shouting and can't make conversation with the person/s you're there with - that is not a high end restaurant, that is a canteen dressed up to pretend it's something it's not. The only reason why I give it three stars rather than less is - the shrimp starter was delicious, the prosecco I had to drink was great and our waitress (even though she had to shout to be heard) was kind and attentive and food came out on time. I did feel a bit rushed though, and it is not a place for a romantic meal. I'm not big into image and if I get dressed up it's a big deal for me. I put on my best dress, make up etc for this and was out in 45 mins, all that time my husband and I didn't speak because we couldn't hear each other with the noise! We are regulars at Aria but this is one place we will not come back to

feabSGnejLjjIlbYls25Og.text: This place is the epitome of "too cool for school." Seems to me that they are completely focused on being a new posh night spot instead of focusing on the guest and making sure you're taken care of. Just feels like the attitude of this place is that you are lucky to be there. We were seated a good 30-40 min after our reservation without so much as an apology or recognition of the situation. Service was fairly subpar as well as my wife was brought the wrong wine and the kitchen neglected to send out one of our sushi rolls. For the price you pay at this place, you expect to be treated as a welcome guest and we did not feel that at all.   We will take our money elsewhere in the future.

-6cP5t9Eea1GpyPEyKv0MA.text: Overrated. Over priced. Not impressed at all. Had reservations for 6 & didn't get seated for over 30 min. We went to in-n-out after a $450 meal. Service wasn't great either. They kept opening & pouring water when we said we didn't want more they would send someone else over with another open bottle. $20 for an aperol spritz. Just a joke.

3gBJVOIKgzgmcz3PER6Ckg.text: It pains me to give less than 5 stars for this stunning restaurant with succulent dishes. However, the hostess/manager is terribly rude. We were running a few minutes late for our 6:45 reservation, so I called and the person who answered the phone said no problem. We walk in through the magically lit flower pathway, and the hostess tells me that our table was given away and she doesn't care who I spoke with, but we could sit at the sushi bar instead, but would have to wait. We were really looking forward to eating here, so we waited, walked away for 2 minutes to take a picture with friends in front of the CATCH sign and she scolded us for walking away, and had us wait some more. We did enjoy the food, which was creative and delicious. But such a shame that the hostess, who I was told was also the manager, is the worst welcoming committee EVER :-(

TnohRmm_k96W1PsvGXTNEw.text: My wife and I have been to other locations and this is the worst location. The music is way too loud, tables are way to close to each other, very uncomfortable feeling when you can't event get thru between the tables. The worst part are the hostesses, they are not friendly at all and completely forgotten about us, I asked 3 times about out reservation and finally they set us down 30 min past our reservation time. Not coming back!

gwCpBKFP2KEvYM_PmE2UfQ.text: If you're looking for a clubbing style restaurant this is the place for you! Super noisy, crowded tables (good for sharing your party with others) and disjointed service of food orders (your sides will come out as appetizers). The bar uses crushed ice so if you like your drinks watered down this is your bar! My husband had to leave the table before he had a complete angry scene with the swearing table of rowdy drunk people next to us. And it was only 6:00pm! Don't take your family here if you'd like to share a conversation. Otherwise, the food and service was good. I miss Bar Massa...

85jsxbGqZU5rRgR-6ocn3w.text: Very fresh sushi!! Manny provided great service and the whole experience was amazing!

HQ3R-PQXiNXrFfI3t0NL-Q.text: My family and I went to Catch for our daughter's 19th birthday.  Beautiful atmosphere, albeit a tad noisy, but upon arrival we were greeted by an extremely RUDE hostess (light brown hair in ponytail with accent) who never once smiled.  Once were were finally seated (we had a 6:00 reservation but didn't get seated until 6:20) our waiter, who was very engaging, took our drink order.  I had a margarita which was very good.  They had a pretty extensive wine and cocktail selection as well.  For dinner I had the wagyu short rib tacos which were absolutely PHENOMENAL.  Everybody else in our party loved their entrees as well.  The only other complaint I have is how long it took to get our food and it didn't all come out together so one person in our party didn't eat until 20 minutes after everyone else!  The manager was also very lovely and came by our table to check on us, as well as give our daughter a great birthday dessert spread.  Would I return to Catch?  Absolutely.

quHOn6qDu4bHEP5pYo1CYg.text: Our experience was a disaster!  Two people out of eight did not get their entrees.  Many side dishes came late and we have to send them back.  Tea and waters weren't refilled.  When we asked for our check without the missing items, they asked us to let them know what was missing.  We refused. The check took forever. The manager acted unaffected about the service, and was defensive.  At the end they did offer "free" dessert, but too little too late. We will NEVER come back.  It's a shame, because what food we did receive was delicious. The atmosphere was good but music was too loud.

Zueb4uMVLossXfjBkgB3RQ.text: I went for a girls night out and it was great! The ambience is really nice and reminded me of a restaurant I went to in Barcelona, Spain! The food was great we got a couple of rolls, the octopus, mushroom pasta, the shrimp, and oysters. Everything was fresh and very delicious. Cocktails were very good too. Our service was awesome. Roger was very attentive and very easy to approach. He really took care of us! I would definitely recommend Catch!

R4kR7o84yWqpYr1HePDpmQ.text: The food and menu are 5 stars.  The design is beautiful.  But the unbelievable noise, awful service (especially at the front desk), and overall concept ruin the experience, especially for large parties. First of all we were a party of 7 but the tattooed bitch at the host stand refused to seat us despite the fact that 6 of us had arrived.  And she was totally obnoxious about it.  Our waiters were fine but the place was so loud we couldn't have any conversations and couldn't even hear what we were all ordering.  Which is a big problem for a restaurant that wants to serve all the food family style.  The food came out in random order -- sides came last.  We had to leave early before some food even arrived, because the whole thing took so long (had a show to get to).  Bill was about $1500.  The food that we actually ate was great. I would probably return as a party of 2 so I could potentially sit right next to the person and hear him or her.

Hvoe6rvauY7BEZKQb9NMBw.text: Darren was an awesome server !! I highly recommend him ! Heard service wasn't that great. But he showed us different ! Good job darren

y2u-2920AnLXYdF80_A1XQ.text: The entrance to catch was absolutely gorgeous. Took a lot of nice pictures there. We made reservations and was seated in 5 min. Our server Roger was very friendly. He came to check on us frequently and made sure everything was to our liking. Our favorite was the catch roll and mushroom spaghetti. Would definitely like to come again!

OcJHKy_YmAFgTF_bxS2DOQ.text: Like most guests here, I went because of the restaurant's aesthetics (LOL). It's a really pretty restaurant! Service was excellent and my waiters were very friendly and prompt. I really liked how one of the waiters gave my sister and I menu suggestions! I tried the short rib wagyu tacos, the mo'jito mo'problems, and the s'mores pizza. Although, I'm not a fan of mayo, the tacos were really good! The aioli and the pineapples balanced the flavors out really well. I played it safe with the mojito; it was pretty good but I wish I ordered the 'one too many' instead. I didn't really care for the s'mores pizza either. Within a few minutes, the marshmallows became super hard making it hard to chew on. All in all, I'm giving the restaurant 3/5 stars because of my food experience. It was pretty good overall but I expected bigger portions for the prices. I'd definitely recommend this restaurant if you're a foodie fan who loves seafood and sushi!

FQqI6QAQxyc7LBIx-BC6Mg.text: Loved it all. Unique atmosphere (really stunning), great service (Marcus was amazing!), and delicious. We took all his suggestions, from drinks to food, and they were all legit amazing. This place knocked it out of the park. *Located by the lobby (kinda hard to find) **Self parking entrance to Aria is on the strip (not Harmon entrance)

ZUDMGlUP1JOfH3K8FPfQqw.text: Don't waste your time or money going to this restaurant. Made a reservation for a birthday celebration and once we arrived at the check-in counter we were made to wait about 10 minutes after our reservation time. Table that they had a seating at was extremely close next to other tables. I have never seen a layout in a strip restaurant down like this we were sitting so close to the couple next to us,almost feel like you were in New York City restaurant. And the food was delicious that's the only plus side to this restaurant but unfortunately with a horrible customer service who will not be making it back or recommend it to anyone. Have to ask the server twice for lemon for a waters and at the end of our trip still did not receive lemon for the water. The table set up was so tiny that the food that we ordered we couldn't even use the plates we had to eat the food off the plates that the food was brought on. In the reservation request I let them know that I would this was a birthday celebration and neither did the front office ever say happy birthday or the server for such high-quality restaurants that's usually how they provide the type of service so something that they should definitely look into paying attention to detail. Once were done with our dinner the server never brought out a complementary happy birthday dessert that they usually do it at all the fine dining establishments on the strip which is another key point that this restaurant does not pay attention to details at all. People that work in the restaurant we're on their cell phones throughout the whole time so if management is ever catching up to these reviews and trying to save this restaurant from ever closing should completely revamp their staff.

GMWnPAPVOMwzT0EvyoruUQ.text: One of the best dining experiences I have ever had. It was my birthday and being a local wanted to try out the newest spot in town. I had heard and seen - plus I have friends who work at Aria that said it looks like a great restaurant - so I had to give a try. I don't know how to describe it really it's just a great atmosphere, they have a pretty elaborate menu but the staff gave phenomenal service in walking me through it. The drinks are well crafted you can tell they put effort into the mixology and the flavor profiles they wanted. My girlfriend and I were blown away. Miguel ( waiter) was extremely friendly, upbeat, and didn't care that it was busy I still felt prioritized. Joey ( manager I believe) came by a couple times helped discuss the menu with me, wished me a happy birthday and we took his recommendations on what to order for our main course. He made a great impression on me and my girlfriend for being genuine. A lot of managers always walk by and ask how's everything going etc - that's what managers do right - but Joey actually asked with a purpose it wasn't like it was a fake routine or just because it was my birthday he did it the right way. Thank you Catch for crushing it. Can not wait to come back.

nO_xjdZxOWMPwlNRUcPsEQ.text: entrance walkway smells bad like they just remodeled slow check in,  had 7:15 reservation and didn't get seated till 7:45 and this on Wednesday night, several groups who arrived after we did got seated. what the use of having reservations, very unorganized and chaotic. wish I could give this place a big fat 0.  after waiting, the food is tasteless not worth it. Only redeeming quality is the wait staff

IqSPIjNVWOYNMaSljEO7uw.text: A large group of friends and I went on 11/7 and to be honest I wasn't all that impressed. The decor and atmosphere were beyond beautiful but the food and service have a lot of catching up to do. This is not a cheap restaurant by any means, but it is also very new, so I didnt know what to expect. We made our reservations for 20 ahead of time and they still weren't prepared for us when we got there. After we sat down ordering was super difficult. It seemed as though the staff had never worked in a high volume upscale restaurant. We ordered our first round of drinks, which came out perfect, however it took 15 minuets and my asking of 3 people before I received my second drink. Also the food was pretty salty, if your sushi is salty without to the soy sauce, there's an issue haha. Also 2 people at my table never received their entrees and the server never noticed. For as much as they're charging I really hope they step it up, because as of right now it's not worthy of being a Las Vegas Strip restaurant.

f3uF2R5IP7BDXv3Y2rEu3Q.text: What a fantastic experience at Catch Las Vegas! From the food to the service to the bartenders and especially management all 10-stars! I want to highlight JP the manager who went out of his way to make my experience feel so special. For just being opened 1 week they have everything buttoned up perfectly. Catch LA needs to take a page out of their book. Had the worst experience at the Los Angeles location but the Las Vegas location made up for it in spades. JP the manager should gets 10-stars. All the way around great crowd gorgeous architecture amazing vibe fabulous and professional employees. This is the new hotspot in Vegas to check out. Thank you again for the wonderful experience.

B6mC5L5jLlq3F4l4XO0Ozg.text: New restaurant at Aria! Beautiful entrance to the restaurant! The service is great  but the food is just OK for the price!

e-uhOr3bAFvq3ztZT1iqRA.text: Very delicious food. Service was decent but not spectacular. I had to ask twice for a glass of wine once we were seated. Initially, it seemed like the waiter didn't have time for us because we ordered a few small plates. I guess he assumed that's all we would order which wasn't the case. We even asked to keep the menu, which I thought implied we were not finished ordering. The service improved once we ordered a couple of the $100+ menu items. Maybe that's just a coincidence. From observing the atmosphere it was clear that the wait staff is still working out some kinks as it's opening week. Each time a food runner would come out of the kitchen they looked lost. They had no idea which table ordered what. There were three instances where the food runners tried to serve us food we didn't order. The first two times we let them know it wasn't ours and by the third time, I assumed it was just compliments of the chef. Overall it was a nice experience and I will return. The porterhouse, Alaskan king crab legs, and scallops were my favorites. The tiger prawns were good also. The entry way is beautiful and a great backdrop for photos.

Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N5HbeIvks1ExiWBXO-EdQA.text: I had such a good experience. Usually trendy restaurants like this are amazing when it comes to atmosphere but then the food is subpar. But this place delivers on the aesthetic and the food is AMAZING! Also the service was great. The bussers and servers had such a fun energy.

Wwm9oXb3Nu5uM1oP10a1Kg.text: I come to Vegas at least 1-2 times a year with my boyfriend. We love to find new restuarants for us to try. This place was amazing. Food delicious and service was great. We had the trio tartar as a starter and fish for dinner both were yummy. I'm sure anything you select form the menu would be just as good or better. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio Tartar

PH5ijWivaBaxFZXTk6HiGg.text: My husband and I went CATCH on Oct 29 that was their Las Vegas  (at Aria Hotel) opening night. It was our anniversary and we were looking forward to celebrating our important day with some memorable dinner. We were planning to have a dinner somewhere else, but we walked by Aria in the afternoon Oct 29  and found out that CATCH's Opening day, Ok why don't we try them? So I made a reservation at 9:45 PM. BUT it was a huge mistake.   1. They lost our 9:45 pm reservation and the receptionist didn't even apologize to us and she just said, " Well, you can still eat it. "  What a nice way to welcome the customers on their first day of the opening.  2. They took us to a table next to the bar counter; a small table with two stools. I asked the receptionist to change the table because this was an important day for us and we didn't want to spend our anniversary sitting at the bar. We dressed up very nice for our anniversary...  why would they seat us at the bar instead of the main dining area? There were many open tebles for late dinner.  3. The most disappointing thing was the food... it was TERRIBLE.  Everything is very salty and boring.   I am Japanese and I KNOW good Sashimi and sushi. Their signature dish (that's what the waiter said) Trifle (oil) sashimi was way too oily and salty, overkilled Sashimi flavor. It totally ruined the test of the fish.  Spinach Octopus was too soggy and salty. And Herb_rosted branzino, the skin was not crispy enough and no flavor. The creamy vegetable basmati was again, way too salty.  I even told a waiter to let his chefs know about it.  4. And their cocktails were not memorable or exciting.  This is my impression on their Las Vegas Opening. Instead of spending a lot of money to pay to celebrities to promote their restaurant as trendy, they need to focus on getting the best chefs, so they can deliver quality food and service. My impression of Catch is that it was very shallow... its all about the look but there is no depth. I don't even know how they can survive with that poor quality in Las Vegas.

1ddaIDQtN19XHRfspE-Zfg.text: Aside from the bitch hostess (thank her for -1 star, Asian girl), I have had a wonderful time here at Catch. King crab leg tempura got me stiff, black truffle sashimi fire cash and the snapper with the lobster mash had me shoot ropes. Server was outstanding. Seriously. Sweetheart of an Asian kid.

ZZkIGRdFEs7jCE0CkHwQJA.text: this is a beautiful restaurant inside the Aria. i always stay in the sky suites here and i am so excited about this place opening! the ambiance is amazing, servers are super nice and quick. i got oysters which were yummy, sashimi, nigiri (the toro was the BEST i've ever had), and lobster mac which was not what i was hoping for so barely ate any of it. i also got a moscow mule which was super good. overall, it was a nice experience and i'll be back!

Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oLAnJeFA9Qq_50r7EI6BlA.text: The food was amazing my favorite was the catch roll. Our server was very nice and timely checking on us and taking care of any needs. Only reason I didn't give a five star was because our reservations were at 9:15. We got there 5mins early to check in and it took a little over 40mins to actually be seated even with a reservation.

TvL4eAAAp1sqW22DHjaNdQ.text: First off this restaurant is BEAUTIFUL. The music was great and it was pretty full for a Tuesday night! We made a reservation (which I highly suggest you do) for 9:30pm we did not get sat till 10pm, the tables are extremely close together the lady next to us had a conversation with me. The drinks came out promptly and the dessert was AMAZING. The hit me cake was our favorite but can be very sweet, so definitely share it!

b4SWLzATIWMh6-qltm7pHw.text: Yall, I honestly made reservations here bc of the insta worthy flower wall. Why didnt I just leave after I took my pics???   Service: Hostesses- the worst! Dont they know they are the first impressions for the restaurant. I guess they just dont give a fickery fuk. They gave me attitude when I asked if my table was ready 30 mins past my reservations. Umm bish, Im the one that should have an attitude. Then they dont even apologize for the wait when they finally decide to seat us 45 mins later.   Waiter: he was nice, but poorly trained in the "fancy" service restaurant that they tryna portray. The service here felt very Cheesecake Factory. Actually, let me not insult the Cheesecake Factory.  Food: the crispy shrimp is exactly like the honey walnut shrimp from panda express.  The mushroom pasta came with cheap ol button mushrooms. The 3/$20 short ribs tacos were the size of a babies hand and all I tasted was salt. Sushi good. Sashimi good. The branzino the waiter recommended blah. Ceviche hella watery.  Drinks: good but the bartenders are super understaffed. Took 15 mins to order and another 15 to pay. This 30min bar experience was part of my 45 mins table wait.  *alternative suggestions- beauty and essex, China poblano, momofuku, lemongrass, the new food court at cosmo, ghost donkey, wynn buffet, basically anywhere but Catch.  Yo gurl aint tryna get caught.

rlbNE6QVaf6W0FkeuKMTPQ.text: The service here is only outdone by the food. We had the crispy shrimp, which was easily the single best food I had while in Vegas. Eat it when it's hot and it just melts in your mouth. Every single sushi roll was incredible as well. If I had any negatives it would be to make the lobster Mac and cheese a little more cheesy and that we had to wait 30 minutes after our reservation time. The food and service beyond that were excellent!

hLxgH2fjBhGIDEMxHWDBAw.text: Very poor customer service I'm setting on the bar waiting 30 minutes for sushi no one come to talk to me manager is only talking to VIP instead of taking care of bartender that is fighting with another bartender very unpleasant experience.

7OBnyuTJzRQ7d55-qunOzA.text: Went here first week when it opened since we were already at Aria, and the entrance just calls out to you. I recommend an early visit before dinner time, just so it isn't as busy in the entrance if you want to take pictures. The service and food were great, and the portions were surprisingly big.

KKzXk-eQEhBoO9U4WoeJOA.text: We had dinner reservations for a 40th B Day and we all had to wait 1 1/2 hrs for our table. Food is average and service was the same. There are too many wonderful restaurants in Las Vegas so I would definitely pass on this one.

ywkcerTsVI584LtHm9Ovdw.text: This place is soo good! The seafood was fresh. It was a really cute restaurant, I loved the ambiance. We had great service for it just opening. Happy that they opened a location in Las Vegas.

DOzJnAxDv5Y4FMwc1rOSpg.text: Sadly, we have not eaten at this restaurant even though we had booked a reservation (6:00). The restaurant was not busy but the hostess thought a good idea to sit us in a section with two other couples side by side! We couldn't help but hear both conversations. My husband asked to change of table to another almost empty section. The hostess was annoyed by our request and after 10min she said that she might be able to find us another in another 30min (in the nearly empty restaurant). My husband declined and ask her how could we avoid this and she said that the customer did not had the choice of where they can sit!!! So we left!  She was surprised that we didn't stay. Well I guess the bad reviews were True about the hostess treating the diners as gum under her shoe!  Good luck for the longevity for this restaurant !  Las Vegas has tons of great restaurants who know how to welcome their guests.   We went instead at Blossom and had a superb meal with an outstanding service!!

iIy9kDDFs-lcNlOz06114A.text: Our reservation was at 8:45 in which we checked in at 8:40. They had us wait at the bar till our table was ready.... we waited and waited and didn't get sat till 9:50??? That was definitely annoying to have to wait that long after we had reservations. They then proceeded to take us into a side room that wasn't even part of the restaurant. I think it might've been their private dining room but none the less we were stuck in a mute, dark, non decor area. The restaurant part was very open and beautiful which we weren't able to enjoy . The food was ok  but nothing that really blew me out of the water. We ordered a dozen oysters, truffle sashimi, ny strip steak, king crab, lobster mash, Brussels, gnocchi, and coconut dessert. Our waiter forgot the gnocchi due to miscommunication  they also forgot to give us chopsticks for the sushi and didn't give us a drop plate or bucket to put our king crab shells in. Had to ask for all these and when they cleaned our table after we were done with our main before dessert they didn't replace our napkins. They also don't have steamed towelettes for cleaning your hands after the crab which is a bit bizarre. All in all I'd definitely recommend checking out the restaurant. Probably more so for drinks and apps then a full dinner. I'd rather go to John George or sage if I were to dine in.  The entry way is divine and definitely makes for one hell of an entry way. That was my favorite part of the night.

up-0FL6r1c913-IvbhHvHQ.text: Marcus was AWESOME! What a great bartender and what a great bar! Menu looks great, drinks are great, loved it!!

Z11X6WjDEwkOdMwVPaprpA.text: The food and service was excellent. I definitely recommend trying the lobster avocado roll. The mango salsa that comes with it, is a great combination. I wish I could remember the guy that served us, he deserves recognition. He was very helpful and always checked on us. The music was my type of genre and I loved the atmosphere. I would say to have at least 2 bartenders in the front bar at all times. The guy was nice but he was hard to get ahold of but he was serving everyone else so it's understandable.

eXy0Tq1ykyyDPE0YRPCy1g.text: Just ok, don't come hungry, had almost all the menu with 3 other couples and didn't have a great food experience, food was not that great especially not for the price, very small portions, yes there is a great atmosphere of just coming to have a drink with a small appetizer and desert but not for a dinner.

YS7x5WZNYKp6arNjYs2XCQ.text: Seafood tower was delicious and the best sushi I've ever had! Literally melts in your mouth! Gluten free pistachio cheesecake was remarkable and Ive been craving it ever since! The entrance way is absolutely beautiful with incredible photo opportunities! The front security guard was kind enough to take a dozen photos for us. Love this restaurant!

vQeAnootYQGfqZ-G-zSEIg.text: The food and service is top notch (as expected in Vegas). However if you are coming here for the typical "catch Scene" it doesn't have the same appeal and Los Angeles and New York. It's a more commercial version of the popular restaurant. You won't likely see any celebrities here like the other locations, but you shouldn't be going here for that anyways. It's all about the food. The Truffle Sashimi is the best item IMO along with rock shrimp and the lobster Mac & Cheese.

2-aWuEWFkvEDsxSjLakkfw.text: These people here are so dishonest, they tell my party that gratuity want included tricking everyone except me. I look at the itemized receipt and was correct. The food is over priced, knew that going in but then they get greedy and try to trap patrons. First and last ever experience here!

oNQnQnuoI0XiUqorgJ9IfA.text: I love catch ! We come here about once a month. We always order the macaroni lobster, the crab leg (which is a special, not always in), the lobster roll which is amazing, & the crispy shrimp! Brittany is by far the best waitress we've ever had here. She was such a gem.

H49OqQKzcYCsVAeJjzejNw.text: Catch is my new favorite restaurant! The walkway entrance to the restaurant is beautiful. Loved that you can stop and take pictures by the beautiful butterfly and rose background. From the moment we walked in I loved everything about this restaurant. The music and ambiance were on point. Loved the music variety! Our server was fantastic and very attentive. I wish I can remember her name! Everything she recommended was so delicious! We ordered the truffle sashimi, catch ceviche and crispy shrimp. We went off the grid and ordered the mushroom spaghetti and so happy we did, this dish was so flavorful and left us wanting more!!! Also ordered the East-Coast Kali cocktail, so good I needed a second one. Thank you Catch, Las Vegas for the a great dining experience. Can't wait to go back!

tE7wPvH6doJYofiaUBCzEA.text: I went to catch on a Friday night for a girlfriend's birthday. We had a reservation for 9pm and arrived around 8:50 and checked in and went to the bar for a drink while our table was ready. The bartenders were very friendly and attentive. As soon as we received our drinks, the hostess came to take us to our table. Once we were sat our waiter came over to explain the menu & their dining & cooking concept. There are two kitchens that prepare the food. One cold & one hot kitchen and the dishes come out as they are finished. We ordered a few dishes to share and honestly, nothing really stood out. The food was just OK, nothing I would crave to go back for. I would go back for the ambiance & mood to hang out and grab drinks with friends. The music was classic hip hop & r&b and the decor was beautiful. Overall for the price & quality of the food, it would not be my first dining choice.

-am7x0fJISZE6tYHX5SWrw.text: First off- Catch is more of a club than a fine dining experience & the pricing is high but normal Vegas/casino restaurant high.  The vibe is very young & hip, the environment  is VERY loud & busy- you will almost be screaming to carry a conversation with those at your table.   Service was slightly above average- I did have to ask for water at one point.   It seems like they may be overbooking their seating/tables per Yelp reviews & people we heard complaining at the hostess booth; mostly struggling with bigger parties.   They don't seem to immediately seat anyone upon arrival, instead they direct them to an overly busy bar area- where it's near impossible to get a cocktail while you wait to be seated; we opted to step out to Lobby Bar for one since we had about 20mins to kill. My friend had a water when we came back & we were informed he couldn't bring it in- even tho the bar was so packed & our table may not even be ready yet....seems petty & silly since the establishment is inside a hotel, but whatever.   The food was fantastic, for the most part:  *Steak melted in your mouth.  *Lobster mashed potatoes were good, but I've had better *Red Snapper was cooked perfectly *Brussle sprouts (recommended by server) came out 10+ mins after our entrees & were over-cooked to me, tasted burnt.   *Decent wine selection We skipped dessert- it was just too loud & I was ready to get out.   The decor is nice & fun, flower tunnle entrance & all.   This could be a fun place to celebrate birthdays & such with friends but I wouldn't say it's peaceful or romantic, it is however Vegas-y so having a cocktail or two before arriving is helpful.

o-EAqYBRoRc3-COXj6okJQ.text: Terrible operation. All hype, no substance.  Based on the recommendations of the concierge since we're staying at the tower suites, we thought it would be great but instead it's bad.  We didn't get to eat our main course Red snapper because it didn't showed up. Wow this place is unbelievably bad. Checked in at 5:30 for our 6pm reservation and yet they tried to seat us between 2 other guests like they are running out of space and it's not even the main dinning room. Then they moved us. Look at the picture. Really? Do you want to have dinner side by side on this small table?

photos.caption: Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D8QwEioFiFo4Y0nFfoi28g.text: Ambience 9, service 10, food 3  Good news; Entrance is beautiful, bar is inviting, and server was attentive and informative.  Food service is quick.    Bad news; They have sushi, they have bao buns, they have pasta, they have mahi tacos, they have steak.... they have everything and none of its good.  Recommendation pick one thing and do it well!  The menu is all over the place.  Bottom line place is culinarily challenged and the food reflects that.    What we ordered: 0/10 CEViCHE , awful.  Seafood did not taste fresh and sauce was poorly balanced.  Way too sweet and not enough acidity.  Just blah.  4/10 ROASTED BEETS, salty.  Lettuce was soggy and foam was not foam it looked like mouse.  6/10 GRILLED OCTOPUS, chewy.  Not tender, tasted like beef jerky almost fried instead of grilled.  The fried potatoes in spicy pepper cream sauce was good.  4/10 MAHI TACOS- unappetizing.  Besides being overly salty I liked the crunch and fresh lime juice.  The appearance of the mahi filling looks like frog that's been food processed.  Only ate one.    2/10 SCALLOP GNOCCI TRUFFLE, loss of words.  How do you take 3 of the best ingredients and make such a bad dish.  Well they did it.  This is a dish raved by other reviewers and I can't understand why.  The gnocci and scallops are served in a herbed salt water with very little truffle.  The gnocci is pillowy and has great texture that's it.  The scallops are gummy and flavorless.    Dessert 6/10 VEGAN PISTACHIO CHEESECAKE, not bad.  Good texture gave this a shot despite having any dairy restrictions or allergies.  Coconut sorbet was refreshing.  Overall not bad.

Oute8khFUF4ft9UjKettGg.text: We had such an awesome time here at catch. The decor and ambiance sets the perfect mood. Each dish we tasted was so delicious! My favorite was the sashimi with truffle oil and the crispy rice with tune. Wine list was great. Staff and servers were friendly and full of good energy!

bQxGHY-fHue4CVHJpFyd1g.text: I had an amazing 5th anniversary with my love. The atmosphere was really wonderful & the service was divine. We were smiling every bite we took. We ordered a dozen oysters, lobster mashed potatoes, filet, crispy shrimp & the donut wheel!! The food was to die for, you will see us shortly.
