6-_4XvYoNZ3Qs6qhP_3O2w.text: Catch was a very fun place to dine. The atmosphere is beautiful walking down the hall into the restaurant, as well as in the dining areas. It was really breathtaking. So to begin with, the service and the food was all delicious. But not so ideal for me. When the server arrives he/she says that they would rather you put in your entire order at once and "it'll just come out when it's ready". I eat slowly and like to enjoy small bites at a time with my wine so I really was not at all a fan of that. Also, the tables and seating is absolutely ridiculous. If the host has to move the table over so that a guest can get into their seat because the table next to them is that close, that's a HUGE issue. What if that guest needs to use the restroom during their meal and the tables next to them have been sat...... how the heck are they gonna be able to get out????????? Management needs to fix this immediately. Not only that, but if we are supposed to order everything at once and it ends up all coming out within maybe 2-3 minutes of each other, it doesn't all fit on the dang table. Like really!?!?! MOST DEFINITELY NEEDS TO MAKE A TON OF ADJUSTMENTS!  Now when it comes to the food, everything was pretty good. The catch ceviche we both thought was amazing. I loved the fresh mangos and blood orange slices, very light and refreshing. We also ordered the catch roll, which was a crab salad roll with salmon on top that the server torched at the table. This dish was our favorite. From the hot appetizer section we ordered the crispy shrimp which was so yummy! It was similar to bang bang shrimp but 100% better. The last item we ordered was a side of the crispy Brussels sprouts. They were average, most definitely not the best I have.   Maybe because they are new they are still working out the kinks but lots of improvement is needed. I very much so hope that management will see this and realize changes need to be made.

photos.caption: Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceviche- so good!
Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels spouts
Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy shrimp

GFLX7R565NNL7ghMNNpZ_A.text: All I can say is this place embodies everything a dining experience should be! Not only was the food off-the-charts delicious, but the service & ambiance was hands down amazing. From the moment you walk in, it is like a magical dream with colorful flowers hanging from the tunnel ceiling and along the walls (which makes for a picturesque photoshoot while you wait for your table!) with cute little extra details around every corner. The food was absolutely EXQUISITE with intense flavors and beautiful presentation -- that had us saying, "wow" with every bite!   Highly recommend:  - TRUFFLE SASHIMI: tuna, hamachi, chili oil, ponzu, caviar, black truffle (wow, this was heaven in fish form!) - CATCH CEVICHE: alaskan king crab, main lobster, shrimp, scallop, mango, blood orange ponzu (so incredibly fresh!) - HAMACHI SPINACH: yellowtail, crispy spinach, shallot, sweet ponzu  - GRILLED SPANISH OCTOPUS: octopus, crispy potatoes, sofrito, garlic aioli  - LOBSTER MAC & CHEESE: maine lobster, mascarpone, breadcrumbs, parmesan (can you really go wrong with this?!) - SCALLOP GNOCCHI: bay scallops, black truffle, parmesan  - MUSHROOM SPAGHETTI: wild mushroom, sugar snap peas, tomato, parmesan (this was recommended to us -- and wow, did not disappoint!) - COOKIE DOUGH SPRING ROLLS: cookie dough filled spring rolls with a cookies & cream fondue for dipping (this was SO good!!!) - HIT ME CHOCOLATE CAKE: liquid klondike, dulce de leche ice cream, brownie & devil's food  - STICKY COCONUT CAKE: coconut cake, coconut water sorbet, mango sauce (the presentation of this was amazing!)  This place is in a league of it's own & exudes total fabulousness! It was the perfect choice for a birthday dinner... BIG THANK YOU TO JASON & OUR SERVER ED FOR THE AMAZING HOSPITALITY! We will definitely be back!

Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States. GRILLED SPANISH OCTOPUS

ZbFwpmZlncqnrH9bwH1Q3g.text: This is now my second time coming to CATCH in the last two months. Went for two birthday dinners and have been blown away every time with the food and service. Joseph was our server both times and we ended up requesting him the second visit. Joseph has excellent knowledge of all the food and cocktails on the menu. We tried the one too many and the watermelon felon to start the night off.  We highly recommend coming here if you are visiting town or have friends who want a unique experience in Las Vegas. This is a great spot for celebrating, and the food is served in a family style setting. We ordered many dishes and everyone was able to share. Portions are solid, and you won't be leaving hungry. The entrance is magical and sets the mood for the entire dining experience.  Will be returning in the future and of course ask for Joseph. Hands down best service! Also recommend the crispy shrimp, one of my favorite dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Shrimp. Highly recommend!

SQbb5V_mlcSnldx91PsRUg.text: Opened the end of October 2018, this beautiful restaurant serves up some of the freshest seafood I've had.  The taste of truffles, lobster and crispness of the fried snapper all made this trip worthwhile.  I have admit, walking through the forest to get into the restaurant was rather chilling, as we photographed some wings left behind and surely caught up in the moment.  The appetizers are fresh and dainty, but full of flavor.  Fish was the main course obviously, but was certainly not the highlight of the evening, when my wife was presented with her birthday dessert.  My concern, however, is having too many reception personnel, or hostesses, which seems to detract from a business perspective.  They were nice, but I could tell, they were still learning the ropes.  first impressions are everything...

0QSqRrB3kr9qAdtNCTthEw.text: I had chosen this restaurant, because Sage (which is excellent) was closed when we were visiting Las Vegas. We love good fish and seafood. This wasn't good. I ordered grilled swordfish which was over cooked and dry. My husband ordered the roasted branzino which he said was good. However, it was served over a cloyingly sweet basmati rice dish. They didn't go together. He had grilled octopus for his appetizer which was tough. Octopus can be tough, but it doesn't have to be. If you want good octopus at the Aria, go to Julian Serrano. On top of the food problems, the wine list is ridiculously expensive, even by Las Vegas standards. The restaurant is also very noisy.  There are so many good restaurants in Las Vegas. This isn't one of the best.

ZlBxJzy8YC5DNhtd2GVceg.text: I think I had high expectations for this place. Our last night in Vegas, we ate here for dinner. We were able to make reservations hours before online. Although we had a reservation, we still had to wait a little bit before being seated.   The seats are very close together and the music is loud. However, the music was a mixture of 90s and early 2000s and current r&b and rap, so I'm not complaining at all. I thought most of the food we ordered was good, but I didn't enjoy my entree, which was the organic crispy chicken. I thought it could have been better.  Overall I would return, but just order something else the next time.

au1yJh9H9a8fnl50pRjASw.text: This place is stunning, when you walk by the flowery entry way with designs and picture pockets for every social occasion, you are bombarded with people taking selfies. The high vaulted ceilings make for a beautiful entry way as you enter the bar area, you would think it would help with the noise when busy but definitely carries a bit with large parties inside.  We just wanted to try out a few drinks so we sat right at the bar, it was very busy however we were able to sit right away at the bar. The boyfriend and I ordered a few drinks and spied as others ordered food around us.  We definitely want to try the food next time around but just had to stop by to see what all the reviews were talking about.  This place is awesome entry is very gorgeous and inviting and the inside is huge and a lot of seating near the bar area, definitely check this place out if your in town.

ZWjN-47jtqOlwGRHDkyttQ.text: Visiting Vegas on a Wim and staying at Aria for the first time. I arrived later in the evening and have been working nonstop the last 3 days. I wanted something quick, relaxing environment, and delicious. The ambience at catch is really good! I love the greenery and decor! Very cozy feel. The food was ok, I had the Snapper and Lobster Mash. Service was good but nothing over the top. I ordered the Lush Lemonade which was pretty decent.

S4oFFGCi1TuEiqFavn8RxA.text: A star for the decor. I'll keep this short and sweet. After planning a A wonderful 60th birthday weekend, we thought Catch would be the perfect dinner spot for my mother and her friends. The waiter unfortunately was very inappropriate and rude. Prior to being seated, I privately asked to direct all inquiries about payment to me privately. The waiter insisted on mentioning payment throughout the entire dinner to the whole party. It was quite uncomfortable for all the guests. As older women they have different taste preferences and instead of directing them to the best food choices to meet their needs he talked down to them and made them feel quite small. I am appalled by this experience! I would recommend that you take photos in the front of Catch and skip out on dinning.

7FCFQu6MH58yBp7x5kQOEw.text: Forced to wait 40 Minutes after our reservation time on a Tuesday night at a bar with the rudest bartender ever. Was seated at a table so close to the others that I felt like I was touching them. It was so loud I couldn't hear the server. Was told we had to order everything at once. Left before we ordered anything . Too many good restaurants in Vegas to be treated this way

N4Tnj2CnV5VHnteMvoSyCw.text: I would say the ambience and experience of CATCH in Las Vegas is 10/10, however the value for their food and actual taste.... 3.5/10 We tried the  - lobster Mac n cheese - truffle sashimi - catch roll  - Spanish grilled octopus  The bill all together came to about $150. Although everything was decent we weren't blown away by the food. I'm originally from Toronto Canada and I have had muuuuuch better for less price. Would I go here again? Probably not, it's a nice experience though.

1vDW46242WWFeFriw-_AuA.text: My boyfriend took me here this past Friday for my 28th birthday. We made a reservation a few days ahead, gave my name, hostess asked if there was a special occasion, said my birthday and we arrived on time.   The hostess didn't have my name and when I remembered I gave my phone number my reservation was listed as Daphney instead of Stefanie. The hostess walked us to the table I was shocked to see how close the two tops were. I asked the hostess if we could sit somewhere else and she said all the two tops for couples are like this and we would have to go back to the hostess stand. Since we made a reservation, I was concerned there were going to tell us the same thing so I didn't want to walk back to the front.   The tables are TOO CLOSE to each other and it is very uncomfortable because you literally hear the other couples' conversations. Come to see later there was a couple at a 4 top booth.. very disrespectful to position couples could only sit at two tops. The waitress asked for drinks and when we received them, I ordered a melon felon I believe and I was surprised how washed down it tasted. Waitress position it's because it is fresh watermelon juice. (We had fresh watermelon juice at the High Limits Lounge and that drink had more watermelon flavor) so when we ordered our food at the two tops, there's a stand to reach over to take your food off because the table is so small... if felt claustrophobic and inappropriate to know we spend around $200 for dinner and you are almost elbow to elbow with other customers and then you reach at the height of your face to get the food. Whereas the other tables don't have this stand concept.   After our 5th plate, we knew we had swordfish and the truffle fries coming out, but we were full. So we decided we just wanted to cancel the fries and just have the swordfish. We asked the waitress to cancel the fries and she said she can't if they are already on their way... I was shocked to hear this because this isn't True. Especially I used to serve and I saw the POS system is Agilysys. You just highlight the item you want to void, select the action to void and have a manager override the void to process it. I asked her to try to because we are full but don't mind the swordfish to come out which was around $40 and the fries were around $18 so it was a high ticket item. Swordfish was dry but we just wanted to make the best and keep if positive for my birthday. Behind my boyfriend I saw a waiter lighting a candle for someone's birthday and when we asked our waitress she said we had to pay for the desert. It was disappointing because when they ask the occasion to make a reservation, if comes across like there's a hospitality aspect to welcome the guest in.   Even at STK, (reference the aspect of another high price restaurant) where I've had Kobe steak for $40 an ounce gave me a free birthday desert so I don't see there's  genuine hospitality and attention to detail at Catch. We had such classy hospitable service at the High Limits Lounge than we did here.

Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So close to the other couple.

LDshg584b6SBNef5JKjmyw.text: We had asked around about the best steak restaurant in LV, but ended up here on a strong recommendation from a friend.  The table right next to ours was shining the flashlights from their phones the whole meal. Like the whole entire meal non-stop. We get it. It was dark, but once you finish ordering, turn the flashlight off.   We told two servers, and a manager. Nobody did anything about it.  We paid our bill and told our server that we were frustrated because nothing was done about the bright lights that kept bobbing into our eyes. He finally sent over the GM.   The GM immediately got defensive and literally yelled at us. He brought up the fact that 'in this day and age everyone is on their phones'. But we were upset about the flashlights, not phone screens.   We just wanted someone to say sorry or even acknowledge the frustration we had.   The GM went on to loudly and angrily ask if we were "just trying to get free stuff".   For a restaurant called Catch, we were impressed that our porterhouse was great, BUT our experience was TERRIBLE. It is incredibly frustrating to be talked to in this manner.  I ended up having to pull the manager aside, explain that his behaviour was very confrontational and basically empathize with him! And we still didn't get an apology.   Next time we will stick with Jean Georges or avoid Aria altogether.

UyAs6adMIjIKo8EZUTHMjQ.text: I dined at Catch with 3 friends for my cousin's birthday dinner. Food was mediocre and our waiter was very rude. We were sat in the lounge room which had a all male staff.  They wore cool fisherman inspired uniforms and the ambiance was very laid back. Things were looking good until our waiter came along.   The waiter was very dismissive, nor was he good at explaining anything on the menu and he could hardly be bothered to respond to questions about  it. He had a nasty attitude and was just overall very pretentious. Just because of him I wanna give Catch 0 stars because he really ruined the entire dinner and brought down the vibe of the group. Service can really make or break the whole dining experience, and ours was most certainly broken.   I would not eat here again or recommend this restaurant to anyone. We ordered lobster Mac and cheese; Which lacked cheese, depth of flavor and was dry. It was a weird brown/reddish color and tasted like a flavorless lobster pasta made with cheap elbow macaroni noodles.   The ceviche tasted fresh and the scallop gnocchi was flavorful enough. We also ordered the snapper which lacked flavor, as did the bed of lobster mashed potatoes it was served atop of. With so many amazing high end restaurants in Las Vegas Catch was a True disappointment.

5t-N9BMYN61t3wIv7dGVDQ.text: Catch already catches people's attention by it's unique garden entrance, perfect for photo ops. Even with reservations, it still took us a while to get seated; however, our food came out very fast. I was very impressed and grateful for that. Everything I tasted was delicious: Catch Roll, Crispy Shrimp, Chicken Bao Buns, Donut Wheel, and the One Too Many cocktail. I cannot wait to go back to try more.

NJaT5HByoGb5ep5e1LGsYg.text: I had been wanting to dine at Catch both in New York and Los Angeles for years. For one reason or another, I never did and I was so excited to learn that Catch was opening up at Aria where I always stay when I'm in Vegas. My fiance and I were there one weekend while I was on a work trip. Coincidentally, his mother and her best friend were also there the same weekend. We were looking for a fine dining experience, and we were all ready to try Catch in its new location. We were able to make a reservation easily online via OpenTable. We made our reservation for 6 PM and we got there a little bit early. As you enter, it is pretty magical. They did a beautiful job dressing up the place. It's a beautiful flowery, garden-like entrance. See photos for reference. We took a few photos on our way in, and then approached the hostess stand. She said that they wouldn't be able to seat anyone until 6 PM so she recommended we grab a few drinks at the bar. The bar area is also gorgeous. They have great craft cocktail options. The bartender was really great and whipped us up a round of cocktails quickly. We finally went over to the dining area and there were very few people there as they had just opened. All of the tables were open, yet we were seated at a small table in a corner. I asked if we could be seated in one of the bigger booths and the hostess said something very bizarre. She said that we, our entire party would have to walk back to the front of the restaurant toward the hostess stand to see if that was a possibility. I really didn't understand why our entire party would have to do that and not just the hostess, so we all made the walk over there, the hostess said "yes," and we all walked back. Really dumb if you ask me. Also, not the best introduction to the restaurant. She also told us that we would need to be out by 7 PM if we took this table. We didn't expect that we would be there that long so it wasn't an issue, except for the fact that we felt like we were being hurried out of there. We did love our table, we were greeted almost right away by our server who was very kind the entire time. He explained the menu and made a few recommendations. We were all starving and we are all seafood lovers so no matter what, we would likely enjoy almost anything. They also had a few specials, one of which my fiance's mom and her friend ordered. It was the king crab leg. My fiance and I ordered a fish entree as well as a few sushi rolls to share. There is a tilted tabletop platter on each table, I like the idea - kind of like a pizza place, but they were very wobbly and not very functional. They were more in the way than anything else. All of our food came out at once so it went from having nothing on the table to having way too much. It wasn't really coursed out. In fact, the entire experience was very rushed. Almost as if they were trying to get us out of there. Also, they kept grabbing stuff from our table that wasn't finished. I had a third of a martini (and those things are expensive), one of the girls tried to take it away and I had to tell her I wasn't done. Also, on to several occasions they tried to take our food off the table and it wasn't done. Restaurant serving-etiquette states that you should always ask if they can take a plate away even if there's only crumbs. Overall, I was unimpressed by Catch because of the hurried nature, the taking away of food, and the weird hostess incident. Maybe I'll return for a cocktail at the bar, but definitely not worth the expense of dinner.

_GiwKZ1oGeKXTn5ZIRUBbQ.text: Fantastic. I was surprised this place was rated 3.5 but we went to find out for ourselves. I tried unsuccessfully to get a reservation here for three days in a row.   One of the hostesses very kindly scoped out a seat for us at the bar (I think there are several, we went to the one in back).   Truffle sashimi--killer. Small(er) portion, as expected. The fish was absolutely as good as I've ever had, and I would have eaten a bowl of hair if they poured the truffle sauce over it. Really really great.   Chicken bao--good, but I'd skip it next time. Essentially it was Asian Chick-Fil-A. I love chick fil a, but I'm not sure it belongs here. Chicken was cooked perfectly, buns were great, no complaints about the dish at all.   Kabayaki corn--. I've had a lot of corn in a lot of places, and this was the best I've ever had. We were scared to order it because, well, corn teeth. The kernels almost fell off the core and the sauce was, just, omg.   Chocolate "hit me" cake--a better, more creative way to eat chocolate and ice cream in a long time. Get this dessert.   Service was great. Friendly and fast. Will definitely be back here again soon. Well done Catch.

xqXAv7mfPOnpq9X09S1VVw.text: Rude server. Was there with my husband and another couple. Food was very mediocre. Ordered wagyu beef- mediocre. Snapper- over cooked. Seafood tower was good, lobster Mac and cheese very good. The server was just so unfriendly. We spent 600 on that meal you'd think he'd be nicer. We really wanted to like it and it was a special occasion (bday). Don't go. Not worth it.

dybeiny6Ld12ILw5dAsdyw.text: Definitely eye-CATCHing! Honestly, the walkway into the restaurant is beautiful. A a "bridge" if you will with a dime of vines/leaves and two iconic places for photos-the infamous CATCH sign and the Butterfly wings.   The best way for me to describe this place is..."busy classy". They are normally in busier cities such as NYC and LA, which attract the popular upper class lifestyle without the super fancy elegance.   ATMOSPHERE: The large bar makes for a great waiting space in which we were ushered in to while waiting for our table to be ready for our reservation -you can start ordering from The menu with signature cocktails.  The Inner dining room away from the bar is very similar-dark wood, with accents of metal (you know, the "garden with dark wood and metal accents" that are everywhere), white linens, candle light, hints of florals each way. Classy and modern. However, the tables are very close together in my opinion. (Where we sat, there was one long bench along the wall with three separate dining tables for three different couples to sit at. I've done this before, but this time, there was barry enough room to get by without knocking by your partner table). Also ended up putting the large menu on the open space of the bench between myself and the lady to my right since there's no room on your table.   FOOD: The food is delicious, but be warned that it IS fancier. This means much spending more money for a smaller portion of higher quality. (We ordered Truffle Sashimi at $33 for a cold appetizer. We ordered lobster mashed potatoes, the grilled Spanish octopus, and the Branzino.  Pretty sure this was about $125+)   Things are meant to be shared and most items of ours came out one after the other (meaning as soon as it's cooked rather than all together), which I'm not very much a fan of. The table directly to my left had all their food served together, while ours came one by one. I guess you may have to request this or put similar items together?   SERVICE: The service from our waiter was delightful, but our bussers were a bit abrupt. (Loud clanks of water on our table each time & very quick to take a plate away...even when I may still be working on it). Also, because things come out "as they're made" it seemed like the longest wait time in between dishes-Especially when you're hungry.   Overall, it's a nice place to try out especially if you're like me and have been waiting for them to open here. I honestly was not very impressed with the decor, the space in which I was seated, or the food. (Although I really enjoyed the sauce of the truffle Sashimi and the octopus plate was delicious and tender!) the food was definitely well cooked and flavorful-but not all was something I would go back for for the taste vs. the price.

GFhUt1t58J9lU1LTBEHY8Q.text: Went here on a Saturday night for a friends birthday and honestly it's the first and last time I'll be there. So many negatives that I wish our 1000$ was spent else where...   - the restaurant called 5 times within 24 hours to confirm our reservation... by the 5th call we were ready to cancel the entire reservation out of irritation.   -the hostess was shazamming a song from the speaker with her cell phone and asked us to hold on when we walked up :/  we are talking a party of 10+ people   - our waiter was nice but seemed like we were an inconvenience. It took 32 mins for me to receive my Diet Coke I ordered as it appeared to be the least important and delivered after the salads had been placed on the table.   - the menu seemed bizarre to me, but I choked it up to being pregnant. So by the time David took our order, all I wanted was the doughnut dessert. He looked at me as if I stuttered and said I haven't given the dessert menus yet... like who the hell cares?!? (The doughnuts were delicious and that's why I gave this place 1 Star)  - people had to send back dirty martinis that were mixed with ginger beer  - the service was slow and the server was rude as hell.. so honestly I tipped according to that..   Overall take your money elsewhere... the only good thing about Catch is the valet is so close to get the F*** out of there.

photos.caption: Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PheigAB_FtzbSZm9-BmPfg.text: A gorgeous venue. It was absolutely beautiful! I just didn't like how close the tables were seated to another. I get it since they have to accommodate so many people.  At the end of the day, the food didn't come up to par. I liked the dessert the best. Pass on the sushi and go with the tapas dishes.

mPfPpcH4nKuhzDbFiz2pgQ.text: The absolute worst dining experience I've ever had.  When choosing a restaurant for your birthday, you want to make sure it's something that has amazing service and has amazing food. I have always wanted to head to Catch in LA but since I am a Vegas local, this is as good as it gets.  I made a reservation for 13 of my friends and family members. I had people fly out of town just for this dinner.  We get to the restaurant and the ambience is absolutely breathtaking when you arrive (hence the one star) great spot for photos/selfies/etc.   When we are all seated, we were given 8 food menus (remember there is 13 of us) and one cocktail menu. Just one... We asked for more, and never received them.   We placed our drink orders, my mom and another guest ordered a dirty martini.  Instead they were given a vodka martini with olives and ginger beer.   Food took forever to come out and tasted all like pre packaged microwaveable food. We were never asked if we wanted to order more drinks once ours were finished.   The best (sarcastically) part of the whole evening was the absolute worst service from our waiter David H. He had the most pompous attitude and was so rude to my guests. When it came time for dessert, I thought I'd at least get a scoop of ice cream with a candle on it.  But no, David said we had to order dessert for me to get a candle.   Seriously?!?!  What establishment is this that a birthday girl can't even get a free scoop of whatever for her birthday...especially after dropping money for drinks, apps, and entrees.   I was given a guilt trip by David H that "none of my friends ordered dessert, so here's a free cookie."  I was shocked by how disrespectful he was to not only me the birthday girl but to my guests.   Please do yourself a favor and stay far away from this establishment. I wish I would of listened to all the yelp reviews instead of wanting to give it a chance. My birthday evening started off pretty terrible thanks to the awful service at Catch.

bSKYBB6CZzc751V-kMgNyQ.text: Wow...outstanding...a must try while in Vegas.  We were a group of six and shared multiple, multiple dishes family style and loved everything we ordered.   Service was efficient, kind and professional and atmosphere was great.    Entire place is truly amazing...beautiful, well decorated and a unique dining experience.    Some of our favorite dishes included:  Truffle sashimi, crispy shrimp, trio tartar, spanish Grilled octopus, and steak was perfectly cooked and a perfect medium rare!  Big servings...be sure to share!  Loved their donut wheel...so tasty!  Presentation of each dish was great...very beautiful!  We will be back...worth visiting...True 5-star!

-3BDZPftxqe8NIeTgpgLjA.text: Walking up to the entrance of the restaurant (in the lobby of Aria) you are smacked in the senses by a carefully-crafted silk floral social media-conscious series of photo ops that make navigating to the checkin stand somewhat of a challenge (read: annoying people in the way). The main bar is the next thing you see, and it's busy...and loud. Thankfully we were seated in another room at a fantastic table and had a very attentive and professional server who never let us want for anything.  Apps of crispy shrimp and king crab were darn good. The snapper and scallop entrees were tasty but nothing extraordinary; Brussel sprouts were fabulous. The meal was very enjoyable but I don't need to go back. If there was a negative, it would be the frequent stench of truffle from dishes that were carried by us; it is an ingredient present in a humorously high number of menu items.  We've eaten better food, of course, but the overall experience was excellent (as it should be for the high prices).

EIyDFPjT9n1MV4lISi9Ctw.text: This was a very disappointing experience.   Our group was attending a private party located within a private room in the back of Catch. I made a reservation via Opentable ahead of time for a group of 6, knowing that we would need to grab dinner.  Stepped into party and it was rather loud and provided only appetizers. Several of us stepped out to go to our table reservation.  When I get to the host desk, they tell me they won't seat us unless our entire party is standing there (nowhere to sit, so yes, stand). I explained that they were in the back room and it didn't matter. I texted the rest of our group to come on out and within 10 minutes they stepped out. We then proceeded to wait. We were finally seated 35 minutes after our reservation time. As we were seated, 3 colleagues asked to join us and pulled up a couple of additional chairs.   I glanced at the menu and the prices were outrageous. They have a whole snapper for $90. Corn is $11. As we were reviewing the menu, staff told the only Asian in our group that there were too many people and he had to leave. Claimed it was a fire hazard. Hmm. Gaggles of people were standing a few feet away trying to enter the private party, but 2 extra chairs at our table was a fire hazard. No offer to try and accommodate us at another table  Too bad that staff picked on a the wealthiest individual in our group to leave the restaurant. Yes, we all left.   I find most restaurants in Las Vegas during CES try hard to accommodate. For the prices they are charging, I recommend they learn to provide better service or try accommodating people willing to spend the money.

lqi0Uh2FcKsiRBx7hqNKVQ.text: I came here to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday - she wanted seafood and I heard it was a photogenic entrance, so why not? When you enter, the decor is gorgeous. If you get there before 7pm, it'll be easy to snap away, but after, it'll be a cluttered walkway. Upon arrival, I gave them my name and reservation time. We were asked to wait at the bar while the table was getting prepared - I think we waited about 15-20mins. While at the bar, we were ignored the entire time and a couple minutes before the hostess grabbed us, the bartender asked if we'd like to see a cocktail menu.  When we were seated, you can't help but notice how close you are to the other tables. A table for two barely fit two glasses of water, two cocktails, and two appetizers; however, our server did pace our meal and I greatly appreciate that (Thanks Darren!). Throughout the service, our waiter was present and I had no problems with the prebussing. We didn't feel rushed and they didn't try to take away plates before we were absolutely finished. We started with the lobster mac and cheese and grilled squid. The grilled squid is absolutely delicious - it was tender and not chewy - it came with potatoes and a sauce I thoroughly enjoyed. As for the lobster mac and cheese, it was unmemorable. It disproportionate amount of lobster throughout. For our entrees, we got their herb branzino and some truffle parm fries. The branzino was delicious! It was lightly sauteed and came with seasoned rice and veggies (again, the sauce was so freakin good).  As for the fries, you can never go wrong with them. At the end of the meal, we got the ONE HIT cake - the name will make sense when you get it. The bourbon sauce made it for me and I would definitely get it again. By the way, you'll probably want to record the presentation. Overall, we enjoyed the food.  TL;DR: Cute entrance, loud ambiance, signature drinks were delicious, avoid the lobster mac and cheese, and get that ONE HIT cake.

_9HLvT9UNKI9JL698qlqPw.text: The outside of the restaurant is definitely pretty. Good for pictures. I went with my bf and we got a table for two. It's a very small table on a long couch area. There was a very nice couple next to us and we even made small talk (that's how close the tables are next to each other).  If you don't like the small space, maybe go with a larger party because there seemed to be more bigger isolated tables. Music is pretty loud but not club loud.  they played hip hop mostly.   Food: it's good but It wasn't  mind blowingly good. I could probably find cheaper and at par tasting/better food elsewhere. I do know it's the strip and it's just expected to be expensive. Sushi was just alright to me. Had the truffle sashimi and catch roll. It's good quality sushi, just basic. I did like the mushroom spaghetti and the hit me chocolate cake. Although most of the allure of the cake was that I got to hit it.   My boyfriend got the dorade fish. That was pretty good.   I did like the cocktails. If you're like me, and you don't like it too strong and you want it to taste good. I got the pineapple something.  Service was also just okay. The server was nice but it had a very casual, hurried vibe to it. Not a fine dining feel at all.   But yeah, if you are looking at the other reviews you can tell there's a mix of really good and really bad, and I think it's in the middle, kind of eh. Plus we spent $200 for eh, so prolly not coming back.

59J7cq65UNMxDfMSJZpeOw.text: Worst experience for a Catch restaurant. First of all, they are way overbooked for the square footage. At a table of two, you're sitting basically bar style right next to other couples, whereas some four tops are sat for two people...how is that fair? LOL. Then come to see that half the restaurant isn't full, and yet you STILL can't hear each other. We sat around for 10 minutes before ever seeing a waiter, and the food was sub-par. I'd say it's about 35% of Catch in LA. As frequenters of Vegas and sushi lovers, there's no reason to come back.

OByQubAqy4ehB-YNSU53kw.text: The food and our waitress is a definite 5 star, but the hostesses are a definite 1 star (that 1 star is actually generous). I would give this place a 5 star, but I'm knocking a star off due to the unfriendly hostesses. We had to wait over 30 minutes after our reservation time without the hostesses informing us how long the wait will be. After 30 minutes wait, I asked the hostess again how far along we'll have to wait, and she said they're cleaning our table. So we decided to grab a drink at the bar and wait for the remaining time; which is another 10 mins. If we knew we had to wait over 30 minutes after our reservation time, we would've grabbed drinks from the start instead of dilly dally there and thought we'll be seated soon. The food is great, even though a bit pricy, but it's Vegas. Would I come back? I would have to say 50/50, because I don't really wanna deal with those arrogant hostesses. Plus, it's Vegas, not that hard to find good food.

k_VM2AJ4lFk4N2cIyX9Btw.text: Our waiter - David H - told our birthday girl "well because none of your guest can decide on a dessert - I guess I will give you some free cookies" - we had a 10 person table top and did drinks and dinner - for this waiter to be this rude to the person we all came to celebrate is completely unacceptable unprofessional and my only hope is that this review causes Catch to respond and take action in regards to this issue. I plan on calling tomorrow to speak to a manager about this situation - this is not ok.  - be careful where you spend your money in Vegas -

5SdnErur3Fr1zpPmQQumyA.text: The flower walkway up to the hostess stand instantly removes you from the business of Vegas. Until you enter the restaurant. The decorated bird cages and tree in the middle of the eating area are esthetically pleasing. Lively atmosphere with a great playlist. Noise level high. A lot of people talking over the music and their neighbors. The food was delicious. The spicy grilled octopus is a must! The lobster mash wasn't what i expected. The taste, color and consistency reminded me of lobster bisque poured into mashed potatoes. I did not eat all of my red snapper because I filled up in the octopus (yummy). The wine selection is impressive. There is a Coravin wine selection! First time I've seen that on a menu. The pistachio cheese cake was ok. A little overkill on the pistachio (and I eat pistachios regularly). It is not an inexpensive dining experience; I knew that prior to making reservation. I recommend for food and wine selection. My night wasn't star worthy for a return visit.

LJFfF1lfXo0FvRS5WCDTZw.text: We were recently in Vegas for the 4th of July week, and were intrigued by the beautiful floral entrance to Catch Restaurant.  We were excited to try it...  When we arrived we waited for a bit, even with reservation and when seated , we were at a small end table where I was sitting at the end of the bench seat which was very uncomfortable. The waitress was very unhelpful as far as recommendations, and seemed rushed. We literally there for under 20 MINUTES from drink to appetizer to dinner!!! The table next to us was very close so we didn't have much privacy. Food good, but felt like I was in a fast food restaurant. Not to mention the waitress brought our side vegetable dish when we were almost done with our entree. We sent it back. Extremely disappointing evening- that is a very short evening!!!  Would not recommend Catch until they work on their service and seating arrangements.

t8-oGHbjSYFerXc8YFB2DA.text: Our server completely ruined my experience. After greeting us, he kept us waiting for a half hour. The part that bothers me the most, is that he didn't own his mistake. He was very matter of fact and blamed us because he said we were still looking at the menu. He didn't even try sell the menu. I had to ask him about the specials. To top all of that off, I was there to celebrate my birthday and he brings out a dessert that said Happy Anniversary on it instead of Happy Birthday. At that point, I asked to see the manager. The manager did not do enough to make it right. He basically offered to bring another dessert out. I told him no, but he brought it out anyway. It was too late. The experience was ruined. Even though the food was good, I'll never be back and I will not recommend it to my friends.

YrRFE591eM2VLTAMt0Mugg.text: Great birthday celebration at Catch! The manager came to our table and made sure we were taken care of. Even made us a special drink himself. Our party of 16 enjoyed ourselves thoroughly!

CyqaVp3hRK7xdeaTpsLSmw.text: Disappointing experience. Went with 3 friends to celebrate two special birthdays and noted this on the reservation in advance and when we chkd in. There was no acknowledgement and the service in general was poor, rude and arrogant. The food was good but overpriced for what we got. I have been to the Catch in Playa del Carmen and it was a much better experience. So many better options in Vegas, skip this one.

Ei3xHh1RpZ5Um3M6eRAESw.text: Believe the bad reviews about the hostesses, especially the Asian lady who oversees the seating arrangements. She's arrogant, lies, and has a snobbish attitude.  The floor manager (in town from NYC to train the staff) is worse. Saving grace: a young, female brunette manager who 1) told the truth about their discriminating seating arrangement (the male manager and Asian lady sarcastically lied even after I asked if it's because we weren't all white-since the 4 tables seated were all white-or we didn't have the right look), 2) was gracious about the unpublicized policy, and 3) offered to book us elsewhere or seat us in the back away from viewing eyes. We accepted the truth and quietly left. It's great if you have the right look, since they'll fill the main area with your group first. If you're not privileged or come with the wrong baggage (as we did so to speak), expect to be treated like second-class people and spoken down to loudly. Yep. No joke. No exaggeration.   Ambiance: one of the best ambience in Vegas.   Truth is, they're so popular they don't need people like us. Period.

XrQzd5xHD7tCfufSYUptcg.text: This is one of my new favorite place in Vegas. Food is amazing, loved tuna crispy cake and my branzino. Staff super nice, on top of that the atmosphere is amazing. Definitely coming back again

photos.caption: Photo of CATCH - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XMC_sTYoN81mnt3jIJak6w.text: What an amazing experience. We had a 8pm reservation and were sat immediately. Once at the table, it seemed like we were VIP guest. Dave, our server, was the best. So knowledgeable of the menu, and gave us incredible suggestions on what to eat. To the chef and his staff, it was beyond the most delicious food.  To the management, it is so nice to see such smoothly ran world class establishment. It is very impressive to see the restaurant at capacity and you all still taking the time to make it a personable experience for your customers.  When in Vegas again, we will be making another reservation for sure. Thank you for a memorable experience.

MjgmeQ8cjhDUwy9YIzrpkg.text: Very pretty restaurant.  Also, very loud.  And, also rather late in their seating of those with reservations...lots of groups were complaining...over 30 min waits. Delicious food.  All the sashimi and seafood appetizers tasted very fresh. The snapper, dorade, branzino, and cantonese lobster entrees were delicious.  Great ending was the donut wonder wheel...perfect size for our party of six to end with a little something sweet.

UlXjbKljF3IFFO5u9VvkhQ.text: Such a Beautiful restaurant. If you have reservations go a little early because the entrance it Instagram worthy! Our server Ed was very attentive and the Hit me cake is a must have!

STkZWAZHx55Bjku9TVWJEg.text: Service sucked. Waiter forgot 2 of our dishes. Crispy chicken was bland. Avoid this and just go to nobu. For the price it is exceptionally overrated.

GJjfDHMJV6WBm0cnlwj5lg.text: The entrance is gorgeous! Make sure you snap a pic in their tunnel! Now onto the food.. I went to their first night open (service was quite confused so I held off on my review until I've been back a few more times), the service is way better now, not 100% but the servers are all very nice. The food is just eh to me. There's nothing spectacular about it (it's quite similar to the Catch in LA). Come more for the ambiance moreso than the food.

N2qQ4n6Yuxp0SqalxTzhgg.text: This was a fabulous meal. Lots of appetizers to share. Cold appetizers sashimi with truffle & caviar, spicy tuna roll to hot appetizers Crunchy shrimp (rock shrimp),scallops gnocchi , Brussels sprouts (toasted) , grilled octopus. Each dish was better than the next. Loved the food and the Atmosphere too.

3R7sG6Hov1vNT3mYH-V_cw.text: My wife and I visited Catch a few weeks ago. The decor is incredible, lots of instagrammable photo areas. Be sure to ask for Steven H at the bar. Great bartender, great service. Food was great, really expensive prices but definitely worth it for a special occasion. I will be visiting again.

NTrR-fNQRslPVYdGM8ULew.text: Star studded... hot girls packed to the brim. Catch Is THE place to be on any night of the week. The food ain't too shabby either, especially the truffle sashimi and Wagyu Tomahawk. The service still has a few kinks to work out but it's so busy on a Thursday night; I don't blame them. Go, see, experience.

mN0D3AdQ3DGO3AhJsigB3g.text: Great Service, good food but a little overrated. Seafood is very fresh, especially the sashimi style appetizers.

NiJYoihgUwrueTv6VihKiQ.text: Ate there a couple days ago. The staff were great and friendlier than I expected. If you're going to spend a shit load of money on food go somewhere else! The King crab had an after taste of Ammonia. Also, the lobster Mac n Cheese had a strange after taste. The best thing was the sushi i forgot which one  The best places to eat are off the strip.

I_zNksCRvW86bjqVGh4WJA.text: Phenomenal service, food and atmosphere.  Accessible and friendly service.  Ask for Nori or Ed's station! Two nights in a row...memorable! New favorite!

7OhCl30fyd65_0sdbd3paQ.text: First impression: ambiance was amazing. Just how I expected it to be, did not disappoint. We went opening weekend with a large group. It was extremely busy!   Food: AMAZING. Every dish that we tried (which was a lot) was outstanding. We enjoyed sushi, sashimi, truffle fries, a pasta dish, and an amazing brownie "hit me" dessert.  Service: Service lacked a little, but as I said it was extremely busy and for the first weekend being open I'm sure the servers were highly stressed. They were extremely polite and knowledgeable, just took a while to get cocktails on the table.   Overall: great restaurant for a fancy date night. Loud music for a great vibe. Definitely will be going back.

KNAN7Ahr7rKqfiQCLT4MXA.text: I was so excited to celebrate my birthday at Catch because of the ambiance and decor.  I made my reservation back in November  for January. I went to the restaurant  a few weeks after making the  reservation and asked the hostess if I could add to my party. She confirmed the change from seven people to ten. The day of my reservation I was running 5mins late so I called to inform the restaurant and had my friend at the restaurant  check the party in. Upon arriving my friend was told there was no reservation.We then showed the  hostess the screenshot of the confirmation of the reservation and suddenly we have reservation now. The hostess states it's only for seven people. I inform her that I physically  came to restaurant more than a month prior to change that.  Suddenly some woman interjects our conversation stating something about 8 o'clock. I did not want to wait two hours for a reservation made for 6:00 p.m. Then the woman seamed frustrated and stated she can accommodate us,  but we  have to be done by 8:00 p.m . I agreed to her terms and we wait to be seated. Our waiter was friendly and provided great service. The food arrived in a timely manner. We were done with dinner within the time they allotted us. The next day I woke up with an  upset stomach and was sick as well as 4 other people  from my party that shared the sushi dishes. In conclusion my experience wasn't that  great  since they  claimed there was  no reservation  and then ended up getting sick and making my friends sick. We spent too much money for the experience we had and only to pay the price of food poisoning.

HJ-RTbPAflcV-GJ7Bbs0Rg.text: Me and my Boyfriend we're celebrating & thought we would try this new place, I was very pleased to find that they have 3 Vegan options on the menu. & I have the sweet potato gnocchi was AMAZING !!!! I also had the Watermelon felon cocktail which was super tasty and refreshing & Our Bartender Jason made our experience so much fun! It's so hard to find great service now a days  in the bar industry! This was one to remember

cZ1U7YsxRnPbZThGxSffgw.text: Catch is a great new addition to the Aria Hotel.  It is one of the more popular up and coming restaurants in the bigger cities, so the hype naturally makes it more popular in the Vegas scene.  The location of the restaurant is easily accessible through the main entrance of the Aria valet/lobby, the access through Crystals is also an easy walk across. As you walk in to the restaurant you will see a long "hallway" type entrance with lots of photo ops, and will bump into guests taking lots of pictures as they wait. We had dinner reservations at 7:30, but were not seated until 8-8:15. There is a bar where guests can wait, but can be a bit frustrating to wait so long if you are starving. The service after being seated was great, our waiter was knowledgeable in the menu and very nice.  We were with a party of 6, and most items came out great.  We had also ordered the rice cakes, which never showed up, but no big deal we were already full by this point. The chocolate dessert is delicious - a definite try.

4pIdag98c257Kagufp-Qqg.text: I'll only come back if they bring back cookie dough spring rolls. And everyone that comes to town... I'll send them elsewhere until then.

pDdZ3MwOJYOPQsXMSFZLIw.text: What can I say... my party of 6 were all extremely blown away. Not just by our server, Ed... but by the entire experience. The food was on point, the food was beyond our expectations, the presentation blew us way and the atmosphere/vibe took the cake! Thank you Ed for completing our evening and making this experience that much more enjoyable. Highly recommend for a great night out, phenomenal food and awesome old school sounds!

GSpeHc5zOrwuIiHcaQdWZA.text: Amazing dining experience !  Staying at Aria and didn't plan stopping in-  so glad we did as the meal, the space, the staff, ALL FIVE STAR!  It's no secret that Las Vegas Strip dining prices can give one sticker  shock- it's double disappointing when there is not enough food to feel full after.  Not here- the prices were normal for the Strip but the portions were much more than expected - nice sized portions and beautifully plated with very  little waiting time the servers made us feel welcome and checked In Frequently enough but not over bearing.  My swordfish was the BEST I ve ever eaten.  The truffle fries out of this world with a vegan aioli !  Don"t even think of missing the Hellfire sushi roll as an appetizer! We ate in the bar and the atmosphere was fun, social, energetic, not over crowded or loud.  This is a top stop and this local will definitely be back

x11Sjpy0170K3OhccolHjQ.text: Amazing Food! Beautiful presentation! Ed was phenomenal!!

YtntNrKX9jbLkTXuV7jLqw.text: Huge disappointment. Made dinner reservations for my husband and I to celebrate our 2nd wedding anniversary. Our reservation was at 9:45 and we weren't seated until 11:15pm, only because we had to ask them twice to not forget about us while we patiently sat in the bar waiting forever. After they finally sat us down we immediately started ordering since we were starving and the 2 things on the menu that we were most excited to try, they had "run out of".  So we ordered some other things and we thought the food was just ok. Definitely not worth the hour and a half wait. The eating area is very crowded and loud. Our server was nice and professional but never once acknowledged our anniversary even though I stated in our reservation that's what we were celebrating. I used the restroom before we left and the stalls were out of toilet paper and both trash cans were completely over flowing. Definitely not the experience we were expecting or was hoping for and we wish we had gone somewhere else. The only thing we liked was the entry way.

ZGJ0jyqDYm-bh-LzK-GEPg.text: Great ambiance. We had a 7:45pm reservation. Upon arrival we were told it would be 20 minutes. 1 hour later we were escorted to our "table" which was a bar top in the bar, not the dining room, and was smaller than the area we had been sitting at in the full bar. We were constantly bumped in to and service was extremely slow. Food portions were tiny and took over an hour to arrive to our table. We made two complaints and nothing was done to try and accommodate us. We were so excited to try this that we cancelled our reservation at another highly regarded restaurant. Big mistake.

De3gwnNncK77JQYcPgY_Sw.text: Bad service-  hard to get a table without attitude. very strange servers!No go... Food may not be bad but the experience is not worth it.

IIQuFrQLwPh_hvxg_FjzTA.text: Don't waste your time or money.  1-Hostesses are rude and pretentious.  2-Had reservation for 4, but they made us stand and wait in the bar for 30 min.  3-music is so loud in bar and restaurant that you cannot carry on a conversation.  4-once we were seated, they served us tap water in a nice carafe bottle that was awful.  5-we waited 10 minutes for our waiter (Steven) to come back to take our drink order.  6-when we ordered our meal, we asked our waiter to bring out our appetizer first.  He said all the food comes out of 3 kitchens randomly.  7-One person in our party was served first, 15 minutes before the next plate came to our our table.  8-the 4th person in our party was served their meal as the rest of us were finishing ours.  9-the waiter even forgot to put in one of our side order (which they took off the bill). How nice.  10-the food was bland and flavorless, as well as overpriced for what you received.  11-our waiter struggled for 10 minutes at the computer trying to figure out how to split out bill between two cards.  STAY AWAY

3qXni8wnyPZx36jkvurJTA.text: We do not recommend!  The waiter was in such a rush, he didn't want to answer any questions. He was rude and dismissive. We left before ordering! This was recommend by Marriott Grand Chateau resort and we will let them know how we we're treated. I never expected to be treated at an upscale restaurant. #catch #lasvegas

9PO980ySV8Ba6GiyG2YcfQ.text: I had such a bad experience! The food was good but it took so longgg to get the food. We literally waited 10-15 minutes between each dish and that's not all. After I paid I asked for my credit card back, which was claimed to be returned by the waiter. I left the restaurant after insisting I didn't receive my card back and the waiter had hardly bothered to check for me and insisted he already gave it to me. I had only that card with, which mad an issue to release my car from the valet. Also, a day after, still without finding my card, I called the restaurant again describing the incident and someone was kind enough to really search for it. After 10 minutes of waiting on the line-what a surprise- it was found!! I came to pick up the card and was juggled between security and the cage-I felt frustrated!! By the time my card was found and returned to me my car was towed! Great finale for a 'great' experience. If you want to contact me, this is my #7029315887

cg1JSQgFPzLogE11c9FE1Q.text: The entry way is amazing, the food is good, and the service is fine but the place is very loud. Sometimes couldn't even hear what the other person was saying.

UdB_G7uc-AKYK5D_nCs0SA.text: No complaints. Amazing everything. Would come back specifically for Marcus at the bar. He's absolutely stellar. UNREAL drinks!

ChXuhJUtkMn_zOBiN5KXsg.text: I am not one to leave reviews but I feel that this one is needed. I was as in Vegas over the weekend and had a 10:30PM reservation for a group of 4 on Saturday night. I called earlier that morning letting the host know it was for a birthday - the host did a great job asking details on the birthday girl and let us know they would bring out a dessert. When I got to the restaurant at 10:15PM I was notified that our table was not ready (we were early so that is ok) and the host again reiterated that it was for a birthday, asking the name of the guest and confirming they would do something. We came back at 10:30PM to  get seated and was told our table wasn't ready yet and we were directed into the bar. Wasn't a big deal but then it took over 15 minutes to get a drink and we didn't get seated till after 11PM - having to go back multiple times to check with the host. I believe we got seated at 11:05ish. Food was great as were the cocktails. However, we asked our server when the birthday girl was away in the restroom what we would be doing for her bday. He said Catch does not do anything. We told him of the conversations we had earlier and nothing. We stepped away and went back to the host stand and was told the same thing. Was a total disappointment and somewhat embarassing for our birthday girl. Not once did anyone notify and manager nor did anyone stop and check on in us. Our dinner was over $400 for 4 people, not counting what we spent at the bar previously.   Disappointing dinner and would not recommend due to the poor customer service.

VDD9xQ5Mb94Mylf33WcyZg.text: We read all of the reviews and were a little uncertain about trying Catch. I am happy to report that our experience was great!  We were seated at the time of our reservation without a wait. Our server Nina was very attentive, answering all of our questions and even recording our dietary restrictions on her note pad. We asked about sake and they called over the"Somm". She recommended a sake we hadn't tried and it fit our taste to a tee. As everyone says, the food is great if a little pricey but this is Vegas after all. It was also beautifully presented. I would totally recommend trying Catch.

ONpiw9Wz-d34znJCSgVkfw.text: I could not have been more disappointed, unfortunately. Every year we try to pick a new top of the line restaurant to try for our annual Vegas trip. The two starts are for the food solely. The atmosphere is amazing, the venue is gorgeous but the service ruined it all. We had the main table in the restaurant for 13 people, we ordered bottles of wine, hundreds of dollars worth of food, and not once was our water topped, not once were we offered more bottles of wine, our food did not come out together. We had to speak to the manager, we would have easily spent more money there however our waiter was not at our table at all. When it came time to check out, she had forgotten to charge us a bottle of wine and failed to take off an appetizer they were going to comp due to it coming out AFTER THE MEAL. We had a table at a club which we were an hour late for due to the waiter taking over 45 minutes to bring us our check after paying. All in all, no matter how good the food was or how beautiful the venue, I would not recommend spending the money for this kind of service.
